content: 1 The prophecies of Isaiah son of Amoz, who prophesied concerning Judah and Jerusalem in the reigns of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah.
content_old: 1 The prophecies of Isaiah son of Amoz, who prophesied concerning Judah and Jerusalem in the reigns of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah.

content: 2 Hear, O heavens, and give ear, O earth, For the LORD has spoken: “I reared children and brought them up— And they have rebelled against Me!
content_old: 2 Hear, O heavens, and give ear, O earth, For the LORD has spoken: “I reared children and brought them up— And they have rebelled against Me!

content: 3 An ox knows its owner, An ass its master’s crib: Israel does not know, My people takes no thought.”
content_old: 3 An ox knows its owner, An ass its master’s crib: Israel does not know, My people takes no thought.”

content: 4 Ah, sinful nation! People laden with iniquity! Brood of evildoers! Depraved children! They have forsaken the LORD, Spurned the Holy One of Israel, Turned their backs .
content_old: 4 Ah, sinful nation! People laden with iniquity! Brood of evildoers! Depraved children! They have forsaken the LORD, Spurned the Holy One of Israel, Turned their backs .

content: 5 Why do you seek further beatings, That you continue to offend? Every head is ailing, And every heart is sick.
content_old: 5 Why do you seek further beatings, That you continue to offend? Every head is ailing, And every heart is sick.

content: 6 From head to foot No spot is sound: All bruises, and welts, And festering sores— Not pressed out, not bound up, Not softened with oil.
content_old: 6 From head to foot No spot is sound: All bruises, and welts, And festering sores— Not pressed out, not bound up, Not softened with oil.

content: 7 Your land is a waste, Your cities burnt down; Before your eyes, the yield of your soil Is consumed by strangers— A wasteland as overthrown by strangers!
content_old: 7 Your land is a waste, Your cities burnt down; Before your eyes, the yield of your soil Is consumed by strangers— A wasteland as overthrown by strangers!

content: 8 Fair Zion is left Like a booth in a vineyard, Like a hut in a cucumber field, Like a city beleaguered.
content_old: 8 Fair Zion is left Like a booth in a vineyard, Like a hut in a cucumber field, Like a city beleaguered.

content: 9 Had not the LORD of Hosts Left us some survivors, We should be like Sodom, Another Gomorrah.
content_old: 9 Had not the LORD of Hosts Left us some survivors, We should be like Sodom, Another Gomorrah.

content: 10 Hear the word of the LORD, You chieftains of Sodom; Give ear to our God’s instruction, You folk of Gomorrah!
content_old: 10 Hear the word of the LORD, You chieftains of Sodom; Give ear to our God’s instruction, You folk of Gomorrah!

content: 11 “What need have I of all your sacrifices?” Says the LORD. “I am sated with burnt offerings of rams, And suet of fatlings, And blood of bulls; And I have no delight In lambs and he-goats.
content_old: 11 “What need have I of all your sacrifices?” Says the LORD. “I am sated with burnt offerings of rams, And suet of fatlings, And blood of bulls; And I have no delight In lambs and he-goats.

content: 12 That you come to appear before Me— Who asked that of you? Trample My courts
content_old: 12 That you come to appear before Me— Who asked that of you? Trample My courts

content: 13 no more; Bringing oblations is futile, Incense is offensive to Me. New moon and sabbath, Proclaiming of solemnities, Assemblies with iniquity, I cannot abide.
content_old: 13 no more; Bringing oblations is futile, Incense is offensive to Me. New moon and sabbath, Proclaiming of solemnities, Assemblies with iniquity, I cannot abide.

content: 14 Your new moons and fixed seasons Fill Me with loathing; They are become a burden to Me, I cannot endure them.
content_old: 14 Your new moons and fixed seasons Fill Me with loathing; They are become a burden to Me, I cannot endure them.

content: 15 And when you lift up your hands, I will turn My eyes away from you; Though you pray at length, I will not listen. Your hands are stained with crime—
content_old: 15 And when you lift up your hands, I will turn My eyes away from you; Though you pray at length, I will not listen. Your hands are stained with crime—

content: 16 Wash yourselves clean; Put your evil doings Away from My sight. Cease to do evil;
content_old: 16 Wash yourselves clean; Put your evil doings Away from My sight. Cease to do evil;

content: 17 Learn to do good. Devote yourselves to justice; Aid the wronged. Uphold the rights of the orphan; Defend the cause of the widow.
content_old: 17 Learn to do good. Devote yourselves to justice; Aid the wronged. Uphold the rights of the orphan; Defend the cause of the widow.

content: 18 “Come, let us reach an understanding, —says the LORD. Be your sins like crimson, They can turn snow-white; Be they red as dyed wool, They can become like fleece.”
content_old: 18 “Come, let us reach an understanding, —says the LORD. Be your sins like crimson, They can turn snow-white; Be they red as dyed wool, They can become like fleece.”

content: 19 If, then, you agree and give heed, You will eat the good things of the earth;
content_old: 19 If, then, you agree and give heed, You will eat the good things of the earth;

content: 20 But if you refuse and disobey, You will be devoured by the sword.— For it was the LORD who spoke.
content_old: 20 But if you refuse and disobey, You will be devoured by the sword.— For it was the LORD who spoke.

content: 21 Alas, she has become a harlot, The faithful city That was filled with justice, Where righteousness dwelt— But now murderers.
content_old: 21 Alas, she has become a harlot, The faithful city That was filled with justice, Where righteousness dwelt— But now murderers.

content: 22 Your silver has turned to dross; Your wine is cut with water.
content_old: 22 Your silver has turned to dross; Your wine is cut with water.

content: 23 Your rulers are rogues And cronies of thieves, Every one avid for presents And greedy for gifts; They do not judge the case of the orphan, And the widow’s cause never reaches them.
content_old: 23 Your rulers are rogues And cronies of thieves, Every one avid for presents And greedy for gifts; They do not judge the case of the orphan, And the widow’s cause never reaches them.

content: 24 Assuredly, this is the declaration Of the Sovereign, the LORD of Hosts, The Mighty One of Israel: “Ah, I will get satisfaction from My foes; I will wreak vengeance on My enemies!
content_old: 24 Assuredly, this is the declaration Of the Sovereign, the LORD of Hosts, The Mighty One of Israel: “Ah, I will get satisfaction from My foes; I will wreak vengeance on My enemies!

content: 25 I will turn My hand against you, And smelt out your dross as with lye, And remove all your slag:
content_old: 25 I will turn My hand against you, And smelt out your dross as with lye, And remove all your slag:

content: 26 I will restore your magistrates as of old, And your counselors as of yore. After that you shall be called City of Righteousness, Faithful City.”
content_old: 26 I will restore your magistrates as of old, And your counselors as of yore. After that you shall be called City of Righteousness, Faithful City.”

content: 27 Zion shall be saved in the judgment; Her repentant ones, in the retribution.
content_old: 27 Zion shall be saved in the judgment; Her repentant ones, in the retribution.

content: 28 But rebels and sinners shall all be crushed, And those who forsake the LORD shall perish.
content_old: 28 But rebels and sinners shall all be crushed, And those who forsake the LORD shall perish.

content: 29 Truly, you shall be shamed Because of the terebinths you desired, And you shall be confounded Because of the gardens you coveted.
content_old: 29 Truly, you shall be shamed Because of the terebinths you desired, And you shall be confounded Because of the gardens you coveted.

content: 30 For you shall be like a terebinth Wilted of leaf, And like a garden That has no water,
content_old: 30 For you shall be like a terebinth Wilted of leaf, And like a garden That has no water,

content: 1 The word that Isaiah son of Amoz prophesied concerning Judah and Jerusalem.
content_old: 1 The word that Isaiah son of Amoz prophesied concerning Judah and Jerusalem.

content: 2 In the days to come, The Mount of the LORD’s House Shall stand firm above the mountains And tower above the hills; And all the nations Shall gaze on it with joy.
content_old: 2 In the days to come, The Mount of the LORD’s House Shall stand firm above the mountains And tower above the hills; And all the nations Shall gaze on it with joy.

content: 3 And the many peoples shall go and say: “Come, Let us go up to the Mount of the LORD, To the House of the God of Jacob; That He may instruct us in His ways, And that we may walk in His paths.” For instruction shall come forth from Zion, The word of the LORD from Jerusalem.
content_old: 3 And the many peoples shall go and say: “Come, Let us go up to the Mount of the LORD, To the House of the God of Jacob; That He may instruct us in His ways, And that we may walk in His paths.” For instruction shall come forth from Zion, The word of the LORD from Jerusalem.

content: 4 Thus He will judge among the nations And arbitrate for the many peoples, And they shall beat their swords into plowshares And their spears into pruning hooks: Nation shall not take up Sword against nation; They shall never again know war.
content_old: 4 Thus He will judge among the nations And arbitrate for the many peoples, And they shall beat their swords into plowshares And their spears into pruning hooks: Nation shall not take up Sword against nation; They shall never again know war.

content: 5 O House of Jacob! Come, let us walk By the light of the LORD.
content_old: 5 O House of Jacob! Come, let us walk By the light of the LORD.

content: 6 For you have forsaken the ways of your people, O House of Jacob! For they are full from the East, And of soothsaying like the Philistines; They abound in customs of the aliens.
content_old: 6 For you have forsaken the ways of your people, O House of Jacob! For they are full from the East, And of soothsaying like the Philistines; They abound in customs of the aliens.

content: 7 Their land is full of silver and gold, There is no limit to their treasures; Their land is full of horses, There is no limit to their chariots.
content_old: 7 Their land is full of silver and gold, There is no limit to their treasures; Their land is full of horses, There is no limit to their chariots.

content: 8 And their land is full of idols; They bow down to the work of their hands, To what their own fingers have wrought.
content_old: 8 And their land is full of idols; They bow down to the work of their hands, To what their own fingers have wrought.

content: 9 But man shall be humbled, And mortal brought low— Oh, do not forgive them!
content_old: 9 But man shall be humbled, And mortal brought low— Oh, do not forgive them!

content: 10 Go deep into the rock, Bury yourselves in the ground, Before the terror of the LORD And His dread majesty!
content_old: 10 Go deep into the rock, Bury yourselves in the ground, Before the terror of the LORD And His dread majesty!

content: 11 Man’s haughty look shall be brought low, And the pride of mortals shall be humbled. None but the LORD shall be Exalted in that day.
content_old: 11 Man’s haughty look shall be brought low, And the pride of mortals shall be humbled. None but the LORD shall be Exalted in that day.

content: 12 For the LORD of Hosts has ready a day Against all that is proud and arrogant, Against all that is lofty—so that it is brought low:
content_old: 12 For the LORD of Hosts has ready a day Against all that is proud and arrogant, Against all that is lofty—so that it is brought low:

content: 13 Against all the cedars of Lebanon, Tall and stately, And all the oaks of Bashan;
content_old: 13 Against all the cedars of Lebanon, Tall and stately, And all the oaks of Bashan;

content: 14 Against all the high mountains And all the lofty hills;
content_old: 14 Against all the high mountains And all the lofty hills;

content: 15 Against every soaring tower And every mighty wall;
content_old: 15 Against every soaring tower And every mighty wall;

content: 16 Against all the ships of Tarshish And all the gallant barks.
content_old: 16 Against all the ships of Tarshish And all the gallant barks.

content: 17 Then man’s haughtiness shall be humbled And the pride of man brought low. None but the LORD shall be Exalted in that day.
content_old: 17 Then man’s haughtiness shall be humbled And the pride of man brought low. None but the LORD shall be Exalted in that day.

content: 18 As for idols, they shall vanish completely.
content_old: 18 As for idols, they shall vanish completely.

content: 19 And men shall enter caverns in the rock And hollows in the ground— Before the terror of the LORD And His dread majesty, When He comes forth to overawe the earth.
content_old: 19 And men shall enter caverns in the rock And hollows in the ground— Before the terror of the LORD And His dread majesty, When He comes forth to overawe the earth.

content: 20 On that day, men shall fling away, To the flying foxes and the bats, The idols of silver And the idols of gold Which they made for worshiping.
content_old: 20 On that day, men shall fling away, To the flying foxes and the bats, The idols of silver And the idols of gold Which they made for worshiping.

content: 21 And they shall enter the clefts in the rocks And the crevices in the cliffs, Before the terror of the LORD And His dread majesty, When He comes forth to overawe the earth.
content_old: 21 And they shall enter the clefts in the rocks And the crevices in the cliffs, Before the terror of the LORD And His dread majesty, When He comes forth to overawe the earth.

content: 1 For lo! The Sovereign LORD of Hosts Will remove from Jerusalem and from Judah Prop and stay, Every prop of food And every prop of water:
content_old: 1 For lo! The Sovereign LORD of Hosts Will remove from Jerusalem and from Judah Prop and stay, Every prop of food And every prop of water:

content: 2 Soldier and warrior, Magistrate and prophet, Augur and elder;
content_old: 2 Soldier and warrior, Magistrate and prophet, Augur and elder;

content: 3 Captain of fifty, Magnate and counselor, Skilled artisan and expert enchanter;
content_old: 3 Captain of fifty, Magnate and counselor, Skilled artisan and expert enchanter;

content: 4 And He will make boys their rulers, And babes shall govern them.
content_old: 4 And He will make boys their rulers, And babes shall govern them.

content: 5 So the people shall oppress one another— Each oppressing his fellow: The young shall bully the old; And the despised the honored.
content_old: 5 So the people shall oppress one another— Each oppressing his fellow: The young shall bully the old; And the despised the honored.

content: 6 For should a man seize his brother, In whose father’s house there is clothing: “Come, be a chief over us, And let this ruin be under your care,”
content_old: 6 For should a man seize his brother, In whose father’s house there is clothing: “Come, be a chief over us, And let this ruin be under your care,”

content: 7 The other will thereupon protest, “I will not be a dresser of wounds, With no food or clothing in my own house. You shall not make me chief of a people!”
content_old: 7 The other will thereupon protest, “I will not be a dresser of wounds, With no food or clothing in my own house. You shall not make me chief of a people!”

content: 8 Ah, Jerusalem has stumbled, And Judah has fallen, Because by word and deed They insult the LORD, Defying His majestic glance.
content_old: 8 Ah, Jerusalem has stumbled, And Judah has fallen, Because by word and deed They insult the LORD, Defying His majestic glance.

content: 9 Their partiality in judgment accuses them; They avow their sins like Sodom, They do not conceal them. Woe to them! For ill Have they served themselves.
content_old: 9 Their partiality in judgment accuses them; They avow their sins like Sodom, They do not conceal them. Woe to them! For ill Have they served themselves.

content: 10 Hail the just man, for he shall fare well; He shall eat the fruit of his works.
content_old: 10 Hail the just man, for he shall fare well; He shall eat the fruit of his works.

content: 11 Woe to the wicked man, for he shall fare ill; As his hands have dealt, so shall it be done to him.
content_old: 11 Woe to the wicked man, for he shall fare ill; As his hands have dealt, so shall it be done to him.

content: 12 My people’s rulers are babes, It is governed by women. O my people! Your leaders are misleaders; They have confused the course of your paths.
content_old: 12 My people’s rulers are babes, It is governed by women. O my people! Your leaders are misleaders; They have confused the course of your paths.

content: 13 The LORD stands up to plead a cause, He rises to champion peoples.
content_old: 13 The LORD stands up to plead a cause, He rises to champion peoples.

content: 14 The LORD will bring this charge Against the elders and officers of His people: “It is you who have ravaged the vineyard; That which was robbed from the poor is in your houses.
content_old: 14 The LORD will bring this charge Against the elders and officers of His people: “It is you who have ravaged the vineyard; That which was robbed from the poor is in your houses.

content: 15 How dare you crush My people And grind the faces of the poor?” —says my Lord GOD of Hosts.
content_old: 15 How dare you crush My people And grind the faces of the poor?” —says my Lord GOD of Hosts.

content: 16 The LORD said: “Because the daughters of Zion Are so vain And walk with heads thrown back, With roving eyes, And with mincing gait, Making a tinkling with their feet”—
content_old: 16 The LORD said: “Because the daughters of Zion Are so vain And walk with heads thrown back, With roving eyes, And with mincing gait, Making a tinkling with their feet”—

content: 17 My Lord will bare the pates Of the daughters of Zion, The LORD will uncover their heads.
content_old: 17 My Lord will bare the pates Of the daughters of Zion, The LORD will uncover their heads.

content: 18 In that day, my LORD will strip off the finery of the anklets, the fillets, and the crescents;
content_old: 18 In that day, my LORD will strip off the finery of the anklets, the fillets, and the crescents;

content: 19 of the eardrops, the bracelets, and the veils;
content_old: 19 of the eardrops, the bracelets, and the veils;

content: 20 the turbans, the armlets, and the sashes; of the talismans and the amulets;
content_old: 20 the turbans, the armlets, and the sashes; of the talismans and the amulets;

content: 21 the signet rings and the nose rings;
content_old: 21 the signet rings and the nose rings;

content: 22 of the festive robes, the mantles, and the shawls; the purses,
content_old: 22 of the festive robes, the mantles, and the shawls; the purses,

content: 23 the lace gowns, and the linen vests; and the kerchiefs and the capes.
content_old: 23 the lace gowns, and the linen vests; and the kerchiefs and the capes.

content: 24 And then— Instead of perfume, there shall be rot; And instead of an apron, a rope; Instead of a diadem of beaten-work, A shorn head; Instead of a rich robe, A girding of sackcloth; A burn instead of beauty.
content_old: 24 And then— Instead of perfume, there shall be rot; And instead of an apron, a rope; Instead of a diadem of beaten-work, A shorn head; Instead of a rich robe, A girding of sackcloth; A burn instead of beauty.

content: 25 Her men shall fall by the sword, Her fighting manhood in battle;
content_old: 25 Her men shall fall by the sword, Her fighting manhood in battle;

content: 1 In that day, seven women shall take hold of one man, saying, “We will eat our own food And wear our own clothes; Only let us be called by your name— Take away our disgrace!”
content_old: 1 In that day, seven women shall take hold of one man, saying, “We will eat our own food And wear our own clothes; Only let us be called by your name— Take away our disgrace!”

content: 2 In that day, The radiance of the LORD Will lend beauty and glory, And the splendor of the land dignity and majesty, To the survivors of Israel.
content_old: 2 In that day, The radiance of the LORD Will lend beauty and glory, And the splendor of the land dignity and majesty, To the survivors of Israel.

content: 3 And those who remain in Zion And are left in Jerusalem— All who are inscribed for life in Jerusalem— Shall be called holy.
content_old: 3 And those who remain in Zion And are left in Jerusalem— All who are inscribed for life in Jerusalem— Shall be called holy.

content: 4 When my Lord has washed away The filth of the daughters of Zion, And from Jerusalem’s midst Has rinsed out her infamy— In a spirit of judgment And in a spirit of purging—
content_old: 4 When my Lord has washed away The filth of the daughters of Zion, And from Jerusalem’s midst Has rinsed out her infamy— In a spirit of judgment And in a spirit of purging—

content: 5 the LORD will create over the whole shrine and meeting place of Mount Zion cloud by day and smoke with a glow of flaming fire by night. Indeed, over all the glory shall hang a canopy,
content_old: 5 the LORD will create over the whole shrine and meeting place of Mount Zion cloud by day and smoke with a glow of flaming fire by night. Indeed, over all the glory shall hang a canopy,

content: 1 Let me sing for my beloved A song of my lover about his vineyard. My beloved had a vineyard On a fruitful hill.
content_old: 1 Let me sing for my beloved A song of my lover about his vineyard. My beloved had a vineyard On a fruitful hill.

content: 2 He broke the ground, cleared it of stones, And planted it with choice vines. He built a watchtower inside it, He even hewed a wine press in it; For he hoped it would yield grapes. Instead, it yielded wild grapes.
content_old: 2 He broke the ground, cleared it of stones, And planted it with choice vines. He built a watchtower inside it, He even hewed a wine press in it; For he hoped it would yield grapes. Instead, it yielded wild grapes.

content: 3 “Now, then, Dwellers of Jerusalem And men of Judah, You be the judges Between Me and My vineyard:
content_old: 3 “Now, then, Dwellers of Jerusalem And men of Judah, You be the judges Between Me and My vineyard:

content: 4 What more could have been done for My vineyard That I failed to do in it? Why, when I hoped it would yield grapes, Did it yield wild grapes?
content_old: 4 What more could have been done for My vineyard That I failed to do in it? Why, when I hoped it would yield grapes, Did it yield wild grapes?

content: 5 “Now I am going to tell you What I will do to My vineyard: I will remove its hedge, That it may be ravaged; I will break down its wall, That it may be trampled.
content_old: 5 “Now I am going to tell you What I will do to My vineyard: I will remove its hedge, That it may be ravaged; I will break down its wall, That it may be trampled.

content: 6 And I will make it a desolation; It shall not be pruned or hoed, And it shall be overgrown with briers and thistles. And I will command the clouds To drop no rain on it.”
content_old: 6 And I will make it a desolation; It shall not be pruned or hoed, And it shall be overgrown with briers and thistles. And I will command the clouds To drop no rain on it.”

content: 7 For the vineyard of the LORD of Hosts Is the House of Israel, And the seedlings he lovingly tended Are the men of Judah. And He hoped for justice, But behold, injustice; For equity, But behold, iniquity!
content_old: 7 For the vineyard of the LORD of Hosts Is the House of Israel, And the seedlings he lovingly tended Are the men of Judah. And He hoped for justice, But behold, injustice; For equity, But behold, iniquity!

content: 8 Ah, Those who add house to house And join field to field, Till there is room for none but you To dwell in the land!
content_old: 8 Ah, Those who add house to house And join field to field, Till there is room for none but you To dwell in the land!

content: 9 In my hearing the LORD of Hosts: Surely, great houses Shall lie forlorn, Spacious and splendid ones Without occupants.
content_old: 9 In my hearing the LORD of Hosts: Surely, great houses Shall lie forlorn, Spacious and splendid ones Without occupants.

content: 10 For ten acres of vineyard Shall yield just one bath, And a field sown with a homer of seed Shall yield a mere ephah.
content_old: 10 For ten acres of vineyard Shall yield just one bath, And a field sown with a homer of seed Shall yield a mere ephah.

content: 11 Ah, Those who chase liquor From early in the morning, And till late in the evening Are inflamed by wine!
content_old: 11 Ah, Those who chase liquor From early in the morning, And till late in the evening Are inflamed by wine!

content: 12 Who, at their banquets, Have lyre and lute, Timbrel, flute, and wine; But who never give a thought To the plan of the LORD, And take no note Of what He is designing.
content_old: 12 Who, at their banquets, Have lyre and lute, Timbrel, flute, and wine; But who never give a thought To the plan of the LORD, And take no note Of what He is designing.

content: 13 Assuredly, My people will suffer exile For not giving heed, Its multitude victims of hunger And its masses parched with thirst.
content_old: 13 Assuredly, My people will suffer exile For not giving heed, Its multitude victims of hunger And its masses parched with thirst.

content: 14 Assuredly, Sheol has opened wide its gullet And parted its jaws in a measureless gape; And down into it shall go, That splendor and tumult, That din and revelry.
content_old: 14 Assuredly, Sheol has opened wide its gullet And parted its jaws in a measureless gape; And down into it shall go, That splendor and tumult, That din and revelry.

content: 15 Yea, man is bowed, And mortal brought low; Brought low is the pride of the haughty.
content_old: 15 Yea, man is bowed, And mortal brought low; Brought low is the pride of the haughty.

content: 16 And the LORD of Hosts is exalted by judgment, The Holy God proved holy by retribution.
content_old: 16 And the LORD of Hosts is exalted by judgment, The Holy God proved holy by retribution.

content: 17 Then lambs shall graze As in their meadows, And strangers shall feed On the ruins of the stout.
content_old: 17 Then lambs shall graze As in their meadows, And strangers shall feed On the ruins of the stout.

content: 18 Ah, Those who haul sin with cords of falsehood And iniquity as with cart ropes!
content_old: 18 Ah, Those who haul sin with cords of falsehood And iniquity as with cart ropes!

content: 19 Who say, “Let Him speed, let Him hasten His purpose, If we are to give thought; Let the plans of the Holy One of Israel Be quickly fulfilled, If we are to give heed.”
content_old: 19 Who say, “Let Him speed, let Him hasten His purpose, If we are to give thought; Let the plans of the Holy One of Israel Be quickly fulfilled, If we are to give heed.”

content: 20 Ah, Those who call evil good And good evil; Who present darkness as light And light as darkness; Who present bitter as sweet And sweet as bitter!
content_old: 20 Ah, Those who call evil good And good evil; Who present darkness as light And light as darkness; Who present bitter as sweet And sweet as bitter!

content: 21 Ah, Those who are so wise— In their own opinion; So clever— In their own judgment!
content_old: 21 Ah, Those who are so wise— In their own opinion; So clever— In their own judgment!

content: 22 Ah, Those who are so doughty— As drinkers of wine, And so valiant— As mixers of drink!
content_old: 22 Ah, Those who are so doughty— As drinkers of wine, And so valiant— As mixers of drink!

content: 23 Who vindicate him who is in the wrong In return for a bribe, And withhold vindication From him who is in the right.
content_old: 23 Who vindicate him who is in the wrong In return for a bribe, And withhold vindication From him who is in the right.

content: 24 Assuredly, As straw is consumed by a tongue of fire And hay shrivels as it burns, Their stock shall become like rot, And their buds shall blow away like dust. For they have rejected the instruction of the LORD of Hosts, Spurned the word of the Holy One of Israel.
content_old: 24 Assuredly, As straw is consumed by a tongue of fire And hay shrivels as it burns, Their stock shall become like rot, And their buds shall blow away like dust. For they have rejected the instruction of the LORD of Hosts, Spurned the word of the Holy One of Israel.

content: 25 That is why The LORD’s anger was roused Against His people, Why He stretched out His arm against it And struck it, So that the mountains quaked, And its corpses lay Like refuse in the streets. Yet his anger has not turned back, And His arm is outstretched still.
content_old: 25 That is why The LORD’s anger was roused Against His people, Why He stretched out His arm against it And struck it, So that the mountains quaked, And its corpses lay Like refuse in the streets. Yet his anger has not turned back, And His arm is outstretched still.

content: 26 He will raise an ensign to a nation afar, Whistle to one at the end of the earth. There it comes with lightning speed!
content_old: 26 He will raise an ensign to a nation afar, Whistle to one at the end of the earth. There it comes with lightning speed!

content: 27 In its ranks, none is weary or stumbles, They never sleep or slumber; The belts on their waists do not come loose, Nor do the thongs of their sandals break.
content_old: 27 In its ranks, none is weary or stumbles, They never sleep or slumber; The belts on their waists do not come loose, Nor do the thongs of their sandals break.

content: 28 Their arrows are sharpened, And all their bows are drawn. Their horses’ hoofs are like flint, Their chariot wheels like the whirlwind.
content_old: 28 Their arrows are sharpened, And all their bows are drawn. Their horses’ hoofs are like flint, Their chariot wheels like the whirlwind.

content: 29 Their roaring is like a lion’s, They roar like the great beasts; When they growl and seize a prey, They carry it off and none can recover it.
content_old: 29 Their roaring is like a lion’s, They roar like the great beasts; When they growl and seize a prey, They carry it off and none can recover it.

content: 1 In the year that King Uzziah died, I beheld my Lord seated on a high and lofty throne; and the skirts of His robe filled the Temple.
content_old: 1 In the year that King Uzziah died, I beheld my Lord seated on a high and lofty throne; and the skirts of His robe filled the Temple.

content: 2 Seraphs stood in attendance on Him. Each of them had six wings: with two he covered his face, with two he covered his legs, and with two he would fly.
content_old: 2 Seraphs stood in attendance on Him. Each of them had six wings: with two he covered his face, with two he covered his legs, and with two he would fly.

content: 3 And one would call to the other, “Holy, holy, holy! The LORD of Hosts! His presence fills all the earth!”
content_old: 3 And one would call to the other, “Holy, holy, holy! The LORD of Hosts! His presence fills all the earth!”

content: 4 The doorposts would shake at the sound of the one who called, and the House kept filling with smoke.
content_old: 4 The doorposts would shake at the sound of the one who called, and the House kept filling with smoke.

content: 5 I cried, “Woe is me; I am lost! For I am a man of unclean lips And I live among a people Of unclean lips; Yet my own eyes have beheld The King LORD of Hosts.”
content_old: 5 I cried, “Woe is me; I am lost! For I am a man of unclean lips And I live among a people Of unclean lips; Yet my own eyes have beheld The King LORD of Hosts.”

content: 6 Then one of the seraphs flew over to me with a live coal, which he had taken from the altar with a pair of tongs.
content_old: 6 Then one of the seraphs flew over to me with a live coal, which he had taken from the altar with a pair of tongs.

content: 7 He touched it to my lips and declared, “Now that this has touched your lips, Your guilt shall depart And your sin be purged away.”
content_old: 7 He touched it to my lips and declared, “Now that this has touched your lips, Your guilt shall depart And your sin be purged away.”

content: 8 Then I heard the voice of my Lord saying, “Whom shall I send? Who will go for us?” And I said, “Here am I; send me.”
content_old: 8 Then I heard the voice of my Lord saying, “Whom shall I send? Who will go for us?” And I said, “Here am I; send me.”

content: 9 And He said, “Go, say to that people: ‘Hear, indeed, but do not understand; See, indeed, but do not grasp.’
content_old: 9 And He said, “Go, say to that people: ‘Hear, indeed, but do not understand; See, indeed, but do not grasp.’

content: 10 Dull that people’s mind, Stop its ears, And seal its eyes— Lest, seeing with its eyes And hearing with its ears, It also grasp with its mind, And repent and save itself.”
content_old: 10 Dull that people’s mind, Stop its ears, And seal its eyes— Lest, seeing with its eyes And hearing with its ears, It also grasp with its mind, And repent and save itself.”

content: 11 I asked, “How long, my Lord?” And He replied: “Till towns lie waste without inhabitants And houses without people, And the ground lies waste and desolate—
content_old: 11 I asked, “How long, my Lord?” And He replied: “Till towns lie waste without inhabitants And houses without people, And the ground lies waste and desolate—

content: 12 For the LORD will banish the population— And deserted sites are many In the midst of the land.
content_old: 12 For the LORD will banish the population— And deserted sites are many In the midst of the land.

content: 1 In the reign of Ahaz son of Jotham son of Uzziah, king of Judah, King Rezin of Aram and King Pekah son of Remaliah of Israel marched upon Jerusalem to attack it; but they were not able to attack it.
content_old: 1 In the reign of Ahaz son of Jotham son of Uzziah, king of Judah, King Rezin of Aram and King Pekah son of Remaliah of Israel marched upon Jerusalem to attack it; but they were not able to attack it.

content: 2 Now, when it was reported to the House of David that Aram had allied itself with Ephraim, their hearts and the hearts of their people trembled as trees of the forest sway before a wind.
content_old: 2 Now, when it was reported to the House of David that Aram had allied itself with Ephraim, their hearts and the hearts of their people trembled as trees of the forest sway before a wind.

content: 3 But the LORD said to Isaiah, “Go out with your son Shear-jashub to meet Ahaz at the end of the conduit of the Upper Pool, by the road of the Fuller’s Field.
content_old: 3 But the LORD said to Isaiah, “Go out with your son Shear-jashub to meet Ahaz at the end of the conduit of the Upper Pool, by the road of the Fuller’s Field.

content: 4 And say to him: Be firm and be calm. Do not be afraid and do not lose heart on account of those two smoking stubs of firebrands, on account of the raging of Rezin and his Arameans and the son of Remaliah.
content_old: 4 And say to him: Be firm and be calm. Do not be afraid and do not lose heart on account of those two smoking stubs of firebrands, on account of the raging of Rezin and his Arameans and the son of Remaliah.

content: 5 Because the Arameans—with Ephraim and the son of Remaliah—have plotted against you, saying,
content_old: 5 Because the Arameans—with Ephraim and the son of Remaliah—have plotted against you, saying,

content: 6 ‘We will march against Judah and invade and conquer it, and we will set up as king in it the son of Tabeel,’
content_old: 6 ‘We will march against Judah and invade and conquer it, and we will set up as king in it the son of Tabeel,’

content: 7 thus said my Lord GOD: It shall not succeed, It shall not come to pass.
content_old: 7 thus said my Lord GOD: It shall not succeed, It shall not come to pass.

content: 8 For the chief city of Aram is Damascus, And the chief of Damascus is Rezin;
content_old: 8 For the chief city of Aram is Damascus, And the chief of Damascus is Rezin;

content: 9 The chief city of Ephraim is Samaria, And the chief of Samaria is the son of Remaliah. And in another sixty-five years, Ephraim shall be shattered as a people. If you will not believe, for you cannot be trusted …”
content_old: 9 The chief city of Ephraim is Samaria, And the chief of Samaria is the son of Remaliah. And in another sixty-five years, Ephraim shall be shattered as a people. If you will not believe, for you cannot be trusted …”

content: 10 The LORD spoke further to Ahaz:
content_old: 10 The LORD spoke further to Ahaz:

content: 11 “Ask for a sign from the LORD your God, anywhere down to Sheol or up to the sky.”
content_old: 11 “Ask for a sign from the LORD your God, anywhere down to Sheol or up to the sky.”

content: 12 But Ahaz replied, “I will not ask, and I will not test the LORD.”
content_old: 12 But Ahaz replied, “I will not ask, and I will not test the LORD.”

content: 13 “Listen, House of David,” Isaiah retorted, “is it not enough for you to treat men as helpless that you also treat my God as helpless?
content_old: 13 “Listen, House of David,” Isaiah retorted, “is it not enough for you to treat men as helpless that you also treat my God as helpless?

content: 14 Assuredly, my Lord will give you a sign of His own accord! Look, the young woman is with child and about to give birth to a son. Let her name him Immanuel.
content_old: 14 Assuredly, my Lord will give you a sign of His own accord! Look, the young woman is with child and about to give birth to a son. Let her name him Immanuel.

content: 15 By the time he learns to reject the bad and choose the good, people will be feeding on curds and honey.
content_old: 15 By the time he learns to reject the bad and choose the good, people will be feeding on curds and honey.

content: 16 For before the lad knows to reject the bad and choose the good, the ground whose two kings you dread shall be abandoned.
content_old: 16 For before the lad knows to reject the bad and choose the good, the ground whose two kings you dread shall be abandoned.

content: 17 The LORD will cause to come upon you and your people and your ancestral house such days as never have come since Ephraim turned away from Judah—that selfsame king of Assyria!
content_old: 17 The LORD will cause to come upon you and your people and your ancestral house such days as never have come since Ephraim turned away from Judah—that selfsame king of Assyria!

content: 18 “In that day, the LORD will whistle to the flies at the ends of the water channels of Egypt and to the bees in the land of Assyria;
content_old: 18 “In that day, the LORD will whistle to the flies at the ends of the water channels of Egypt and to the bees in the land of Assyria;

content: 19 and they shall all come and alight in the rugged wadis, and in the clefts of the rocks, and in all the thornbrakes, and in all the watering places.
content_old: 19 and they shall all come and alight in the rugged wadis, and in the clefts of the rocks, and in all the thornbrakes, and in all the watering places.

content: 20 “In that day, my Lord will cut away with the razor that is hired beyond the Euphrates—with the king of Assyria—the hair of the head and the hair of the legs, and it shall clip off the beard as well.
content_old: 20 “In that day, my Lord will cut away with the razor that is hired beyond the Euphrates—with the king of Assyria—the hair of the head and the hair of the legs, and it shall clip off the beard as well.

content: 21 And in that day, each man shall save alive a heifer of the herd and two animals of the flock.
content_old: 21 And in that day, each man shall save alive a heifer of the herd and two animals of the flock.

content: 22 And he shall obtain so much milk that he shall eat curds. Thus everyone who is left in the land shall feed on curds and honey.
content_old: 22 And he shall obtain so much milk that he shall eat curds. Thus everyone who is left in the land shall feed on curds and honey.

content: 23 “For in that day, every spot where there could stand a thousand vines worth a thousand shekels of silver shall become a wilderness of thornbush and thistle.
content_old: 23 “For in that day, every spot where there could stand a thousand vines worth a thousand shekels of silver shall become a wilderness of thornbush and thistle.

content: 24 One will have to go there with bow and arrows, for the country shall be all thornbushes and thistles.
content_old: 24 One will have to go there with bow and arrows, for the country shall be all thornbushes and thistles.

content: 1 The LORD said to me, “Get yourself a large sheet and write on it in common script ‘For Maher-shalal-hash-baz’;
content_old: 1 The LORD said to me, “Get yourself a large sheet and write on it in common script ‘For Maher-shalal-hash-baz’;

content: 2 and call reliable witnesses, the priest Uriah and Zechariah son of Jeberechiah, to witness for Me.”
content_old: 2 and call reliable witnesses, the priest Uriah and Zechariah son of Jeberechiah, to witness for Me.”

content: 3 I was intimate with the prophetess, and she conceived and bore a son; and the LORD said to me, “Name him Maher-shalal-hash-baz.
content_old: 3 I was intimate with the prophetess, and she conceived and bore a son; and the LORD said to me, “Name him Maher-shalal-hash-baz.

content: 4 For before the boy learns to call ‘Father’ and ‘Mother,’ the wealth of Damascus and the spoils of Samaria, and the delights of Rezin and of the son of Remaliah, shall be carried off before the king of Assyria.”
content_old: 4 For before the boy learns to call ‘Father’ and ‘Mother,’ the wealth of Damascus and the spoils of Samaria, and the delights of Rezin and of the son of Remaliah, shall be carried off before the king of Assyria.”

content: 5 Again the LORD spoke to me, thus:
content_old: 5 Again the LORD spoke to me, thus:

content: 6 “Because that people has spurned The gently flowing waters of Siloam”—
content_old: 6 “Because that people has spurned The gently flowing waters of Siloam”—

content: 7 Assuredly, My Lord will bring up against them The mighty, massive waters of the Euphrates, The king of Assyria and all his multitude. It shall rise above all its channels, And flow over all its beds,
content_old: 7 Assuredly, My Lord will bring up against them The mighty, massive waters of the Euphrates, The king of Assyria and all his multitude. It shall rise above all its channels, And flow over all its beds,

content: 8 And swirl through Judah like a flash flood Reaching up to the neck. But with us is God, Whose wings are spread As wide as your land is broad!
content_old: 8 And swirl through Judah like a flash flood Reaching up to the neck. But with us is God, Whose wings are spread As wide as your land is broad!

content: 9 Band together, O peoples—you shall be broken! Listen to this, you remotest parts of the earth: Gird yourselves—you shall be broken; Gird yourselves—you shall be broken!
content_old: 9 Band together, O peoples—you shall be broken! Listen to this, you remotest parts of the earth: Gird yourselves—you shall be broken; Gird yourselves—you shall be broken!

content: 10 Hatch a plot—it shall be foiled; Agree on action—it shall not succeed. For with us is God!
content_old: 10 Hatch a plot—it shall be foiled; Agree on action—it shall not succeed. For with us is God!

content: 11 For this is what the LORD said to me, when He took me by the hand and charged me not to walk in the path of that people:
content_old: 11 For this is what the LORD said to me, when He took me by the hand and charged me not to walk in the path of that people:

content: 12 “You must not call conspiracy All that that people calls conspiracy, Nor revere what it reveres, Nor hold it in awe.
content_old: 12 “You must not call conspiracy All that that people calls conspiracy, Nor revere what it reveres, Nor hold it in awe.

content: 13 None but the LORD of Hosts Shall you account holy; Give reverence to Him alone, Hold Him alone in awe.
content_old: 13 None but the LORD of Hosts Shall you account holy; Give reverence to Him alone, Hold Him alone in awe.

content: 14 He shall be for a sanctuary, A stone men strike against: A rock men stumble over For the two Houses of Israel, And a trap and a snare for those Who dwell in Jerusalem.
content_old: 14 He shall be for a sanctuary, A stone men strike against: A rock men stumble over For the two Houses of Israel, And a trap and a snare for those Who dwell in Jerusalem.

content: 15 The masses shall trip over these And shall fall and be injured, Shall be snared and be caught.
content_old: 15 The masses shall trip over these And shall fall and be injured, Shall be snared and be caught.

content: 16 Bind up the message, Seal the instruction with My disciples.”
content_old: 16 Bind up the message, Seal the instruction with My disciples.”

content: 17 So I will wait for the LORD, who is hiding His face from the House of Jacob, and I will trust in Him.
content_old: 17 So I will wait for the LORD, who is hiding His face from the House of Jacob, and I will trust in Him.

content: 18 Here stand I and the children the LORD has given me as signs and portents in Israel from the LORD of Hosts, who dwells on Mount Zion.
content_old: 18 Here stand I and the children the LORD has given me as signs and portents in Israel from the LORD of Hosts, who dwells on Mount Zion.

content: 19 Now, should people say to you, “Inquire of the ghosts and familiar spirits that chirp and moan; for a people may inquire of its divine beings—of the dead on behalf of the living—
content_old: 19 Now, should people say to you, “Inquire of the ghosts and familiar spirits that chirp and moan; for a people may inquire of its divine beings—of the dead on behalf of the living—

content: 20 for instruction and message,” surely, for one who speaks thus there shall be no dawn.
content_old: 20 for instruction and message,” surely, for one who speaks thus there shall be no dawn.

content: 21 And he shall go about in it wretched and hungry; and when he is hungry, he shall rage and revolt against his king and his divine beings. He may turn his face upward
content_old: 21 And he shall go about in it wretched and hungry; and when he is hungry, he shall rage and revolt against his king and his divine beings. He may turn his face upward

content: 22 or he may look below, but behold, Distress and darkness, with no daybreak; Straitness and gloom, with no dawn.
content_old: 22 or he may look below, but behold, Distress and darkness, with no daybreak; Straitness and gloom, with no dawn.

content: 1 The people that walked in darkness Have seen a brilliant light; On those who dwelt in a land of gloom Light has dawned.
content_old: 1 The people that walked in darkness Have seen a brilliant light; On those who dwelt in a land of gloom Light has dawned.

content: 2 You have magnified that nation, Have given it great joy; They have rejoiced before You As they rejoice at reaping time, As they exult When dividing spoil.
content_old: 2 You have magnified that nation, Have given it great joy; They have rejoiced before You As they rejoice at reaping time, As they exult When dividing spoil.

content: 3 For the yoke that they bore And the stick on their back— The rod of their taskmaster— You have broken as on the day of Midian.
content_old: 3 For the yoke that they bore And the stick on their back— The rod of their taskmaster— You have broken as on the day of Midian.

content: 4 Truly, all the boots put on to stamp with And all the garments donned in infamy Have been fed to the flames, Devoured by fire.
content_old: 4 Truly, all the boots put on to stamp with And all the garments donned in infamy Have been fed to the flames, Devoured by fire.

content: 5 For a child has been born to us, A son has been given us. And authority has settled on his shoulders. He has been named “The Mighty God is planning grace; The Eternal Father, a peaceable ruler”—
content_old: 5 For a child has been born to us, A son has been given us. And authority has settled on his shoulders. He has been named “The Mighty God is planning grace; The Eternal Father, a peaceable ruler”—

content: 6 In token of abundant authority And of peace without limit Upon David’s throne and kingdom, That it may be firmly established In justice and in equity Now and evermore. The zeal of the LORD of Hosts Shall bring this to pass.
content_old: 6 In token of abundant authority And of peace without limit Upon David’s throne and kingdom, That it may be firmly established In justice and in equity Now and evermore. The zeal of the LORD of Hosts Shall bring this to pass.

content: 7 My Lord Let loose a word against Jacob And it fell upon Israel.
content_old: 7 My Lord Let loose a word against Jacob And it fell upon Israel.

content: 8 But all the people noted— Ephraim and the inhabitants of Samaria— In arrogance and haughtiness:
content_old: 8 But all the people noted— Ephraim and the inhabitants of Samaria— In arrogance and haughtiness:

content: 9 “Bricks have fallen— We’ll rebuild with dressed stone; Sycamores have been felled— We’ll grow cedars instead!”
content_old: 9 “Bricks have fallen— We’ll rebuild with dressed stone; Sycamores have been felled— We’ll grow cedars instead!”

content: 10 So the LORD let the enemies of Rezin Triumph over it And stirred up its foes—
content_old: 10 So the LORD let the enemies of Rezin Triumph over it And stirred up its foes—

content: 11 Aram from the east And Philistia from the west— Who devoured Israel With greedy mouths. Yet His anger has not turned back, And His arm is outstretched still.
content_old: 11 Aram from the east And Philistia from the west— Who devoured Israel With greedy mouths. Yet His anger has not turned back, And His arm is outstretched still.

content: 12 For the people has not turned back To Him who struck it And has not sought The LORD of Hosts.
content_old: 12 For the people has not turned back To Him who struck it And has not sought The LORD of Hosts.

content: 13 So the LORD will cut off from Israel Head and tail, Palm branch and reed, In a single day.
content_old: 13 So the LORD will cut off from Israel Head and tail, Palm branch and reed, In a single day.

content: 14 Elders and magnates— Such are the heads; Prophets who give false instruction, Such are the tails
content_old: 14 Elders and magnates— Such are the heads; Prophets who give false instruction, Such are the tails

content: 15 That people’s leaders have been misleaders, So they that are led have been confused.
content_old: 15 That people’s leaders have been misleaders, So they that are led have been confused.

content: 16 That is why my Lord Will not spare their youths, Nor show compassion To their orphans and widows; For all are ungodly and wicked, And every mouth speaks impiety.
content_old: 16 That is why my Lord Will not spare their youths, Nor show compassion To their orphans and widows; For all are ungodly and wicked, And every mouth speaks impiety.

content: 17 Already wickedness has blazed forth like a fire Devouring thorn and thistle. It has kindled the thickets of the wood, Which have turned into billowing smoke. Yet His anger has not turned back, And His arm is outstretched still.
content_old: 17 Already wickedness has blazed forth like a fire Devouring thorn and thistle. It has kindled the thickets of the wood, Which have turned into billowing smoke. Yet His anger has not turned back, And His arm is outstretched still.

content: 18 By the fury of the LORD of Hosts, The earth was shaken. Next, the people became like devouring fire: No man spared his countryman.
content_old: 18 By the fury of the LORD of Hosts, The earth was shaken. Next, the people became like devouring fire: No man spared his countryman.

content: 19 They snatched on the right, but remained hungry, And consumed on the left without being sated. Each devoured the flesh of his own kindred—
content_old: 19 They snatched on the right, but remained hungry, And consumed on the left without being sated. Each devoured the flesh of his own kindred—

content: 1 Ha! Those who write out evil writs And compose iniquitous documents,
content_old: 1 Ha! Those who write out evil writs And compose iniquitous documents,

content: 2 To subvert the cause of the poor, To rob of their rights the needy of My people; That widows may be their spoil, And fatherless children their booty!
content_old: 2 To subvert the cause of the poor, To rob of their rights the needy of My people; That widows may be their spoil, And fatherless children their booty!

content: 3 What will you do on the day of punishment, When the calamity comes from afar? To whom will you flee for help, And how will you save your carcasses
content_old: 3 What will you do on the day of punishment, When the calamity comes from afar? To whom will you flee for help, And how will you save your carcasses

content: 4 From collapsing under prisoners, From falling beneath the slain? Yet His anger has not turned back, And his arm is outstretched still.
content_old: 4 From collapsing under prisoners, From falling beneath the slain? Yet His anger has not turned back, And his arm is outstretched still.

content: 5 Ha! Assyria, rod of My anger, In whose hand, as a staff, is My fury!
content_old: 5 Ha! Assyria, rod of My anger, In whose hand, as a staff, is My fury!

content: 6 I send him against an ungodly nation, I charge him against a people that provokes Me, To take its spoil and to seize its booty And to make it a thing trampled Like the mire of the streets.
content_old: 6 I send him against an ungodly nation, I charge him against a people that provokes Me, To take its spoil and to seize its booty And to make it a thing trampled Like the mire of the streets.

content: 7 But he has evil plans, His mind harbors evil designs; For he means to destroy, To wipe out nations, not a few.
content_old: 7 But he has evil plans, His mind harbors evil designs; For he means to destroy, To wipe out nations, not a few.

content: 8 For he thinks, “After all, I have kings as my captains!
content_old: 8 For he thinks, “After all, I have kings as my captains!

content: 9 Was Calno any different from Carchemish? Or Hamath from Arpad? Or Samaria from Damascus?
content_old: 9 Was Calno any different from Carchemish? Or Hamath from Arpad? Or Samaria from Damascus?

content: 10 Since I was able to seize The insignificant kingdoms, Whose images exceeded Jersualem’s and Samaria’s,
content_old: 10 Since I was able to seize The insignificant kingdoms, Whose images exceeded Jersualem’s and Samaria’s,

content: 11 Shall I not do to Jerusalem and her images What I did to Samaria and her idols?”
content_old: 11 Shall I not do to Jerusalem and her images What I did to Samaria and her idols?”

content: 12 But when my Lord has carried out all his purpose on Mount Zion and in Jerusalem, He will punish the majestic pride and overbearing arrogance of the king of Assyria.
content_old: 12 But when my Lord has carried out all his purpose on Mount Zion and in Jerusalem, He will punish the majestic pride and overbearing arrogance of the king of Assyria.

content: 13 For he thought, “By the might of my hand have I wrought it, By my skill, for I am clever: I have erased the borders of peoples; I have plundered their treasures, And exiled their vast populations.
content_old: 13 For he thought, “By the might of my hand have I wrought it, By my skill, for I am clever: I have erased the borders of peoples; I have plundered their treasures, And exiled their vast populations.

content: 14 I was able to seize, like a nest, The wealth of peoples; As one gathers abandoned eggs, So I gathered all the earth: Nothing so much as flapped a wing Or opened a mouth to peep.”
content_old: 14 I was able to seize, like a nest, The wealth of peoples; As one gathers abandoned eggs, So I gathered all the earth: Nothing so much as flapped a wing Or opened a mouth to peep.”

content: 15 Does an ax boast over him who hews with it, Or a saw magnify itself above him who wields it? As though the rod raised him who lifts it, As though the staff lifted the man!
content_old: 15 Does an ax boast over him who hews with it, Or a saw magnify itself above him who wields it? As though the rod raised him who lifts it, As though the staff lifted the man!

content: 16 Assuredly, The Sovereign LORD of Hosts will send A wasting away in its fatness; And under its body shall burn A burning like that of fire, Destroying frame and flesh. It shall be like a sick man who pines away.
content_old: 16 Assuredly, The Sovereign LORD of Hosts will send A wasting away in its fatness; And under its body shall burn A burning like that of fire, Destroying frame and flesh. It shall be like a sick man who pines away.

content: 17 The Light of Israel will be fire And its Holy One flame. It will burn and consume its thorns And its thistles in a single day,
content_old: 17 The Light of Israel will be fire And its Holy One flame. It will burn and consume its thorns And its thistles in a single day,

content: 18 And the mass of its scrub and its farm land.
content_old: 18 And the mass of its scrub and its farm land.

content: 19 What trees remain of its scrub Shall be so few that a boy may record them.
content_old: 19 What trees remain of its scrub Shall be so few that a boy may record them.

content: 20 And in that day, The remnant of Israel And the escaped of the House of Jacob Shall lean no more upon him that beats it, But shall lean sincerely On the LORD, the Holy One of Israel.
content_old: 20 And in that day, The remnant of Israel And the escaped of the House of Jacob Shall lean no more upon him that beats it, But shall lean sincerely On the LORD, the Holy One of Israel.

content: 21 Only a remnant shall return, Only a remnant of Jacob, To Mighty God.
content_old: 21 Only a remnant shall return, Only a remnant of Jacob, To Mighty God.

content: 22 Even if your people, O Israel, Should be as the sands of the sea, Only a remnant of it shall return. Destruction is decreed; Retribution comes like a flood!
content_old: 22 Even if your people, O Israel, Should be as the sands of the sea, Only a remnant of it shall return. Destruction is decreed; Retribution comes like a flood!

content: 23 For my Lord GOD of Hosts is carrying out A decree of destruction upon all the land.
content_old: 23 For my Lord GOD of Hosts is carrying out A decree of destruction upon all the land.

content: 24 Assuredly, thus said my Lord GOD of Hosts: “O My people that dwells in Zion, have no fear of Assyria, who beats you with a rod and wields his staff over you as did the Egyptians.
content_old: 24 Assuredly, thus said my Lord GOD of Hosts: “O My people that dwells in Zion, have no fear of Assyria, who beats you with a rod and wields his staff over you as did the Egyptians.

content: 25 For very soon My wrath will have spent itself, and My anger that was bent on wasting them.”
content_old: 25 For very soon My wrath will have spent itself, and My anger that was bent on wasting them.”

content: 26 The LORD of Hosts will brandish a scourge over him as when He beat Midian at the Rock of Oreb, and will wield His staff as He did over the Egyptians by the sea.
content_old: 26 The LORD of Hosts will brandish a scourge over him as when He beat Midian at the Rock of Oreb, and will wield His staff as He did over the Egyptians by the sea.

content: 27 And in that day, His burden shall drop from your back, And his yoke from your neck; The yoke shall be destroyed because of fatness.
content_old: 27 And in that day, His burden shall drop from your back, And his yoke from your neck; The yoke shall be destroyed because of fatness.

content: 28 He advanced upon Aiath, He proceeded to Migron, At Michmas he deposited his baggage.
content_old: 28 He advanced upon Aiath, He proceeded to Migron, At Michmas he deposited his baggage.

content: 29 They made the crossing; “Geba is to be our night quarters!” Ramah was alarmed; Gibeah of Saul took to flight.
content_old: 29 They made the crossing; “Geba is to be our night quarters!” Ramah was alarmed; Gibeah of Saul took to flight.

content: 30 “Give a shrill cry, O Bath-gallim! Hearken, Laishah! Take up the cry, Anathoth!”
content_old: 30 “Give a shrill cry, O Bath-gallim! Hearken, Laishah! Take up the cry, Anathoth!”

content: 31 Madmenah ran away; The dwellers of Gebim sought refuge.
content_old: 31 Madmenah ran away; The dwellers of Gebim sought refuge.

content: 32 This same day at Nob He shall stand and wave his hand. O mount of Fair Zion! O hill of Jerusalem!
content_old: 32 This same day at Nob He shall stand and wave his hand. O mount of Fair Zion! O hill of Jerusalem!

content: 33 Lo! The Sovereign LORD of Hosts Will hew off the tree-crowns with an ax: The tall ones shall be felled, The lofty ones cut down:
content_old: 33 Lo! The Sovereign LORD of Hosts Will hew off the tree-crowns with an ax: The tall ones shall be felled, The lofty ones cut down:

content: 1 But a shoot shall grow out of the stump of Jesse, A twig shall sprout from his stock.
content_old: 1 But a shoot shall grow out of the stump of Jesse, A twig shall sprout from his stock.

content: 2 The spirit of the LORD shall alight upon him: A spirit of wisdom and insight, A spirit of counsel and valor, A spirit of devotion and reverence for the LORD.
content_old: 2 The spirit of the LORD shall alight upon him: A spirit of wisdom and insight, A spirit of counsel and valor, A spirit of devotion and reverence for the LORD.

content: 3 He shall sense the truth by his reverence for the LORD: He shall not judge by what his eyes behold, Nor decide by what his ears perceive.
content_old: 3 He shall sense the truth by his reverence for the LORD: He shall not judge by what his eyes behold, Nor decide by what his ears perceive.

content: 4 Thus he shall judge the poor with equity And decide with justice for the lowly of the land. He shall strike down a land with the rod of his mouth And slay the wicked with the breath of his lips.
content_old: 4 Thus he shall judge the poor with equity And decide with justice for the lowly of the land. He shall strike down a land with the rod of his mouth And slay the wicked with the breath of his lips.

content: 5 Justice shall be the girdle of his loins, And faithfulness the girdle of his waist.
content_old: 5 Justice shall be the girdle of his loins, And faithfulness the girdle of his waist.

content: 6 The wolf shall dwell with the lamb, The leopard lie down with the kid; The calf, the beast of prey, and the fatling together, With a little boy to herd them.
content_old: 6 The wolf shall dwell with the lamb, The leopard lie down with the kid; The calf, the beast of prey, and the fatling together, With a little boy to herd them.

content: 7 The cow and the bear shall graze, Their young shall lie down together; And the lion, like the ox, shall eat straw.
content_old: 7 The cow and the bear shall graze, Their young shall lie down together; And the lion, like the ox, shall eat straw.

content: 8 A babe shall play Over a viper’s hole, And an infant pass his hand Over an adder’s den.
content_old: 8 A babe shall play Over a viper’s hole, And an infant pass his hand Over an adder’s den.

content: 9 In all of My sacred mount Nothing evil or vile shall be done; For the land shall be filled with devotion to the LORD As water covers the sea.
content_old: 9 In all of My sacred mount Nothing evil or vile shall be done; For the land shall be filled with devotion to the LORD As water covers the sea.

content: 10 In that day, The stock of Jesse that has remained standing Shall become a standard to peoples— Nations shall seek his counsel And his abode shall be honored.
content_old: 10 In that day, The stock of Jesse that has remained standing Shall become a standard to peoples— Nations shall seek his counsel And his abode shall be honored.

content: 11 In that day, My Lord will apply His hand again to redeeming the other part of His people from Assyria—as also from Egypt, Pathros, Nubia, Elam, Shinar, Hamath, and the coastlands.
content_old: 11 In that day, My Lord will apply His hand again to redeeming the other part of His people from Assyria—as also from Egypt, Pathros, Nubia, Elam, Shinar, Hamath, and the coastlands.

content: 12 He will hold up a signal to the nations And assemble the banished of Israel, And gather the dispersed of Judah From the four corners of the earth.
content_old: 12 He will hold up a signal to the nations And assemble the banished of Israel, And gather the dispersed of Judah From the four corners of the earth.

content: 13 Then Ephraim’s envy shall cease And Judah’s harassment shall end; Ephraim shall not envy Judah, And Judah shall not harass Ephraim.
content_old: 13 Then Ephraim’s envy shall cease And Judah’s harassment shall end; Ephraim shall not envy Judah, And Judah shall not harass Ephraim.

content: 14 They shall pounce on the back of Philistia to the west, And together plunder the peoples of the east; Edom and Moab shall be subject to them And the children of Ammon shall obey them.
content_old: 14 They shall pounce on the back of Philistia to the west, And together plunder the peoples of the east; Edom and Moab shall be subject to them And the children of Ammon shall obey them.

content: 15 The LORD will dry up the tongue of the Egyptian sea.—He will raise His hand over the Euphrates with the might of His wind and break it into seven wadis, so that it can be trodden dry-shod.
content_old: 15 The LORD will dry up the tongue of the Egyptian sea.—He will raise His hand over the Euphrates with the might of His wind and break it into seven wadis, so that it can be trodden dry-shod.

content: 1 In that day, you shall say: “I give thanks to You, O LORD! Although You were wroth with me, Your wrath has turned back and You comfort me,
content_old: 1 In that day, you shall say: “I give thanks to You, O LORD! Although You were wroth with me, Your wrath has turned back and You comfort me,

content: 2 Behold the God who gives me triumph! I am confident, unafraid; For Yah the LORD is my strength and might, And He has been my deliverance.”
content_old: 2 Behold the God who gives me triumph! I am confident, unafraid; For Yah the LORD is my strength and might, And He has been my deliverance.”

content: 3 Joyfully shall you draw water From the fountains of triumph,
content_old: 3 Joyfully shall you draw water From the fountains of triumph,

content: 4 And you shall say on that day: “Praise the LORD, proclaim His name. Make His deeds known among the peoples; Declare that His name is exalted.
content_old: 4 And you shall say on that day: “Praise the LORD, proclaim His name. Make His deeds known among the peoples; Declare that His name is exalted.

content: 5 Hymn the LORD, For He has done gloriously; Let this be made known In all the world!
content_old: 5 Hymn the LORD, For He has done gloriously; Let this be made known In all the world!

content: 1 The “Babylon” Pronouncement, a prophecy of Isaiah son of Amoz.
content_old: 1 The “Babylon” Pronouncement, a prophecy of Isaiah son of Amoz.

content: 2 “Raise a standard upon a bare hill, Cry aloud to them; Wave a hand, and let them enter The gates of the nobles!
content_old: 2 “Raise a standard upon a bare hill, Cry aloud to them; Wave a hand, and let them enter The gates of the nobles!

content: 3 I have summoned My purified guests To execute My wrath; Behold, I have called My stalwarts, My proudly exultant ones.”
content_old: 3 I have summoned My purified guests To execute My wrath; Behold, I have called My stalwarts, My proudly exultant ones.”

content: 4 Hark! a tumult on the mountains— As of a mighty force; Hark! an uproar of kingdoms, Nations assembling! The LORD of Hosts is mustering A host for war.
content_old: 4 Hark! a tumult on the mountains— As of a mighty force; Hark! an uproar of kingdoms, Nations assembling! The LORD of Hosts is mustering A host for war.

content: 5 They come from a distant land, From the end of the sky— The LORD with the weapons of His wrath— To ravage all the earth!
content_old: 5 They come from a distant land, From the end of the sky— The LORD with the weapons of His wrath— To ravage all the earth!

content: 6 Howl! For the day of the LORD is near; It shall come like havoc from Shaddai.
content_old: 6 Howl! For the day of the LORD is near; It shall come like havoc from Shaddai.

content: 7 Therefore all hands shall grow limp, And all men’s hearts shall sink;
content_old: 7 Therefore all hands shall grow limp, And all men’s hearts shall sink;

content: 8 And, overcome by terror, They shall be seized by pangs and throes, Writhe like a woman in travail. They shall gaze at each other in horror, Their faces livid with fright.
content_old: 8 And, overcome by terror, They shall be seized by pangs and throes, Writhe like a woman in travail. They shall gaze at each other in horror, Their faces livid with fright.

content: 9 Lo! The day of the LORD is coming With pitiless fury and wrath, To make the earth a desolation, To wipe out the sinners upon it.
content_old: 9 Lo! The day of the LORD is coming With pitiless fury and wrath, To make the earth a desolation, To wipe out the sinners upon it.

content: 10 The stars and constellations of heaven Shall not give off their light; The sun shall be dark when it rises, And the moon shall diffuse no glow.
content_old: 10 The stars and constellations of heaven Shall not give off their light; The sun shall be dark when it rises, And the moon shall diffuse no glow.

content: 11 “And I will requite to the world its evil, And to the wicked their iniquity; I will put an end to the pride of the arrogant And humble the haughtiness of tyrants.
content_old: 11 “And I will requite to the world its evil, And to the wicked their iniquity; I will put an end to the pride of the arrogant And humble the haughtiness of tyrants.

content: 12 I will make people scarcer than fine gold, And men than gold of Ophir.”
content_old: 12 I will make people scarcer than fine gold, And men than gold of Ophir.”

content: 13 Therefore shall heaven be shaken, And earth leap out of its place, At the fury of the LORD of Hosts On the day of His burning wrath.
content_old: 13 Therefore shall heaven be shaken, And earth leap out of its place, At the fury of the LORD of Hosts On the day of His burning wrath.

content: 14 Then like gazelles that are chased, And like sheep that no man gathers, Each man shall turn back to his people, They shall flee every one to his land.
content_old: 14 Then like gazelles that are chased, And like sheep that no man gathers, Each man shall turn back to his people, They shall flee every one to his land.

content: 15 All who remain shall be pierced through, All who are caught Shall fall by the sword.
content_old: 15 All who remain shall be pierced through, All who are caught Shall fall by the sword.

content: 16 And their babes shall be dashed to pieces in their sight, Their homes shall be plundered, And their wives shall be raped.
content_old: 16 And their babes shall be dashed to pieces in their sight, Their homes shall be plundered, And their wives shall be raped.

content: 17 “Behold, I stir up the Medes against them, Who do not value silver Or delight in gold.
content_old: 17 “Behold, I stir up the Medes against them, Who do not value silver Or delight in gold.

content: 18 Their bows shall shatter the young; They shall show no pity to infants, They shall not spare the children.”
content_old: 18 Their bows shall shatter the young; They shall show no pity to infants, They shall not spare the children.”

content: 19 And Babylon, glory of kingdoms, Proud splendor of the Chaldeans, Shall become like Sodom and Gomorrah Overturned by God.
content_old: 19 And Babylon, glory of kingdoms, Proud splendor of the Chaldeans, Shall become like Sodom and Gomorrah Overturned by God.

content: 20 Nevermore shall it be settled Nor dwelt in through all the ages. No Arab shall pitch his tent there, No shepherds make flocks lie down there.
content_old: 20 Nevermore shall it be settled Nor dwelt in through all the ages. No Arab shall pitch his tent there, No shepherds make flocks lie down there.

content: 21 But beasts shall lie down there, And the houses be filled with owls; There shall ostriches make their home, And there shall satyrs dance.
content_old: 21 But beasts shall lie down there, And the houses be filled with owls; There shall ostriches make their home, And there shall satyrs dance.

content: 1 But the LORD will pardon Jacob, and will again choose Israel, and will settle them on their own soil. And strangers shall join them and shall cleave to the House of Jacob.
content_old: 1 But the LORD will pardon Jacob, and will again choose Israel, and will settle them on their own soil. And strangers shall join them and shall cleave to the House of Jacob.

content: 2 For peoples shall take them and bring them to their homeland; and the House of Israel shall possess them as slaves and handmaids on the soil of the LORD. They shall be captors of their captors and masters to their taskmasters.
content_old: 2 For peoples shall take them and bring them to their homeland; and the House of Israel shall possess them as slaves and handmaids on the soil of the LORD. They shall be captors of their captors and masters to their taskmasters.

content: 3 And when the LORD has given you rest from your sorrow and trouble, and from the hard service that you were made to serve,
content_old: 3 And when the LORD has given you rest from your sorrow and trouble, and from the hard service that you were made to serve,

content: 4 you shall recite this song of scorn over the king of Babylon: How is the taskmaster vanished, How is oppression ended!
content_old: 4 you shall recite this song of scorn over the king of Babylon: How is the taskmaster vanished, How is oppression ended!

content: 5 The LORD has broken the staff of the wicked, The rod of tyrants,
content_old: 5 The LORD has broken the staff of the wicked, The rod of tyrants,

content: 6 That smote peoples in wrath With stroke unceasing, That belabored nations in fury In relentless pursuit.
content_old: 6 That smote peoples in wrath With stroke unceasing, That belabored nations in fury In relentless pursuit.

content: 7 All the earth is calm, untroubled; Loudly it cheers.
content_old: 7 All the earth is calm, untroubled; Loudly it cheers.

content: 8 Even pines rejoice at your fate, And cedars of Lebanon: “Now that you have lain down, None shall come up to fell us.”
content_old: 8 Even pines rejoice at your fate, And cedars of Lebanon: “Now that you have lain down, None shall come up to fell us.”

content: 9 Sheol below was astir To greet your coming— Rousing for you the shades Of all earth’s chieftains, Raising from their thrones All the kings of nations.
content_old: 9 Sheol below was astir To greet your coming— Rousing for you the shades Of all earth’s chieftains, Raising from their thrones All the kings of nations.

content: 10 All speak up and say to you, “So you have been stricken as we were, You have become like us!
content_old: 10 All speak up and say to you, “So you have been stricken as we were, You have become like us!

content: 11 Your pomp is brought down to Sheol, And the strains of your lutes! Worms are to be your bed, Maggots your blanket!”
content_old: 11 Your pomp is brought down to Sheol, And the strains of your lutes! Worms are to be your bed, Maggots your blanket!”

content: 12 How are you fallen from heaven, O Shining One, son of Dawn! How are you felled to earth, O vanquisher of nations!
content_old: 12 How are you fallen from heaven, O Shining One, son of Dawn! How are you felled to earth, O vanquisher of nations!

content: 13 Once you thought in your heart, “I will climb to the sky; Higher than the stars of God I will set my throne. I will sit in the mount of assembly, On the summit of Zaphon:
content_old: 13 Once you thought in your heart, “I will climb to the sky; Higher than the stars of God I will set my throne. I will sit in the mount of assembly, On the summit of Zaphon:

content: 14 I will mount the back of a cloud— I will match the Most High.”
content_old: 14 I will mount the back of a cloud— I will match the Most High.”

content: 15 Instead, you are brought down to Sheol, To the bottom of the Pit.
content_old: 15 Instead, you are brought down to Sheol, To the bottom of the Pit.

content: 16 They who behold you stare; They peer at you closely: “Is this the man Who shook the earth, Who made realms tremble,
content_old: 16 They who behold you stare; They peer at you closely: “Is this the man Who shook the earth, Who made realms tremble,

content: 17 Who made the world like a waste And wrecked its towns, Who never released his prisoners to their homes?”
content_old: 17 Who made the world like a waste And wrecked its towns, Who never released his prisoners to their homes?”

content: 18 All the kings of nations Were laid, every one, in honor Each in his tomb;
content_old: 18 All the kings of nations Were laid, every one, in honor Each in his tomb;

content: 19 While you were left lying unburied, Like loathsome carrion, Like a trampled corpse the clothing of slain gashed by the sword Who sink to the very stones of the Pit.
content_old: 19 While you were left lying unburied, Like loathsome carrion, Like a trampled corpse the clothing of slain gashed by the sword Who sink to the very stones of the Pit.

content: 20 You shall not have a burial like them; Because you destroyed your country, Murdered your people. Let the breed of evildoers Nevermore be named!
content_old: 20 You shall not have a burial like them; Because you destroyed your country, Murdered your people. Let the breed of evildoers Nevermore be named!

content: 21 Prepare a slaughtering block for his sons Because of the guilt of their father. Let them not arise to possess the earth! Then the world’s face shall be covered with towns.
content_old: 21 Prepare a slaughtering block for his sons Because of the guilt of their father. Let them not arise to possess the earth! Then the world’s face shall be covered with towns.

content: 22 I will rise up against them—declares the LORD of Hosts—and will wipe out from Babylon name and remnant, kith and kin—declares the LORD—
content_old: 22 I will rise up against them—declares the LORD of Hosts—and will wipe out from Babylon name and remnant, kith and kin—declares the LORD—

content: 23 and I will make it a home of bitterns, pools of water. I will sweep it with a broom of extermination—declares the LORD of Hosts.
content_old: 23 and I will make it a home of bitterns, pools of water. I will sweep it with a broom of extermination—declares the LORD of Hosts.

content: 24 The LORD of Hosts has sworn this oath: “As I have designed, so shall it happen; What I have planned, that shall come to pass:
content_old: 24 The LORD of Hosts has sworn this oath: “As I have designed, so shall it happen; What I have planned, that shall come to pass:

content: 25 To break Assyria in My land, To crush him on My mountain.” And his yoke shall drop off them, And his burden shall drop from their backs.
content_old: 25 To break Assyria in My land, To crush him on My mountain.” And his yoke shall drop off them, And his burden shall drop from their backs.

content: 26 That is the plan that is planned For all the earth; That is why an arm is poised Over all the nations.
content_old: 26 That is the plan that is planned For all the earth; That is why an arm is poised Over all the nations.
