content: 27 For the LORD of Hosts has planned, Who then can foil it? It is His arm that is poised, And who can stay it?
content_old: 27 For the LORD of Hosts has planned, Who then can foil it? It is His arm that is poised, And who can stay it?

content: 28 This pronouncement was made in the year that King Ahaz died:
content_old: 28 This pronouncement was made in the year that King Ahaz died:

content: 29 Rejoice not, all Philistia, Because the staff of him that beat you is broken. For from the stock of a snake there sprouts an asp, A flying seraph branches out from it.
content_old: 29 Rejoice not, all Philistia, Because the staff of him that beat you is broken. For from the stock of a snake there sprouts an asp, A flying seraph branches out from it.

content: 30 The first-born of the poor shall graze And the destitute lie down secure. I will kill your stock by famine, And it shall slay the very last of you.
content_old: 30 The first-born of the poor shall graze And the destitute lie down secure. I will kill your stock by famine, And it shall slay the very last of you.

content: 31 Howl, O gate; cry out, O city; Quake, all Philistia! For a stout one is coming from the north And there is no straggler in his ranks.
content_old: 31 Howl, O gate; cry out, O city; Quake, all Philistia! For a stout one is coming from the north And there is no straggler in his ranks.

content: 1 The “Moab” Pronouncement. Ah, in the night Ar was sacked, Moab was ruined; Ah, in the night Kir was sacked, Moab was ruined.
content_old: 1 The “Moab” Pronouncement. Ah, in the night Ar was sacked, Moab was ruined; Ah, in the night Kir was sacked, Moab was ruined.

content: 2 He went up to the temple to weep, Dibon to the outdoor shrines. Over Nebo and Medeba Moab is wailing; On every head is baldness, Every beard is shorn.
content_old: 2 He went up to the temple to weep, Dibon to the outdoor shrines. Over Nebo and Medeba Moab is wailing; On every head is baldness, Every beard is shorn.

content: 3 In its streets, they are girt with sackcloth; On its roofs, in its squares, Everyone is wailing, Streaming with tears.
content_old: 3 In its streets, they are girt with sackcloth; On its roofs, in its squares, Everyone is wailing, Streaming with tears.

content: 4 Heshbon and Elealeh cry out, Their voice carries to Jahaz. Therefore, The shock troops of Moab shout, His body is convulsed.
content_old: 4 Heshbon and Elealeh cry out, Their voice carries to Jahaz. Therefore, The shock troops of Moab shout, His body is convulsed.

content: 5 My heart cries out for Moab— His fugitives flee down to Zoar, To Eglath-shelishiyah. For the ascent of Luhith They ascend with weeping; On the road to Horonaim They raise a cry of anguish.
content_old: 5 My heart cries out for Moab— His fugitives flee down to Zoar, To Eglath-shelishiyah. For the ascent of Luhith They ascend with weeping; On the road to Horonaim They raise a cry of anguish.

content: 6 Ah, the waters of Nimrim Are become a desolation; The grass is sear, The herbage is gone, Vegetation is vanished.
content_old: 6 Ah, the waters of Nimrim Are become a desolation; The grass is sear, The herbage is gone, Vegetation is vanished.

content: 7 Therefore, The gains they have made, and their stores, They carry to the Wadi of Willows.
content_old: 7 Therefore, The gains they have made, and their stores, They carry to the Wadi of Willows.

content: 8 Ah, the cry has compassed The country of Moab: All the way to Eglaim her wailing, Even at Beer-elim her wailing!
content_old: 8 Ah, the cry has compassed The country of Moab: All the way to Eglaim her wailing, Even at Beer-elim her wailing!

content: 1 Dispatch as messenger The ruler of the land, From Sela in the wilderness To the mount of Fair Zion:
content_old: 1 Dispatch as messenger The ruler of the land, From Sela in the wilderness To the mount of Fair Zion:

content: 2 “Like fugitive birds, Like nestlings driven away, Moab’s villagers linger By the fords of the Arnon.
content_old: 2 “Like fugitive birds, Like nestlings driven away, Moab’s villagers linger By the fords of the Arnon.

content: 3 Give advice, Offer counsel. At high noon make Your shadow like night: Conceal the outcasts, Betray not the fugitives.
content_old: 3 Give advice, Offer counsel. At high noon make Your shadow like night: Conceal the outcasts, Betray not the fugitives.

content: 4 Let Moab’s outcasts Find asylum in you; Be a shelter for them Against the despoiler.” For violence has vanished, Rapine is ended, And marauders have perished from this land.
content_old: 4 Let Moab’s outcasts Find asylum in you; Be a shelter for them Against the despoiler.” For violence has vanished, Rapine is ended, And marauders have perished from this land.

content: 5 And a throne shall be established in goodness In the tent of David, And on it shall sit in faithfulness A ruler devoted to justice And zealous for equity.
content_old: 5 And a throne shall be established in goodness In the tent of David, And on it shall sit in faithfulness A ruler devoted to justice And zealous for equity.

content: 6 “We have heard of Moab’s pride— Most haughty is he— Of his pride and haughtiness and arrogance, And of the iniquity in him.”
content_old: 6 “We have heard of Moab’s pride— Most haughty is he— Of his pride and haughtiness and arrogance, And of the iniquity in him.”

content: 7 Ah, let Moab howl; Let all in Moab howl! For the raisin-cakes of Kir-hareseth You shall moan most pitifully.
content_old: 7 Ah, let Moab howl; Let all in Moab howl! For the raisin-cakes of Kir-hareseth You shall moan most pitifully.

content: 8 The vineyards of Heshbon are withered, And the vines of Sibmah; Their tendrils spread To Baale-goiim, And reached to Jazer, And strayed to the desert; Their shoots spread out And crossed the sea.
content_old: 8 The vineyards of Heshbon are withered, And the vines of Sibmah; Their tendrils spread To Baale-goiim, And reached to Jazer, And strayed to the desert; Their shoots spread out And crossed the sea.

content: 9 Therefore, As I weep for Jazer, So I weep for Sibmah’s vines; O Heshbon and Elealeh, I drench you with my tears. Ended are the shouts Over your fig and grain harvests.
content_old: 9 Therefore, As I weep for Jazer, So I weep for Sibmah’s vines; O Heshbon and Elealeh, I drench you with my tears. Ended are the shouts Over your fig and grain harvests.

content: 10 Rejoicing and gladness Are gone from the farm land; In the vineyards no shouting Or cheering is heard. No more does the treader Tread wine in the presses— The shouts have been silenced.
content_old: 10 Rejoicing and gladness Are gone from the farm land; In the vineyards no shouting Or cheering is heard. No more does the treader Tread wine in the presses— The shouts have been silenced.

content: 11 Therefore, Like a lyre my heart moans for Moab, And my very soul for Kir-heres.
content_old: 11 Therefore, Like a lyre my heart moans for Moab, And my very soul for Kir-heres.

content: 12 And when it has become apparent that Moab has gained nothing in the outdoor shrine, he shall come to pray in his temple—but to no avail.
content_old: 12 And when it has become apparent that Moab has gained nothing in the outdoor shrine, he shall come to pray in his temple—but to no avail.

content: 13 That is the word that the LORD spoke concerning Moab long ago.
content_old: 13 That is the word that the LORD spoke concerning Moab long ago.

content: 1 The “Damascus” Pronouncement. Behold, Damascus shall cease to be a city; It shall become a heap of ruins.
content_old: 1 The “Damascus” Pronouncement. Behold, Damascus shall cease to be a city; It shall become a heap of ruins.

content: 2 The towns of Aroer shall be deserted; They shall be a place for flocks To lie down, with none disturbing.
content_old: 2 The towns of Aroer shall be deserted; They shall be a place for flocks To lie down, with none disturbing.

content: 3 Fortresses shall cease from Ephraim, And sovereignty from Damascus; The remnant of Aram shall become Like the mass of Israelites —declares the LORD of Hosts.
content_old: 3 Fortresses shall cease from Ephraim, And sovereignty from Damascus; The remnant of Aram shall become Like the mass of Israelites —declares the LORD of Hosts.

content: 4 In that day, The mass of Jacob shall dwindle, And the fatness of his body become lean:
content_old: 4 In that day, The mass of Jacob shall dwindle, And the fatness of his body become lean:

content: 5 After being like the standing grain Harvested by the reaper— Who reaps ears by the armful— He shall be like the ears that are gleaned In the Valley of Rephaim.
content_old: 5 After being like the standing grain Harvested by the reaper— Who reaps ears by the armful— He shall be like the ears that are gleaned In the Valley of Rephaim.

content: 6 Only gleanings shall be left of him, As when one beats an olive tree: Two berries or three on the topmost branch, Four or five on the boughs of the crown —declares the LORD, the God of Israel.
content_old: 6 Only gleanings shall be left of him, As when one beats an olive tree: Two berries or three on the topmost branch, Four or five on the boughs of the crown —declares the LORD, the God of Israel.

content: 7 In that day, men shall turn to their Maker, their eyes look to the Holy One of Israel;
content_old: 7 In that day, men shall turn to their Maker, their eyes look to the Holy One of Israel;

content: 8 they shall not turn to the altars that their own hands made, or look to the sacred posts and incense stands that their own fingers wrought.
content_old: 8 they shall not turn to the altars that their own hands made, or look to the sacred posts and incense stands that their own fingers wrought.

content: 9 In that day, their fortress cities shall be like the deserted sites which the Horesh and the Amir abandoned because of the Israelites; and there shall be desolation.
content_old: 9 In that day, their fortress cities shall be like the deserted sites which the Horesh and the Amir abandoned because of the Israelites; and there shall be desolation.

content: 10 Truly, you have forgotten the God who saves you And have not remembered the Rock who shelters you; That is why, though you plant a delightful sapling, What you sow proves a disappointing slip.
content_old: 10 Truly, you have forgotten the God who saves you And have not remembered the Rock who shelters you; That is why, though you plant a delightful sapling, What you sow proves a disappointing slip.

content: 11 On the day that you plant, you see it grow; On the morning you sow, you see it bud— But the branches wither away On a day of sickness and mortal agony.
content_old: 11 On the day that you plant, you see it grow; On the morning you sow, you see it bud— But the branches wither away On a day of sickness and mortal agony.

content: 12 Ah, the roar of many peoples That roar as roars the sea, The rage of nations that rage As rage the mighty waters—
content_old: 12 Ah, the roar of many peoples That roar as roars the sea, The rage of nations that rage As rage the mighty waters—

content: 13 Nations raging like massive waters! But He shouts at them, and they flee far away, Driven like chaff before winds in the hills, And like tumbleweed before a gale.
content_old: 13 Nations raging like massive waters! But He shouts at them, and they flee far away, Driven like chaff before winds in the hills, And like tumbleweed before a gale.

content: 1 Ah, land in the deep shadow of wings, Beyond the rivers of Nubia!
content_old: 1 Ah, land in the deep shadow of wings, Beyond the rivers of Nubia!

content: 2 Go, swift messengers, To a nation far and remote, To a people thrust forth and away— A nation of gibber and chatter— Whose land is cut off by streams; Which sends out envoys by sea, In papyrus vessels upon the water!
content_old: 2 Go, swift messengers, To a nation far and remote, To a people thrust forth and away— A nation of gibber and chatter— Whose land is cut off by streams; Which sends out envoys by sea, In papyrus vessels upon the water!

content: 3 “All you who live in the world And inhabit the earth, When a flag is raised in the hills, take note! When a ram’s horn is blown, give heed!”
content_old: 3 “All you who live in the world And inhabit the earth, When a flag is raised in the hills, take note! When a ram’s horn is blown, give heed!”

content: 4 For thus the LORD said to me: “I rest calm and confident in My habitation— Like a scorching heat upon sprouts, Like a rain-cloud in the heat of reaping time.”
content_old: 4 For thus the LORD said to me: “I rest calm and confident in My habitation— Like a scorching heat upon sprouts, Like a rain-cloud in the heat of reaping time.”

content: 5 For before the harvest, yet after the budding, When the blossom has hardened into berries, He will trim away the twigs with pruning hooks, And lop off the trailing branches.
content_old: 5 For before the harvest, yet after the budding, When the blossom has hardened into berries, He will trim away the twigs with pruning hooks, And lop off the trailing branches.

content: 6 They shall all be left To the kites of the hills And to the beasts of the earth; The kites shall summer on them And all the beasts of the earth shall winter on them.
content_old: 6 They shall all be left To the kites of the hills And to the beasts of the earth; The kites shall summer on them And all the beasts of the earth shall winter on them.

content: 1 The “Egypt” Pronouncement. Mounted on a swift cloud, The LORD will come to Egypt; Egypt’s idols shall tremble before Him, And the heart of the Egyptians shall sink within them.
content_old: 1 The “Egypt” Pronouncement. Mounted on a swift cloud, The LORD will come to Egypt; Egypt’s idols shall tremble before Him, And the heart of the Egyptians shall sink within them.

content: 2 “I will incite Egyptian against Egyptian: They shall war with each other, Every man with his fellow, City with city And kingdom with kingdom.
content_old: 2 “I will incite Egyptian against Egyptian: They shall war with each other, Every man with his fellow, City with city And kingdom with kingdom.

content: 3 Egypt shall be drained of spirit, And I will confound its plans; So they will consult the idols and the shades And the ghosts and the familiar spirits.
content_old: 3 Egypt shall be drained of spirit, And I will confound its plans; So they will consult the idols and the shades And the ghosts and the familiar spirits.

content: 4 And I will place the Egyptians At the mercy of a harsh master, And a ruthless king shall rule them” —declares the Sovereign, the LORD of Hosts.
content_old: 4 And I will place the Egyptians At the mercy of a harsh master, And a ruthless king shall rule them” —declares the Sovereign, the LORD of Hosts.

content: 5 Water shall fail from the seas, Rivers dry up and be parched,
content_old: 5 Water shall fail from the seas, Rivers dry up and be parched,

content: 6 Channels turn foul as they ebb, And Egypt’s canals run dry. Reed and rush shall decay,
content_old: 6 Channels turn foul as they ebb, And Egypt’s canals run dry. Reed and rush shall decay,

content: 7 And the Nile papyrus by the Nile-side And everything sown by the Nile Shall wither, blow away, and vanish.
content_old: 7 And the Nile papyrus by the Nile-side And everything sown by the Nile Shall wither, blow away, and vanish.

content: 8 The fishermen shall lament; All who cast lines in the Nile shall mourn, And those who spread nets on the water shall languish.
content_old: 8 The fishermen shall lament; All who cast lines in the Nile shall mourn, And those who spread nets on the water shall languish.

content: 9 The flax workers, too, shall be dismayed, Both carders and weavers chagrined.
content_old: 9 The flax workers, too, shall be dismayed, Both carders and weavers chagrined.

content: 10 Her foundations shall be crushed, And all who make dams shall be despondent.
content_old: 10 Her foundations shall be crushed, And all who make dams shall be despondent.

content: 11 Utter fools are the nobles of Tanis; The sagest of Pharaoh’s advisers absurd predictions. How can you say to Pharaoh, “I am a scion of sages, A scion of Kedemite kings”?
content_old: 11 Utter fools are the nobles of Tanis; The sagest of Pharaoh’s advisers absurd predictions. How can you say to Pharaoh, “I am a scion of sages, A scion of Kedemite kings”?

content: 12 Where, indeed, are your sages? Let them tell you, let them discover What the LORD of Hosts has planned against Egypt.
content_old: 12 Where, indeed, are your sages? Let them tell you, let them discover What the LORD of Hosts has planned against Egypt.

content: 13 The nobles of Tanis have been fools, The nobles of Memphis deluded; Egypt has been led astray By the chiefs of her tribes.
content_old: 13 The nobles of Tanis have been fools, The nobles of Memphis deluded; Egypt has been led astray By the chiefs of her tribes.

content: 14 The LORD has mixed within her A spirit of distortion, Which shall lead Egypt astray in all her undertakings As a vomiting drunkard goes astray;
content_old: 14 The LORD has mixed within her A spirit of distortion, Which shall lead Egypt astray in all her undertakings As a vomiting drunkard goes astray;

content: 15 Nothing shall be achieved in Egypt By either head or tail, Palm branch or reed.
content_old: 15 Nothing shall be achieved in Egypt By either head or tail, Palm branch or reed.

content: 16 In that day, the Egyptians shall be like women, trembling and terrified because the LORD of Hosts will raise His hand against them.
content_old: 16 In that day, the Egyptians shall be like women, trembling and terrified because the LORD of Hosts will raise His hand against them.

content: 17 And the land of Judah shall also be the dread of the Egyptians; they shall quake whenever anybody mentions it to them, because of what the LORD of Hosts is planning against them.
content_old: 17 And the land of Judah shall also be the dread of the Egyptians; they shall quake whenever anybody mentions it to them, because of what the LORD of Hosts is planning against them.

content: 18 In that day, there shall be several towns in the land of Egypt speaking the language of Canaan and swearing loyalty to the LORD of Hosts; one shall be called Town of Heres.
content_old: 18 In that day, there shall be several towns in the land of Egypt speaking the language of Canaan and swearing loyalty to the LORD of Hosts; one shall be called Town of Heres.

content: 19 In that day, there shall be an altar to the LORD inside the land of Egypt and a pillar to the LORD at its border.
content_old: 19 In that day, there shall be an altar to the LORD inside the land of Egypt and a pillar to the LORD at its border.

content: 20 They shall serve as a symbol and reminder of the LORD of Hosts in the land of Egypt, so that when the Egyptians cry out to the LORD against oppressors, He will send them a savior and champion to deliver them.
content_old: 20 They shall serve as a symbol and reminder of the LORD of Hosts in the land of Egypt, so that when the Egyptians cry out to the LORD against oppressors, He will send them a savior and champion to deliver them.

content: 21 For the LORD will make Himself known to the Egyptians, and the Egyptians shall acknowledge the LORD in that day, and they shall serve with sacrifice and oblation and shall make vows to the LORD and fulfill them.
content_old: 21 For the LORD will make Himself known to the Egyptians, and the Egyptians shall acknowledge the LORD in that day, and they shall serve with sacrifice and oblation and shall make vows to the LORD and fulfill them.

content: 22 The LORD will first afflict and then heal the Egyptians; when they turn back to the LORD, He will respond to their entreaties and heal them.
content_old: 22 The LORD will first afflict and then heal the Egyptians; when they turn back to the LORD, He will respond to their entreaties and heal them.

content: 23 In that day, there shall be a highway from Egypt to Assyria. The Assyrians shall join with the Egyptians and Egyptians with the Assyrians, and then the Egyptians together with the Assyrians shall serve.
content_old: 23 In that day, there shall be a highway from Egypt to Assyria. The Assyrians shall join with the Egyptians and Egyptians with the Assyrians, and then the Egyptians together with the Assyrians shall serve.

content: 24 In that day, Israel shall be a third partner with Egypt and Assyria as a blessing on earth;
content_old: 24 In that day, Israel shall be a third partner with Egypt and Assyria as a blessing on earth;

content: 1 It was the year that the Tartan came to Ashdod—being sent by King Sargon of Assyria—and attacked Ashdod and took it.
content_old: 1 It was the year that the Tartan came to Ashdod—being sent by King Sargon of Assyria—and attacked Ashdod and took it.

content: 2 Previously, the LORD had spoken to Isaiah son of Amoz, saying, “Go, untie the sackcloth from your loins and take your sandals off your feet,” which he had done, going naked and barefoot.
content_old: 2 Previously, the LORD had spoken to Isaiah son of Amoz, saying, “Go, untie the sackcloth from your loins and take your sandals off your feet,” which he had done, going naked and barefoot.

content: 3 And now the LORD said, “It is a sign and a portent for Egypt and Nubia. Just as My servant Isaiah has gone naked and barefoot for three years,
content_old: 3 And now the LORD said, “It is a sign and a portent for Egypt and Nubia. Just as My servant Isaiah has gone naked and barefoot for three years,

content: 4 so shall the king of Assyria drive off the captives of Egypt and the exiles of Nubia, young and old, naked and barefoot and with bared buttocks—to the shame of Egypt!
content_old: 4 so shall the king of Assyria drive off the captives of Egypt and the exiles of Nubia, young and old, naked and barefoot and with bared buttocks—to the shame of Egypt!

content: 5 And they shall be dismayed and chagrined because of Nubia their hope and Egypt their boast.
content_old: 5 And they shall be dismayed and chagrined because of Nubia their hope and Egypt their boast.

content: 1 The “Desert of the Sea” Pronouncement. Like the gales That race through the Negeb, It comes from the desert, The terrible land.
content_old: 1 The “Desert of the Sea” Pronouncement. Like the gales That race through the Negeb, It comes from the desert, The terrible land.

content: 2 A harsh prophecy Has been announced to me: “The betrayer is betraying, The ravager ravaging. Advance, Elam! Lay siege, Media! I have put an end To all her sighing.”
content_old: 2 A harsh prophecy Has been announced to me: “The betrayer is betraying, The ravager ravaging. Advance, Elam! Lay siege, Media! I have put an end To all her sighing.”

content: 3 Therefore my loins Are seized with trembling; I am gripped by pangs Like a woman in travail, Too anguished to hear, Too frightened to see.
content_old: 3 Therefore my loins Are seized with trembling; I am gripped by pangs Like a woman in travail, Too anguished to hear, Too frightened to see.

content: 4 My mind is confused, I shudder in panic. My night of pleasure He has turned to terror:
content_old: 4 My mind is confused, I shudder in panic. My night of pleasure He has turned to terror:

content: 5 “Set the table!” To “Let the watchman watch!” “Eat and drink!” To “Up, officers! grease the shields!”
content_old: 5 “Set the table!” To “Let the watchman watch!” “Eat and drink!” To “Up, officers! grease the shields!”

content: 6 For thus my LORD said to me: “Go, set up a sentry; Let him announce what he sees.
content_old: 6 For thus my LORD said to me: “Go, set up a sentry; Let him announce what he sees.

content: 7 He will see mounted men, Horsemen in pairs— Riders on asses, Riders on camels— And he will listen closely, Most attentively.”
content_old: 7 He will see mounted men, Horsemen in pairs— Riders on asses, Riders on camels— And he will listen closely, Most attentively.”

content: 8 And like a lion he called out: “On my Lord��s lookout I stand Ever by day, And at my post I watch Every night.
content_old: 8 And like a lion he called out: “On my Lord��s lookout I stand Ever by day, And at my post I watch Every night.

content: 9 And there they come, mounted men— Horsemen in pairs!” Then he spoke up and said, “Fallen, fallen is Babylon, And all the images of her gods Have crashed to the ground!”
content_old: 9 And there they come, mounted men— Horsemen in pairs!” Then he spoke up and said, “Fallen, fallen is Babylon, And all the images of her gods Have crashed to the ground!”

content: 10 My threshing, the product of my threshing floor: What I have heard from the LORD of Hosts, The God of Israel— That I have told to you.
content_old: 10 My threshing, the product of my threshing floor: What I have heard from the LORD of Hosts, The God of Israel— That I have told to you.

content: 11 The “Dumah” Pronouncement. A call comes to me from Seir: “Watchman, what of the night? Watchman, what of the night?”
content_old: 11 The “Dumah” Pronouncement. A call comes to me from Seir: “Watchman, what of the night? Watchman, what of the night?”

content: 12 The watchman replied, “Morning came, and so did night. If you would inquire, inquire. Come back again.”
content_old: 12 The watchman replied, “Morning came, and so did night. If you would inquire, inquire. Come back again.”

content: 13 The “In the Steppe” Pronouncement. In the scrub, in the steppe, you will lodge, O caravans of the Dedanites!
content_old: 13 The “In the Steppe” Pronouncement. In the scrub, in the steppe, you will lodge, O caravans of the Dedanites!

content: 14 Meet the thirsty with water, You who dwell in the land of Tema; Greet the fugitive with bread.
content_old: 14 Meet the thirsty with water, You who dwell in the land of Tema; Greet the fugitive with bread.

content: 15 For they have fled before swords: Before the whetted sword, Before the bow that was drawn, Before the stress of war.
content_old: 15 For they have fled before swords: Before the whetted sword, Before the bow that was drawn, Before the stress of war.

content: 16 For thus my Lord has said to me: “In another year, fixed like the years of a hired laborer, all the multitude of Kedar shall vanish;
content_old: 16 For thus my Lord has said to me: “In another year, fixed like the years of a hired laborer, all the multitude of Kedar shall vanish;

content: 1 The “Valley of Vision” Pronouncement. What can have happened to you That you have gone, all of you, up on the roofs,
content_old: 1 The “Valley of Vision” Pronouncement. What can have happened to you That you have gone, all of you, up on the roofs,

content: 2 O you who were full of tumult, You clamorous town, You city so gay? Your slain are not the slain of the sword Nor the dead of battle.
content_old: 2 O you who were full of tumult, You clamorous town, You city so gay? Your slain are not the slain of the sword Nor the dead of battle.

content: 3 Your officers have all departed, They fled far away; Your survivors were all taken captive, Taken captive without their bows.
content_old: 3 Your officers have all departed, They fled far away; Your survivors were all taken captive, Taken captive without their bows.

content: 4 That is why I say, “Let me be, I will weep bitterly. Press not to comfort me For the ruin of my poor people.”
content_old: 4 That is why I say, “Let me be, I will weep bitterly. Press not to comfort me For the ruin of my poor people.”

content: 5 For my Lord GOD of Hosts had a day Of tumult and din and confusion— Kir raged in the Valley of Vision, And Shoa on the hill;
content_old: 5 For my Lord GOD of Hosts had a day Of tumult and din and confusion— Kir raged in the Valley of Vision, And Shoa on the hill;

content: 6 While Elam bore the quiver In troops of mounted men, And Kir bared the shield—
content_old: 6 While Elam bore the quiver In troops of mounted men, And Kir bared the shield—

content: 7 And your choicest lowlands Were filled with chariots and horsemen: They stormed at Judah’s gateway
content_old: 7 And your choicest lowlands Were filled with chariots and horsemen: They stormed at Judah’s gateway

content: 8 And pressed beyond its screen. You gave thought on that day To the arms in the Forest House,
content_old: 8 And pressed beyond its screen. You gave thought on that day To the arms in the Forest House,

content: 9 And you took note of the many breaches In the City of David.
content_old: 9 And you took note of the many breaches In the City of David.

content: 10 And you collected the water of the Lower Pool; and you counted the houses of Jerusalem and pulled houses down to fortify the wall;
content_old: 10 And you collected the water of the Lower Pool; and you counted the houses of Jerusalem and pulled houses down to fortify the wall;

content: 11 and you constructed a basin between the two walls for the water of the old pool. But you gave no thought to Him who planned it, You took no note of Him who designed it long before.
content_old: 11 and you constructed a basin between the two walls for the water of the old pool. But you gave no thought to Him who planned it, You took no note of Him who designed it long before.

content: 12 My Lord GOD of Hosts summoned on that day To weeping and lamenting, To tonsuring and girding with sackcloth.
content_old: 12 My Lord GOD of Hosts summoned on that day To weeping and lamenting, To tonsuring and girding with sackcloth.

content: 13 Instead, there was rejoicing and merriment, Killing of cattle and slaughtering of sheep, Eating of meat and drinking of wine: “Eat and drink, for tomorrow we die!”
content_old: 13 Instead, there was rejoicing and merriment, Killing of cattle and slaughtering of sheep, Eating of meat and drinking of wine: “Eat and drink, for tomorrow we die!”

content: 14 Then the LORD of Hosts revealed Himself to my ears: “This iniquity shall never be forgiven you Until you die,” said my Lord GOD of Hosts.
content_old: 14 Then the LORD of Hosts revealed Himself to my ears: “This iniquity shall never be forgiven you Until you die,” said my Lord GOD of Hosts.

content: 15 Thus said my Lord GOD of Hosts: Go in to see that steward, that Shebna, in charge of the palace:
content_old: 15 Thus said my Lord GOD of Hosts: Go in to see that steward, that Shebna, in charge of the palace:

content: 16 What have you here, and whom have you here, That you have hewn out a tomb for yourself here?— O you who have hewn your tomb on high; O you who have hollowed out for yourself an abode in the cliff!
content_old: 16 What have you here, and whom have you here, That you have hewn out a tomb for yourself here?— O you who have hewn your tomb on high; O you who have hollowed out for yourself an abode in the cliff!

content: 17 The LORD is about to shake you Severely, fellow, and then wrap you around Himself.
content_old: 17 The LORD is about to shake you Severely, fellow, and then wrap you around Himself.

content: 18 Indeed, He will wind you about Him as a headdress, a turban. Off to a broad land! There shall you die, and there shall be the chariots bearing your body, O shame of your master’s house!
content_old: 18 Indeed, He will wind you about Him as a headdress, a turban. Off to a broad land! There shall you die, and there shall be the chariots bearing your body, O shame of your master’s house!

content: 19 For I will hurl you from your station And you shall be torn down from your stand.
content_old: 19 For I will hurl you from your station And you shall be torn down from your stand.

content: 20 And in that day, I will summon My servant Eliakim son of Hilkiah,
content_old: 20 And in that day, I will summon My servant Eliakim son of Hilkiah,

content: 21 and I will invest him with your tunic, gird him with your sash, and deliver your authority into his hand; and he shall be a father to the inhabitants of Jerusalem and the men of Judah.
content_old: 21 and I will invest him with your tunic, gird him with your sash, and deliver your authority into his hand; and he shall be a father to the inhabitants of Jerusalem and the men of Judah.

content: 22 I will place the keys of David’s palace on his shoulders; and what he unlocks none may shut, and what he locks none may open.
content_old: 22 I will place the keys of David’s palace on his shoulders; and what he unlocks none may shut, and what he locks none may open.

content: 23 He shall be a seat of honor to his father’s household. I will fix him as a peg in a firm place,
content_old: 23 He shall be a seat of honor to his father’s household. I will fix him as a peg in a firm place,

content: 24 on which all the substance of his father’s household shall be hung: the sprouts and the leaves—all the small vessels, from bowls to all sorts of jars.
content_old: 24 on which all the substance of his father’s household shall be hung: the sprouts and the leaves—all the small vessels, from bowls to all sorts of jars.

content: 1 The “Tyre” Pronouncement. Howl, you ships of Tarshish! For havoc has been wrought, not a house is left; As they came from the land of Kittim, This was revealed to them.
content_old: 1 The “Tyre” Pronouncement. Howl, you ships of Tarshish! For havoc has been wrought, not a house is left; As they came from the land of Kittim, This was revealed to them.

content: 2 Moan, you coastland dwellers, You traders of Sidon, Once thronged by seafarers,
content_old: 2 Moan, you coastland dwellers, You traders of Sidon, Once thronged by seafarers,

content: 3 Over many waters Your revenue came: From the trade of nations, From the grain of Shihor, The harvest of the Nile.
content_old: 3 Over many waters Your revenue came: From the trade of nations, From the grain of Shihor, The harvest of the Nile.

content: 4 Be ashamed, O Sidon! For the sea—this stronghold of the sea—declares, “I am as one who has never labored, Never given birth, Never raised youths Or reared maidens!”
content_old: 4 Be ashamed, O Sidon! For the sea—this stronghold of the sea—declares, “I am as one who has never labored, Never given birth, Never raised youths Or reared maidens!”

content: 5 When the Egyptians heard it, they quailed As when they heard about Tyre.
content_old: 5 When the Egyptians heard it, they quailed As when they heard about Tyre.

content: 6 Pass on to Tarshish— Howl, you coastland dwellers!
content_old: 6 Pass on to Tarshish— Howl, you coastland dwellers!

content: 7 Was such your merry city In former times, of yore? Did her feet carry her off To sojourn far away?
content_old: 7 Was such your merry city In former times, of yore? Did her feet carry her off To sojourn far away?

content: 8 Who was it that planned this For crown-wearing Tyre, Whose merchants were nobles, Whose traders the world honored?
content_old: 8 Who was it that planned this For crown-wearing Tyre, Whose merchants were nobles, Whose traders the world honored?

content: 9 The LORD of Hosts planned it— To defile all glorious beauty, To shame all the honored of the world.
content_old: 9 The LORD of Hosts planned it— To defile all glorious beauty, To shame all the honored of the world.

content: 10 Traverse your land like the Nile, Fair Tarshish; This is a harbor no more.
content_old: 10 Traverse your land like the Nile, Fair Tarshish; This is a harbor no more.

content: 11 The LORD poised His arm o’er the sea And made kingdoms quake; It was He decreed destruction For Phoenicia’s strongholds,
content_old: 11 The LORD poised His arm o’er the sea And made kingdoms quake; It was He decreed destruction For Phoenicia’s strongholds,

content: 12 And said, “You shall be gay no more, O plundered one, Fair Maiden Sidon. Up, cross over to Kittim— Even there you shall have no rest.”
content_old: 12 And said, “You shall be gay no more, O plundered one, Fair Maiden Sidon. Up, cross over to Kittim— Even there you shall have no rest.”

content: 13 Behold the land of Chaldea— This is the people that has ceased to be. Assyria, which founded it for ships, Which raised its watchtowers, Erected its ramparts, Has turned it into a ruin.
content_old: 13 Behold the land of Chaldea— This is the people that has ceased to be. Assyria, which founded it for ships, Which raised its watchtowers, Erected its ramparts, Has turned it into a ruin.

content: 14 Howl, O ships of Tarshish, For your stronghold is destroyed!
content_old: 14 Howl, O ships of Tarshish, For your stronghold is destroyed!

content: 15 In that day, Tyre shall remain forgotten for seventy years, equaling the lifetime of one king. After a lapse of seventy years, it shall go with Tyre as with the harlot in the ditty:
content_old: 15 In that day, Tyre shall remain forgotten for seventy years, equaling the lifetime of one king. After a lapse of seventy years, it shall go with Tyre as with the harlot in the ditty:

content: 16 Take a lyre, go about the town, Harlot long forgotten; Sweetly play, make much music, To bring you back to mind.
content_old: 16 Take a lyre, go about the town, Harlot long forgotten; Sweetly play, make much music, To bring you back to mind.

content: 17 For after a lapse of seventy years, the LORD will take note of Tyre, and she shall resume her “fee-taking” and “play the harlot” with all the kingdoms of the world, on the face of the earth.
content_old: 17 For after a lapse of seventy years, the LORD will take note of Tyre, and she shall resume her “fee-taking” and “play the harlot” with all the kingdoms of the world, on the face of the earth.

content: 1 Behold, The LORD will strip the earth bare, And lay it waste, And twist its surface, And scatter its inhabitants.
content_old: 1 Behold, The LORD will strip the earth bare, And lay it waste, And twist its surface, And scatter its inhabitants.

content: 2 Layman and priest shall fare alike, Slave and master, Handmaid and mistress, Buyer and seller, Lender and borrower, Creditor and debtor.
content_old: 2 Layman and priest shall fare alike, Slave and master, Handmaid and mistress, Buyer and seller, Lender and borrower, Creditor and debtor.

content: 3 The earth shall be bare, bare; It shall be plundered, plundered; For it is the LORD who spoke this word.
content_old: 3 The earth shall be bare, bare; It shall be plundered, plundered; For it is the LORD who spoke this word.

content: 4 The earth is withered, sear; The world languishes, it is sear; The most exalted people of the earth languish.
content_old: 4 The earth is withered, sear; The world languishes, it is sear; The most exalted people of the earth languish.

content: 5 For the earth was defiled Under its inhabitants; Because they transgressed teachings, Violated laws, Broke the ancient covenant.
content_old: 5 For the earth was defiled Under its inhabitants; Because they transgressed teachings, Violated laws, Broke the ancient covenant.

content: 6 That is why a curse consumes the earth, And its inhabitants pay the penalty; That is why earth’s dwellers have dwindled, And but few men are left.
content_old: 6 That is why a curse consumes the earth, And its inhabitants pay the penalty; That is why earth’s dwellers have dwindled, And but few men are left.

content: 7 The new wine fails, The vine languishes; And all the merry-hearted sigh.
content_old: 7 The new wine fails, The vine languishes; And all the merry-hearted sigh.

content: 8 Stilled is the merriment of timbrels, Ended the clamor of revelers, Stilled the merriment of lyres.
content_old: 8 Stilled is the merriment of timbrels, Ended the clamor of revelers, Stilled the merriment of lyres.

content: 9 They drink their wine without song; Liquor tastes bitter to the drinker.
content_old: 9 They drink their wine without song; Liquor tastes bitter to the drinker.

content: 10 Towns are broken, empty; Every house is shut, none enters;
content_old: 10 Towns are broken, empty; Every house is shut, none enters;

content: 11 Even over wine, a cry goes up in the streets: The sun has set on all joy, The gladness of the earth is banished.
content_old: 11 Even over wine, a cry goes up in the streets: The sun has set on all joy, The gladness of the earth is banished.

content: 12 Desolation is left in the town And the gate is battered to ruins.
content_old: 12 Desolation is left in the town And the gate is battered to ruins.

content: 13 For thus shall it be among the peoples In the midst of the earth: As when the olive tree is beaten out, Like gleanings when the vintage is over.
content_old: 13 For thus shall it be among the peoples In the midst of the earth: As when the olive tree is beaten out, Like gleanings when the vintage is over.

content: 14 These shall lift up their voices, Exult in the majesty of the LORD. They shall shout from the sea:
content_old: 14 These shall lift up their voices, Exult in the majesty of the LORD. They shall shout from the sea:

content: 15 Therefore, honor the LORD with lights In the coastlands of the sea— The name of the LORD, the God of Israel.
content_old: 15 Therefore, honor the LORD with lights In the coastlands of the sea— The name of the LORD, the God of Israel.

content: 16 From the end of the earth We hear singing: Glory to the righteous! And I said: I waste away! I waste away! Woe is me! The faithless have acted faithlessly; The faithless have broken faith!
content_old: 16 From the end of the earth We hear singing: Glory to the righteous! And I said: I waste away! I waste away! Woe is me! The faithless have acted faithlessly; The faithless have broken faith!

content: 17 Terror, and pit, and trap Upon you who dwell on earth!
content_old: 17 Terror, and pit, and trap Upon you who dwell on earth!

content: 18 He who flees at the report of the terror Shall fall into the pit; And he who climbs out of the pit Shall be caught in the trap. For sluices are opened on high, And earth’s foundations tremble.
content_old: 18 He who flees at the report of the terror Shall fall into the pit; And he who climbs out of the pit Shall be caught in the trap. For sluices are opened on high, And earth’s foundations tremble.

content: 19 The earth is breaking, breaking; The earth is crumbling, crumbling. The earth is tottering, tottering;
content_old: 19 The earth is breaking, breaking; The earth is crumbling, crumbling. The earth is tottering, tottering;

content: 20 The earth is swaying like a drunkard; It is rocking to and fro like a hut. Its iniquity shall weigh it down, And it shall fall, to rise no more.
content_old: 20 The earth is swaying like a drunkard; It is rocking to and fro like a hut. Its iniquity shall weigh it down, And it shall fall, to rise no more.

content: 21 In that day, the LORD will punish The host of heaven in heaven And the kings of the earth on earth.
content_old: 21 In that day, the LORD will punish The host of heaven in heaven And the kings of the earth on earth.

content: 22 They shall be gathered in a dungeon As captives are gathered; And shall be locked up in a prison. But after many days they shall be remembered.
content_old: 22 They shall be gathered in a dungeon As captives are gathered; And shall be locked up in a prison. But after many days they shall be remembered.

content: 1 O LORD, You are my God; I will extol You, I will praise Your name. For You planned graciousness of old, Counsels of steadfast faithfulness.
content_old: 1 O LORD, You are my God; I will extol You, I will praise Your name. For You planned graciousness of old, Counsels of steadfast faithfulness.

content: 2 For You have turned a city into a stone heap, A walled town into a ruin, The citadel of strangers into rubble, Never to be rebuilt.
content_old: 2 For You have turned a city into a stone heap, A walled town into a ruin, The citadel of strangers into rubble, Never to be rebuilt.

content: 3 Therefore a fierce people must honor You, A city of cruel nations must fear You.
content_old: 3 Therefore a fierce people must honor You, A city of cruel nations must fear You.

content: 4 For You have been a refuge for the poor man, A shelter for the needy man in his distress— Shelter from rainstorm, shade from heat. When the fury of tyrants was like a winter rainstorm,
content_old: 4 For You have been a refuge for the poor man, A shelter for the needy man in his distress— Shelter from rainstorm, shade from heat. When the fury of tyrants was like a winter rainstorm,

content: 5 The rage of strangers like heat in the desert, You subdued the heat with the shade of clouds, The singing of the tyrants was vanquished.
content_old: 5 The rage of strangers like heat in the desert, You subdued the heat with the shade of clouds, The singing of the tyrants was vanquished.

content: 6 The LORD of Hosts will make on this mount For all the peoples A banquet of rich viands, A banquet of choice wines— Of rich viands seasoned with marrow, Of choice wines well refined.
content_old: 6 The LORD of Hosts will make on this mount For all the peoples A banquet of rich viands, A banquet of choice wines— Of rich viands seasoned with marrow, Of choice wines well refined.

content: 7 And He will destroy on this mount the shroud That is drawn over the faces of all the peoples And the covering that is spread Over all the nations:
content_old: 7 And He will destroy on this mount the shroud That is drawn over the faces of all the peoples And the covering that is spread Over all the nations:

content: 8 He will destroy death forever. My Lord GOD will wipe the tears away From all faces And will put an end to the reproach of His people Over all the earth— For it is the LORD who has spoken.
content_old: 8 He will destroy death forever. My Lord GOD will wipe the tears away From all faces And will put an end to the reproach of His people Over all the earth— For it is the LORD who has spoken.

content: 9 In that day they shall say: This is our God; We trusted in Him, and He delivered us. This is the LORD, in whom we trusted; Let us rejoice and exult in His deliverance!
content_old: 9 In that day they shall say: This is our God; We trusted in Him, and He delivered us. This is the LORD, in whom we trusted; Let us rejoice and exult in His deliverance!

content: 10 For the hand of the LORD shall descend Upon this mount, And Moab shall be trampled under Him As straw is threshed to bits at Madmenah.
content_old: 10 For the hand of the LORD shall descend Upon this mount, And Moab shall be trampled under Him As straw is threshed to bits at Madmenah.

content: 11 Then He will spread out His hands in their homeland, As a swimmer spreads his hands out to swim, And He will humble their pride Along with the emblems of their power.
content_old: 11 Then He will spread out His hands in their homeland, As a swimmer spreads his hands out to swim, And He will humble their pride Along with the emblems of their power.

content: 1 In that day, this song shall be sung In the land of Judah: Ours is a mighty city; He makes victory our inner and outer wall.
content_old: 1 In that day, this song shall be sung In the land of Judah: Ours is a mighty city; He makes victory our inner and outer wall.

content: 2 Open the gates, and let A righteous nation enter, A nation that keeps faith.
content_old: 2 Open the gates, and let A righteous nation enter, A nation that keeps faith.

content: 3 The confident mind You guard in safety, In safety because it trusts in You.
content_old: 3 The confident mind You guard in safety, In safety because it trusts in You.

content: 4 Trust in the LORD for ever and ever, For in Yah the LORD you have an everlasting Rock.
content_old: 4 Trust in the LORD for ever and ever, For in Yah the LORD you have an everlasting Rock.

content: 5 For He has brought low those who dwelt high up, Has humbled the secure city, Humbled it to the ground, Leveled it with the dust—
content_old: 5 For He has brought low those who dwelt high up, Has humbled the secure city, Humbled it to the ground, Leveled it with the dust—

content: 6 To be trampled underfoot, By the feet of the needy, By the soles of the poor.
content_old: 6 To be trampled underfoot, By the feet of the needy, By the soles of the poor.

content: 7 The path is level for the righteous man; O Just One, You make smooth the course of the righteous.
content_old: 7 The path is level for the righteous man; O Just One, You make smooth the course of the righteous.

content: 8 For Your just ways, O LORD, we look to You; We long for the name by which You are called.
content_old: 8 For Your just ways, O LORD, we look to You; We long for the name by which You are called.

content: 9 At night I yearn for You with all my being, I seek You with all the spirit within me. For when Your judgments are wrought on earth, The inhabitants of the world learn righteousness.
content_old: 9 At night I yearn for You with all my being, I seek You with all the spirit within me. For when Your judgments are wrought on earth, The inhabitants of the world learn righteousness.

content: 10 But when the scoundrel is spared, he learns not righteousness; In a place of integrity, he does wrong— He ignores the majesty of the LORD.
content_old: 10 But when the scoundrel is spared, he learns not righteousness; In a place of integrity, he does wrong— He ignores the majesty of the LORD.

content: 11 O LORD! They see not Your hand exalted. Let them be shamed as they behold Your zeal for Your people And fire consuming Your adversaries.
content_old: 11 O LORD! They see not Your hand exalted. Let them be shamed as they behold Your zeal for Your people And fire consuming Your adversaries.

content: 12 O LORD! May You appoint well-being for us, Since You have also requited all our misdeeds.
content_old: 12 O LORD! May You appoint well-being for us, Since You have also requited all our misdeeds.

content: 13 O LORD our God! Lords other than You possessed us, But only Your name shall we utter.
content_old: 13 O LORD our God! Lords other than You possessed us, But only Your name shall we utter.

content: 14 They are dead, they can never live; Shades, they can never rise; Of a truth, You have dealt with them and wiped them out, Have put an end to all mention of them.
content_old: 14 They are dead, they can never live; Shades, they can never rise; Of a truth, You have dealt with them and wiped them out, Have put an end to all mention of them.

content: 15 When You added to the nation, O LORD, When You added to the nation, Extending all the boundaries of the land, You were honored.
content_old: 15 When You added to the nation, O LORD, When You added to the nation, Extending all the boundaries of the land, You were honored.

content: 16 O LORD! In their distress, they sought You; Your chastisement reduced them To anguished whispered prayer.
content_old: 16 O LORD! In their distress, they sought You; Your chastisement reduced them To anguished whispered prayer.

content: 17 Like a woman with child Approaching childbirth, Writhing and screaming in her pangs, So are we become because of You, O LORD.
content_old: 17 Like a woman with child Approaching childbirth, Writhing and screaming in her pangs, So are we become because of You, O LORD.

content: 18 We were with child, we writhed— It is as though we had given birth to wind; We have won no victory on earth; The inhabitants of the world have not come to life!
content_old: 18 We were with child, we writhed— It is as though we had given birth to wind; We have won no victory on earth; The inhabitants of the world have not come to life!

content: 19 Oh, let Your dead revive! Let corpses arise! Awake and shout for joy, You who dwell in the dust!— For Your dew is like the dew on fresh growth; You make the land of the shades come to life.
content_old: 19 Oh, let Your dead revive! Let corpses arise! Awake and shout for joy, You who dwell in the dust!— For Your dew is like the dew on fresh growth; You make the land of the shades come to life.

content: 20 Go, my people, enter your chambers, And lock your doors behind you. Hide but a little moment, Until the indignation passes.
content_old: 20 Go, my people, enter your chambers, And lock your doors behind you. Hide but a little moment, Until the indignation passes.

content: 1 In that day the LORD will punish, With His great, cruel, mighty sword Leviathan the Elusive Serpent— Leviathan the Twisting Serpent; He will slay the Dragon of the sea.
content_old: 1 In that day the LORD will punish, With His great, cruel, mighty sword Leviathan the Elusive Serpent— Leviathan the Twisting Serpent; He will slay the Dragon of the sea.

content: 2 In that day, They shall sing of it: “Vineyard of Delight.”
content_old: 2 In that day, They shall sing of it: “Vineyard of Delight.”

content: 3 I the LORD keep watch over it, I water it every moment; That no harm may befall it, I watch it night and day.
content_old: 3 I the LORD keep watch over it, I water it every moment; That no harm may befall it, I watch it night and day.

content: 4 There is no anger in Me: If one offers Me thorns and thistles, I will march to battle against him, And set all of them on fire.
content_old: 4 There is no anger in Me: If one offers Me thorns and thistles, I will march to battle against him, And set all of them on fire.

content: 5 But if he holds fast to My refuge, He makes Me his friend; He makes Me his friend.
content_old: 5 But if he holds fast to My refuge, He makes Me his friend; He makes Me his friend.

content: 6 In days to come Jacob shall strike root, Israel shall sprout and blossom, And the face of the world Shall be covered with fruit.
content_old: 6 In days to come Jacob shall strike root, Israel shall sprout and blossom, And the face of the world Shall be covered with fruit.

content: 7 Was he beaten as his beater has been? Did he suffer such slaughter as his slayers?
content_old: 7 Was he beaten as his beater has been? Did he suffer such slaughter as his slayers?

content: 8 Assailing them with fury unchained, His pitiless blast bore them off On a day of gale.
content_old: 8 Assailing them with fury unchained, His pitiless blast bore them off On a day of gale.

content: 9 Assuredly, by this alone Shall Jacob’s sin be purged away; This is the only price For removing his guilt: That he make all the altar-stones Like shattered blocks of chalk— With no sacred post left standing, Nor any incense altar.
content_old: 9 Assuredly, by this alone Shall Jacob’s sin be purged away; This is the only price For removing his guilt: That he make all the altar-stones Like shattered blocks of chalk— With no sacred post left standing, Nor any incense altar.

content: 10 Thus fortified cities lie desolate, Homesteads deserted, forsaken like a wilderness; There calves graze, there they lie down And consume its boughs.
content_old: 10 Thus fortified cities lie desolate, Homesteads deserted, forsaken like a wilderness; There calves graze, there they lie down And consume its boughs.

content: 11 When its crown is withered, they break; Women come and make fires with them. For they are a people without understanding; That is why Their Maker will show them no mercy, Their Creator will deny them grace.
content_old: 11 When its crown is withered, they break; Women come and make fires with them. For they are a people without understanding; That is why Their Maker will show them no mercy, Their Creator will deny them grace.

content: 12 And in that day, the LORD will beat out from the channel of the Euphrates to the Wadi of Egypt; and you shall be picked up one by one, O children of Israel!
content_old: 12 And in that day, the LORD will beat out from the channel of the Euphrates to the Wadi of Egypt; and you shall be picked up one by one, O children of Israel!

content: 1 Ah, the proud crowns of the drunkards of Ephraim, Whose glorious beauty is but wilted flowers On the heads of men bloated with rich food, Who are overcome by wine!
content_old: 1 Ah, the proud crowns of the drunkards of Ephraim, Whose glorious beauty is but wilted flowers On the heads of men bloated with rich food, Who are overcome by wine!

content: 2 Lo, my Lord has something strong and mighty, Like a storm of hail, A shower of pestilence. Something like a storm of massive, torrential rain Shall be hurled with force to the ground.
content_old: 2 Lo, my Lord has something strong and mighty, Like a storm of hail, A shower of pestilence. Something like a storm of massive, torrential rain Shall be hurled with force to the ground.

content: 3 Trampled underfoot shall be The proud crowns of the drunkards of Ephraim,
content_old: 3 Trampled underfoot shall be The proud crowns of the drunkards of Ephraim,

content: 4 The wilted flowers— On the heads of men bloated with rich food— That are his glorious beauty. They shall be like an early fig Before the fruit harvest; Whoever sees it devours it While it is still in his hand.
content_old: 4 The wilted flowers— On the heads of men bloated with rich food— That are his glorious beauty. They shall be like an early fig Before the fruit harvest; Whoever sees it devours it While it is still in his hand.

content: 5 In that day, the LORD of Hosts shall become a crown of beauty and a diadem of glory for the remnant of His people,
content_old: 5 In that day, the LORD of Hosts shall become a crown of beauty and a diadem of glory for the remnant of His people,

content: 6 and a spirit of judgment for him who sits in judgment and of valor for those who repel attacks at the gate.
content_old: 6 and a spirit of judgment for him who sits in judgment and of valor for those who repel attacks at the gate.

content: 7 But these are also muddled by wine And dazed by liquor: Priest and prophet Are muddled by liquor; They are confused by wine, They are dazed by liquor; They are muddled in their visions, They stumble in judgment.
content_old: 7 But these are also muddled by wine And dazed by liquor: Priest and prophet Are muddled by liquor; They are confused by wine, They are dazed by liquor; They are muddled in their visions, They stumble in judgment.

content: 8 Yea, all tables are covered With vomit and filth, So that no space is left.
content_old: 8 Yea, all tables are covered With vomit and filth, So that no space is left.

content: 9 “To whom would he give instruction? To whom expound a message? To those newly weaned from milk, Just taken away from the breast?
content_old: 9 “To whom would he give instruction? To whom expound a message? To those newly weaned from milk, Just taken away from the breast?

content: 10 That same mutter upon mutter, Murmur upon murmur, Now here, now there!”
content_old: 10 That same mutter upon mutter, Murmur upon murmur, Now here, now there!”

content: 11 Truly, as one who speaks to that people in a stammering jargon and an alien tongue
content_old: 11 Truly, as one who speaks to that people in a stammering jargon and an alien tongue

content: 12 is he who declares to them, “This is the resting place, let the weary rest; this is the place of repose.” They refuse to listen.
content_old: 12 is he who declares to them, “This is the resting place, let the weary rest; this is the place of repose.” They refuse to listen.

content: 13 To them the word of the LORD is: “Mutter upon mutter, Murmur upon murmur, Now here, now there.” And so they will march, But they shall fall backward, And be injured and snared and captured.
content_old: 13 To them the word of the LORD is: “Mutter upon mutter, Murmur upon murmur, Now here, now there.” And so they will march, But they shall fall backward, And be injured and snared and captured.

content: 14 Hear now the word of the LORD, You men of mockery, Who govern that people In Jerusalem!
content_old: 14 Hear now the word of the LORD, You men of mockery, Who govern that people In Jerusalem!

content: 15 For you have said, “We have made a covenant with Death, Concluded a pact with Sheol. When the sweeping flood passes through, It shall not reach us; For we have made falsehood our refuge, Taken shelter in treachery.”
content_old: 15 For you have said, “We have made a covenant with Death, Concluded a pact with Sheol. When the sweeping flood passes through, It shall not reach us; For we have made falsehood our refuge, Taken shelter in treachery.”

content: 16 Assuredly, Thus said the Lord GOD: “Behold, I will found in Zion, Stone by stone, A tower of precious cornerstones, Exceedingly firm; He who trusts need not fear.
content_old: 16 Assuredly, Thus said the Lord GOD: “Behold, I will found in Zion, Stone by stone, A tower of precious cornerstones, Exceedingly firm; He who trusts need not fear.

content: 17 But I will apply judgment as a measuring line And retribution as weights; Hail shall sweep away the refuge of falsehood, And flood-waters engulf your shelter.
content_old: 17 But I will apply judgment as a measuring line And retribution as weights; Hail shall sweep away the refuge of falsehood, And flood-waters engulf your shelter.

content: 18 Your covenant with Death shall be annulled, Your pact with Sheol shall not endure; When the sweeping flood passes through, You shall be its victims.
content_old: 18 Your covenant with Death shall be annulled, Your pact with Sheol shall not endure; When the sweeping flood passes through, You shall be its victims.

content: 19 It shall catch you Every time it passes through; It shall pass through every morning, Every day and every night. And it shall be sheer horror To grasp the message.”
content_old: 19 It shall catch you Every time it passes through; It shall pass through every morning, Every day and every night. And it shall be sheer horror To grasp the message.”

content: 20 The couch is too short for stretching out, And the cover too narrow for curling up!
content_old: 20 The couch is too short for stretching out, And the cover too narrow for curling up!

content: 21 For the LORD will arise As on the hill of Perazim, He will rouse Himself As in the vale of Gibeon, To do His work— Strange is His work! And to perform His task— Astounding is His task!
content_old: 21 For the LORD will arise As on the hill of Perazim, He will rouse Himself As in the vale of Gibeon, To do His work— Strange is His work! And to perform His task— Astounding is His task!

content: 22 Therefore, refrain from mockery, Lest your bonds be tightened. For I have heard a decree of destruction From my Lord GOD of Hosts Against all the land.
content_old: 22 Therefore, refrain from mockery, Lest your bonds be tightened. For I have heard a decree of destruction From my Lord GOD of Hosts Against all the land.

content: 23 Give diligent ear to my words, Attend carefully to what I say.
content_old: 23 Give diligent ear to my words, Attend carefully to what I say.

content: 24 Does he who plows to sow Plow all the time, Breaking up and furrowing his land?
content_old: 24 Does he who plows to sow Plow all the time, Breaking up and furrowing his land?

content: 25 When he has smoothed its surface, Does he not rather broadcast black cumin And scatter cumin, Or set wheat in a row, Barley in a strip, And emmer in a patch?
content_old: 25 When he has smoothed its surface, Does he not rather broadcast black cumin And scatter cumin, Or set wheat in a row, Barley in a strip, And emmer in a patch?

content: 26 For He teaches him the right manner, His God instructs him.
content_old: 26 For He teaches him the right manner, His God instructs him.

content: 27 So, too, black cumin is not threshed with a threshing board, Nor is the wheel of a threshing sledge rolled over cumin; But black cumin is beaten out with a stick And cumin with a rod.
content_old: 27 So, too, black cumin is not threshed with a threshing board, Nor is the wheel of a threshing sledge rolled over cumin; But black cumin is beaten out with a stick And cumin with a rod.

content: 28 It is cereal that is crushed. For even if he threshes it thoroughly, And the wheel of his sledge and his horses overwhelm it, He does not crush it.
content_old: 28 It is cereal that is crushed. For even if he threshes it thoroughly, And the wheel of his sledge and his horses overwhelm it, He does not crush it.

content: 1 “Ah, Ariel, Ariel, City where David camped! Add year to year, Let festivals come in their cycles!
content_old: 1 “Ah, Ariel, Ariel, City where David camped! Add year to year, Let festivals come in their cycles!

content: 2 And I will harass Ariel, And there shall be sorrow and sighing. She shall be to Me like Ariel.
content_old: 2 And I will harass Ariel, And there shall be sorrow and sighing. She shall be to Me like Ariel.

content: 3 And I will camp against you round about; I will lay siege to you with a mound, And I will set up siegeworks against you.
content_old: 3 And I will camp against you round about; I will lay siege to you with a mound, And I will set up siegeworks against you.

content: 4 And you shall speak from lower than the ground, Your speech shall be humbler than the sod; Your speech shall sound like a ghost’s from the ground, Your voice shall chirp from the sod.
content_old: 4 And you shall speak from lower than the ground, Your speech shall be humbler than the sod; Your speech shall sound like a ghost’s from the ground, Your voice shall chirp from the sod.

content: 5 And like fine dust shall be The multitude of your strangers; And like flying chaff, The multitude of tyrants.” And suddenly, in an instant,
content_old: 5 And like fine dust shall be The multitude of your strangers; And like flying chaff, The multitude of tyrants.” And suddenly, in an instant,

content: 6 She shall be remembered of the LORD of Hosts With roaring, and shaking, and deafening noise, Storm, and tempest, and blaze of consuming fire.
content_old: 6 She shall be remembered of the LORD of Hosts With roaring, and shaking, and deafening noise, Storm, and tempest, and blaze of consuming fire.

content: 7 Then, like a dream, a vision of the night, Shall be the multitude of nations That war upon Ariel, And all her besiegers, and the siegeworks against her, And those who harass her.
content_old: 7 Then, like a dream, a vision of the night, Shall be the multitude of nations That war upon Ariel, And all her besiegers, and the siegeworks against her, And those who harass her.

content: 8 Like one who is hungry And dreams he is eating, But wakes to find himself empty; And like one who is thirsty And dreams he is drinking, But wakes to find himself faint And utterly parched— So shall be all the multitude of nations That war upon Mount Zion.
content_old: 8 Like one who is hungry And dreams he is eating, But wakes to find himself empty; And like one who is thirsty And dreams he is drinking, But wakes to find himself faint And utterly parched— So shall be all the multitude of nations That war upon Mount Zion.

content: 9 Act stupid and be stupefied! Act blind and be blinded! They are drunk, but not from wine, They stagger, but not from liquor.
content_old: 9 Act stupid and be stupefied! Act blind and be blinded! They are drunk, but not from wine, They stagger, but not from liquor.

content: 10 For the LORD has spread over you A spirit of deep sleep, And has shut your eyes, the prophets, And covered your heads, the seers;
content_old: 10 For the LORD has spread over you A spirit of deep sleep, And has shut your eyes, the prophets, And covered your heads, the seers;

content: 11 So that all prophecy has been to you Like the words of a sealed document. If it is handed to one who can read and he is asked to read it, he will say, “I can’t, because it is sealed”;
content_old: 11 So that all prophecy has been to you Like the words of a sealed document. If it is handed to one who can read and he is asked to read it, he will say, “I can’t, because it is sealed”;

content: 12 and if the document is handed to one who cannot read and he is asked to read it, he will say, “I can’t read.”
content_old: 12 and if the document is handed to one who cannot read and he is asked to read it, he will say, “I can’t read.”

content: 13 My Lord said: Because that people has approached with its mouth And honored Me with its lips, But has kept its heart far from Me, And its worship of Me has been A commandment of men, learned by rote—
content_old: 13 My Lord said: Because that people has approached with its mouth And honored Me with its lips, But has kept its heart far from Me, And its worship of Me has been A commandment of men, learned by rote—

content: 14 Truly, I shall further baffle that people With bafflement upon bafflement; And the wisdom of its wise shall fail, And the prudence of its prudent shall vanish.
content_old: 14 Truly, I shall further baffle that people With bafflement upon bafflement; And the wisdom of its wise shall fail, And the prudence of its prudent shall vanish.

content: 15 Ha! Those who would hide their plans Deep from the LORD! Who do their work in dark places And say, “Who sees us, who takes note of us?”
content_old: 15 Ha! Those who would hide their plans Deep from the LORD! Who do their work in dark places And say, “Who sees us, who takes note of us?”

content: 16 How perverse of you! Should the potter be accounted as the clay? Should what is made say of its Maker, “He did not make me,” And what is formed say of Him who formed it, “He did not understand?”
content_old: 16 How perverse of you! Should the potter be accounted as the clay? Should what is made say of its Maker, “He did not make me,” And what is formed say of Him who formed it, “He did not understand?”

content: 17 Surely, in a little while, Lebanon will be transformed into farm land, And farm land accounted as mere brush.
content_old: 17 Surely, in a little while, Lebanon will be transformed into farm land, And farm land accounted as mere brush.

content: 18 In that day, the deaf shall hear even written words, And the eyes of the blind shall see Even in darkness and obscurity.
content_old: 18 In that day, the deaf shall hear even written words, And the eyes of the blind shall see Even in darkness and obscurity.

content: 19 Then the humble shall have increasing joy through the LORD, And the neediest of men shall exult In the Holy One of Israel.
content_old: 19 Then the humble shall have increasing joy through the LORD, And the neediest of men shall exult In the Holy One of Israel.

content: 20 For the tyrant shall be no more, The scoffer shall cease to be; And those diligent for evil shall be wiped out,
content_old: 20 For the tyrant shall be no more, The scoffer shall cease to be; And those diligent for evil shall be wiped out,

content: 21 Who cause men to lose their lawsuits, Laying a snare for the arbiter at the gate, And wronging by falsehood Him who was in the right.
content_old: 21 Who cause men to lose their lawsuits, Laying a snare for the arbiter at the gate, And wronging by falsehood Him who was in the right.

content: 22 Assuredly, thus said the LORD to the House of Jacob, Who redeemed Abraham: No more shall Jacob be shamed, No longer his face grow pale.
content_old: 22 Assuredly, thus said the LORD to the House of Jacob, Who redeemed Abraham: No more shall Jacob be shamed, No longer his face grow pale.

content: 23 For when he—that is, his children—behold what My hands have wrought in his midst, they will hallow My name. Men will hallow the Holy One of Jacob And stand in awe of the God of Israel.
content_old: 23 For when he—that is, his children—behold what My hands have wrought in his midst, they will hallow My name. Men will hallow the Holy One of Jacob And stand in awe of the God of Israel.

content: 1 Oh, disloyal sons! —declares the LORD— Making plans Against My wishes, Weaving schemes Against My will, Thereby piling Guilt on guilt—
content_old: 1 Oh, disloyal sons! —declares the LORD— Making plans Against My wishes, Weaving schemes Against My will, Thereby piling Guilt on guilt—

content: 2 Who set out to go down to Egypt Without asking Me, To seek refuge with Pharaoh, To seek shelter under the protection of Egypt.
content_old: 2 Who set out to go down to Egypt Without asking Me, To seek refuge with Pharaoh, To seek shelter under the protection of Egypt.

content: 3 The refuge with Pharaoh shall result in your shame; The shelter under Egypt’s protection, in your chagrin.
content_old: 3 The refuge with Pharaoh shall result in your shame; The shelter under Egypt’s protection, in your chagrin.

content: 4 Though his officers are present in Zoan, And his messengers reach as far as Hanes,
content_old: 4 Though his officers are present in Zoan, And his messengers reach as far as Hanes,

content: 5 They all shall come to shame Because of a people that does not avail them, That is of no help or avail, But brings only chagrin and disgrace.
content_old: 5 They all shall come to shame Because of a people that does not avail them, That is of no help or avail, But brings only chagrin and disgrace.

content: 6 The “Beasts of the Negeb” Pronouncement. Through a land of distress and hardship, Of lion and roaring king-beast, Of viper and flying seraph, They convey their wealth on the backs of asses, Their treasures on camels’ humps, To a people of no avail.
content_old: 6 The “Beasts of the Negeb” Pronouncement. Through a land of distress and hardship, Of lion and roaring king-beast, Of viper and flying seraph, They convey their wealth on the backs of asses, Their treasures on camels’ humps, To a people of no avail.

content: 7 For the help of Egypt Shall be vain and empty. Truly, I call this, “They are a threat that has ceased.”
content_old: 7 For the help of Egypt Shall be vain and empty. Truly, I call this, “They are a threat that has ceased.”

content: 8 Now, Go, write it down on a tablet And inscribe it in a record, That it may be with them for future days, A witness forever.
content_old: 8 Now, Go, write it down on a tablet And inscribe it in a record, That it may be with them for future days, A witness forever.

content: 9 For it is a rebellious people, Faithless children, Children who refused to heed The instruction of the LORD;
content_old: 9 For it is a rebellious people, Faithless children, Children who refused to heed The instruction of the LORD;

content: 10 Who said to the seers, “Do not see,” To the prophets, “Do not prophesy truth to us; Speak to us falsehoods, Prophesy delusions.
content_old: 10 Who said to the seers, “Do not see,” To the prophets, “Do not prophesy truth to us; Speak to us falsehoods, Prophesy delusions.

content: 11 Leave the way! Get off the path! Let us hear no more About the Holy One of Israel!”
content_old: 11 Leave the way! Get off the path! Let us hear no more About the Holy One of Israel!”

content: 12 Assuredly, Thus said the Holy One of Israel: Because you have rejected this word, And have put your trust and reliance In that which is fraudulent and tortuous—
content_old: 12 Assuredly, Thus said the Holy One of Israel: Because you have rejected this word, And have put your trust and reliance In that which is fraudulent and tortuous—

content: 13 Of a surety, This iniquity shall work on you Like a spreading breach that occurs in a lofty wall, Whose crash comes sudden and swift.
content_old: 13 Of a surety, This iniquity shall work on you Like a spreading breach that occurs in a lofty wall, Whose crash comes sudden and swift.

content: 14 It is smashed as one smashes an earthen jug, Ruthlessly shattered So that no shard is left in its breakage To scoop coals from a brazier, Or ladle water from a puddle.
content_old: 14 It is smashed as one smashes an earthen jug, Ruthlessly shattered So that no shard is left in its breakage To scoop coals from a brazier, Or ladle water from a puddle.

content: 15 For thus said my Lord GOD, The Holy One of Israel, “You shall triumph by stillness and quiet; Your victory shall come about Through calm and confidence.” But you refused.
content_old: 15 For thus said my Lord GOD, The Holy One of Israel, “You shall triumph by stillness and quiet; Your victory shall come about Through calm and confidence.” But you refused.

content: 16 “No,” you declared. “We shall flee on steeds”— Therefore you shall flee! “We shall ride on swift mounts”— Therefore your pursuers shall prove swift!
content_old: 16 “No,” you declared. “We shall flee on steeds”— Therefore you shall flee! “We shall ride on swift mounts”— Therefore your pursuers shall prove swift!

content: 17 One thousand before the shout of one— You shall flee at the shout of five; Till what is left of you Is like a mast on a hilltop, Like a pole upon a mountain.
content_old: 17 One thousand before the shout of one— You shall flee at the shout of five; Till what is left of you Is like a mast on a hilltop, Like a pole upon a mountain.

content: 18 Truly, the LORD is waiting to show you grace, Truly, He will arise to pardon you. For the LORD is a God of justice; Happy are all who wait for Him.
content_old: 18 Truly, the LORD is waiting to show you grace, Truly, He will arise to pardon you. For the LORD is a God of justice; Happy are all who wait for Him.

content: 19 Indeed, O people in Zion, dwellers of Jerusalem, you shall not have cause to weep. He will grant you His favor at the sound of your cry; He will respond as soon as He hears it.
content_old: 19 Indeed, O people in Zion, dwellers of Jerusalem, you shall not have cause to weep. He will grant you His favor at the sound of your cry; He will respond as soon as He hears it.

content: 20 My Lord will provide for you meager bread and scant water. Then your Guide will no more be ignored, but your eyes will watch your Guide;
content_old: 20 My Lord will provide for you meager bread and scant water. Then your Guide will no more be ignored, but your eyes will watch your Guide;

content: 21 and, whenever you deviate to the right or to the left, your ears will heed the command from behind you: “This is the road; follow it!”
content_old: 21 and, whenever you deviate to the right or to the left, your ears will heed the command from behind you: “This is the road; follow it!”

content: 22 And you will treat as unclean the silver overlay of your images and the golden plating of your idols. You will cast them away like a menstruous woman. “Out!” you will call to them.
content_old: 22 And you will treat as unclean the silver overlay of your images and the golden plating of your idols. You will cast them away like a menstruous woman. “Out!” you will call to them.

content: 23 So rain shall be provided for the seed with which you sow the ground, and the bread that the ground brings forth shall be rich and fat. Your livestock, in that day, shall graze in broad pastures;
content_old: 23 So rain shall be provided for the seed with which you sow the ground, and the bread that the ground brings forth shall be rich and fat. Your livestock, in that day, shall graze in broad pastures;

content: 24 as for the cattle and the asses that till the soil, they shall partake of salted fodder that has been winnowed with shovel and fan.
content_old: 24 as for the cattle and the asses that till the soil, they shall partake of salted fodder that has been winnowed with shovel and fan.

content: 25 And on every high mountain and on every lofty hill, there shall appear brooks and watercourses—on a day of heavy slaughter, when towers topple.
content_old: 25 And on every high mountain and on every lofty hill, there shall appear brooks and watercourses—on a day of heavy slaughter, when towers topple.

content: 26 And the light of the moon shall become like the light of the sun, and the light of the sun shall become sevenfold, like the light of the seven days, when the LORD binds up His people’s wounds and heals the injuries it has suffered.
content_old: 26 And the light of the moon shall become like the light of the sun, and the light of the sun shall become sevenfold, like the light of the seven days, when the LORD binds up His people’s wounds and heals the injuries it has suffered.

content: 27 Behold the LORD Himself Comes from afar In blazing wrath, With a heavy burden— His lips full of fury, His tongue like devouring fire,
