content_old: 27 Behold the LORD Himself Comes from afar In blazing wrath, With a heavy burden— His lips full of fury, His tongue like devouring fire,

content: 28 And his breath like a raging torrent Reaching halfway up the neck— To set a misguiding yoke upon nations And a misleading bridle upon the jaws of peoples,
content_old: 28 And his breath like a raging torrent Reaching halfway up the neck— To set a misguiding yoke upon nations And a misleading bridle upon the jaws of peoples,

content: 29 For you, there shall be singing As on a night when a festival is hallowed; There shall be rejoicing as when they march With flute, with timbrels, and with lyres To the Rock of Israel on the Mount of the LORD.
content_old: 29 For you, there shall be singing As on a night when a festival is hallowed; There shall be rejoicing as when they march With flute, with timbrels, and with lyres To the Rock of Israel on the Mount of the LORD.

content: 30 For the LORD will make His majestic voice heard And display the sweep of His arm In raging wrath, In a devouring blaze of fire, In tempest, and rainstorm, and hailstones.
content_old: 30 For the LORD will make His majestic voice heard And display the sweep of His arm In raging wrath, In a devouring blaze of fire, In tempest, and rainstorm, and hailstones.

content: 31 Truly, Assyria, who beats with the rod, Shall be cowed by the voice of the LORD;
content_old: 31 Truly, Assyria, who beats with the rod, Shall be cowed by the voice of the LORD;

content: 32 And each time the appointed staff passes by, The LORD will bring down upon him And will do battle with him as he waves it.
content_old: 32 And each time the appointed staff passes by, The LORD will bring down upon him And will do battle with him as he waves it.

content: 1 Ha! Those who go down to Egypt for help And rely upon horses! They have put their trust in abundance of chariots, In vast numbers of riders, And they have not turned to the Holy One of Israel, They have not sought the LORD.
content_old: 1 Ha! Those who go down to Egypt for help And rely upon horses! They have put their trust in abundance of chariots, In vast numbers of riders, And they have not turned to the Holy One of Israel, They have not sought the LORD.

content: 2 But He too is wise! He has brought on misfortune, And has not canceled His word. So He shall rise against the house of evildoers, And the allies of the workers of iniquity.
content_old: 2 But He too is wise! He has brought on misfortune, And has not canceled His word. So He shall rise against the house of evildoers, And the allies of the workers of iniquity.

content: 3 For the Egyptians are man, not God, And their horses are flesh, not spirit; And when the LORD stretches out His arm, The helper shall trip And the helped one shall fall, And both shall perish together.
content_old: 3 For the Egyptians are man, not God, And their horses are flesh, not spirit; And when the LORD stretches out His arm, The helper shall trip And the helped one shall fall, And both shall perish together.

content: 4 For thus the LORD has said to me: As a lion—a great beast— Growls over its prey And, when the shepherds gather In force against him, Is not dismayed by their cries Nor cowed by their noise— So the LORD of Hosts will descend to make war Against the mount and the hill of Zion.
content_old: 4 For thus the LORD has said to me: As a lion—a great beast— Growls over its prey And, when the shepherds gather In force against him, Is not dismayed by their cries Nor cowed by their noise— So the LORD of Hosts will descend to make war Against the mount and the hill of Zion.

content: 5 Like the birds that fly, even so will the LORD of Hosts shield Jerusalem, shielding and saving, protecting and rescuing.
content_old: 5 Like the birds that fly, even so will the LORD of Hosts shield Jerusalem, shielding and saving, protecting and rescuing.

content: 6 Return, O children of Israel, to Him to whom they have been so shamefully false;
content_old: 6 Return, O children of Israel, to Him to whom they have been so shamefully false;

content: 7 for in that day everyone will reject his idols of silver and idols of gold, which your hands have made for your guilt.
content_old: 7 for in that day everyone will reject his idols of silver and idols of gold, which your hands have made for your guilt.

content: 8 Then Assyria shall fall, Not by the sword of man; A sword not of humans shall devour him. He shall shrivel before the sword, And his young men pine away.
content_old: 8 Then Assyria shall fall, Not by the sword of man; A sword not of humans shall devour him. He shall shrivel before the sword, And his young men pine away.

content: 1 Behold, a king shall reign in righteousness, And ministers shall govern with justice;
content_old: 1 Behold, a king shall reign in righteousness, And ministers shall govern with justice;

content: 2 Every one of them shall be Like a refuge from gales, A shelter from rainstorms; Like brooks of water in a desert, Like the shade of a massive rock In a languishing land.
content_old: 2 Every one of them shall be Like a refuge from gales, A shelter from rainstorms; Like brooks of water in a desert, Like the shade of a massive rock In a languishing land.

content: 3 Then the eyes of those who have sight shall not be sealed, And the ears of those who have hearing shall listen;
content_old: 3 Then the eyes of those who have sight shall not be sealed, And the ears of those who have hearing shall listen;

content: 4 And the minds of the thoughtless shall attend and note, And the tongues of mumblers shall speak with fluent eloquence.
content_old: 4 And the minds of the thoughtless shall attend and note, And the tongues of mumblers shall speak with fluent eloquence.

content: 5 No more shall a villain be called noble, Nor shall “gentleman” be said of a knave.
content_old: 5 No more shall a villain be called noble, Nor shall “gentleman” be said of a knave.

content: 6 For the villain speaks villainy And plots treachery; To act impiously And to preach disloyalty against the LORD; To leave the hungry unsatisfied And deprive the thirsty of drink.
content_old: 6 For the villain speaks villainy And plots treachery; To act impiously And to preach disloyalty against the LORD; To leave the hungry unsatisfied And deprive the thirsty of drink.

content: 7 As for the knave, his tools are knavish. He forges plots To destroy the poor with falsehoods And the needy when they plead their cause.
content_old: 7 As for the knave, his tools are knavish. He forges plots To destroy the poor with falsehoods And the needy when they plead their cause.

content: 8 But the noble has noble intentions And is constant in noble acts.
content_old: 8 But the noble has noble intentions And is constant in noble acts.

content: 9 You carefree women, Attend, hear my words! You confident ladies, Give ear to my speech!
content_old: 9 You carefree women, Attend, hear my words! You confident ladies, Give ear to my speech!

content: 10 In little more than a year, You shall be troubled, O confident ones, When the vintage is over And no ingathering takes place.
content_old: 10 In little more than a year, You shall be troubled, O confident ones, When the vintage is over And no ingathering takes place.

content: 11 Tremble, you carefree ones! Quake, O confident ones! Strip yourselves naked, Put the cloth about your loins!
content_old: 11 Tremble, you carefree ones! Quake, O confident ones! Strip yourselves naked, Put the cloth about your loins!

content: 12 Lament upon the breasts, For the pleasant fields, For the spreading grapevines,
content_old: 12 Lament upon the breasts, For the pleasant fields, For the spreading grapevines,

content: 13 For my people’s soil— It shall be overgrown with briers and thistles— Aye, and for all the houses of delight, For the city of mirth.
content_old: 13 For my people’s soil— It shall be overgrown with briers and thistles— Aye, and for all the houses of delight, For the city of mirth.

content: 14 For the castle shall be abandoned, The noisy city forsaken; Citadel and tower shall become Bare places forever, A stamping ground for wild asses, A pasture for flocks—
content_old: 14 For the castle shall be abandoned, The noisy city forsaken; Citadel and tower shall become Bare places forever, A stamping ground for wild asses, A pasture for flocks—

content: 15 Till a spirit from on high is poured out on us, And wilderness is transformed into farm land, While farm land rates as mere brush.
content_old: 15 Till a spirit from on high is poured out on us, And wilderness is transformed into farm land, While farm land rates as mere brush.

content: 16 Then justice shall abide in the wilderness And righteousness shall dwell on the farm land.
content_old: 16 Then justice shall abide in the wilderness And righteousness shall dwell on the farm land.

content: 17 For the work of righteousness shall be peace, And the effect of righteousness, calm and confidence forever.
content_old: 17 For the work of righteousness shall be peace, And the effect of righteousness, calm and confidence forever.

content: 18 Then my people shall dwell in peaceful homes, In secure dwellings, In untroubled places of rest.
content_old: 18 Then my people shall dwell in peaceful homes, In secure dwellings, In untroubled places of rest.

content: 19 And the brush shall sink and vanish, Even as the city is laid low.
content_old: 19 And the brush shall sink and vanish, Even as the city is laid low.

content: 1 Ha, you ravager who are not ravaged, You betrayer who have not been betrayed! When you have done ravaging, you shall be ravaged; When you have finished betraying, you shall be betrayed.
content_old: 1 Ha, you ravager who are not ravaged, You betrayer who have not been betrayed! When you have done ravaging, you shall be ravaged; When you have finished betraying, you shall be betrayed.

content: 2 O LORD, be gracious to us! It is to You we have looked; Be their arm every morning, Also our deliverance in time of stress.
content_old: 2 O LORD, be gracious to us! It is to You we have looked; Be their arm every morning, Also our deliverance in time of stress.

content: 3 At roaring, peoples have fled, Before Your majesty nations have scattered;
content_old: 3 At roaring, peoples have fled, Before Your majesty nations have scattered;

content: 4 And spoil was gathered as locusts are gathered, It was amassed as grasshoppers are amassed.
content_old: 4 And spoil was gathered as locusts are gathered, It was amassed as grasshoppers are amassed.

content: 5 The LORD is exalted, He dwells on high! He filled Zion With justice and righteousness.
content_old: 5 The LORD is exalted, He dwells on high! He filled Zion With justice and righteousness.

content: 6 Faithfulness to Your charge was wealth, Wisdom and devotion triumph, Reverence for the LORD—that was her treasure.
content_old: 6 Faithfulness to Your charge was wealth, Wisdom and devotion triumph, Reverence for the LORD—that was her treasure.

content: 7 Hark! The Arielites cry aloud; Shalom’s messengers weep bitterly.
content_old: 7 Hark! The Arielites cry aloud; Shalom’s messengers weep bitterly.

content: 8 Highways are desolate, Wayfarers have ceased. A covenant has been renounced, Cities rejected Mortal man despised.
content_old: 8 Highways are desolate, Wayfarers have ceased. A covenant has been renounced, Cities rejected Mortal man despised.

content: 9 The land is wilted and withered; Lebanon disgraced and moldering, Sharon is become like a desert, And Bashan and Carmel are stripped bare.
content_old: 9 The land is wilted and withered; Lebanon disgraced and moldering, Sharon is become like a desert, And Bashan and Carmel are stripped bare.

content: 10 “Now I will arise,” says the LORD, “Now I will exalt Myself, now raise Myself high.
content_old: 10 “Now I will arise,” says the LORD, “Now I will exalt Myself, now raise Myself high.

content: 11 You shall conceive hay, Give birth to straw; My breath will devour you like fire.
content_old: 11 You shall conceive hay, Give birth to straw; My breath will devour you like fire.

content: 12 Peoples shall be burnings of lime, Thorns cut down that are set on fire.
content_old: 12 Peoples shall be burnings of lime, Thorns cut down that are set on fire.

content: 13 Hear, you who are far, what I have done; You who are near, note My might.”
content_old: 13 Hear, you who are far, what I have done; You who are near, note My might.”

content: 14 Sinners in Zion are frightened, The godless are seized with trembling: “Who of us can dwell with the devouring fire: Who of us can dwell with the never-dying blaze?”
content_old: 14 Sinners in Zion are frightened, The godless are seized with trembling: “Who of us can dwell with the devouring fire: Who of us can dwell with the never-dying blaze?”

content: 15 He who walks in righteousness, Speaks uprightly, Spurns profit from fraudulent dealings, Waves away a bribe instead of grasping it, Stops his ears against listening to infamy, Shuts his eyes against looking at evil—
content_old: 15 He who walks in righteousness, Speaks uprightly, Spurns profit from fraudulent dealings, Waves away a bribe instead of grasping it, Stops his ears against listening to infamy, Shuts his eyes against looking at evil—

content: 16 Such a one shall dwell in lofty security, With inaccessible cliffs for his stronghold, With his food supplied And his drink assured.
content_old: 16 Such a one shall dwell in lofty security, With inaccessible cliffs for his stronghold, With his food supplied And his drink assured.

content: 17 When your eyes behold a king in his beauty, When they contemplate the land round about,
content_old: 17 When your eyes behold a king in his beauty, When they contemplate the land round about,

content: 18 Your throat shall murmur in awe, “Where is one who could count? Where is one who could weigh? Where is one who could count towers?”
content_old: 18 Your throat shall murmur in awe, “Where is one who could count? Where is one who could weigh? Where is one who could count towers?”

content: 19 No more shall you see the barbarian folk, The people of speech too obscure to comprehend, So stammering of tongue that they are not understood.
content_old: 19 No more shall you see the barbarian folk, The people of speech too obscure to comprehend, So stammering of tongue that they are not understood.

content: 20 When you gaze upon Zion, our city of assembly, Your eyes shall behold Jerusalem As a secure homestead, A tent not to be transported, Whose pegs shall never be pulled up, And none of whose ropes shall break.
content_old: 20 When you gaze upon Zion, our city of assembly, Your eyes shall behold Jerusalem As a secure homestead, A tent not to be transported, Whose pegs shall never be pulled up, And none of whose ropes shall break.

content: 21 For there the LORD in His greatness shall be for us Like a region of rivers, of broad streams, Where no floating vessels can sail And no mighty craft can travel— Their ropes are slack, They cannot steady the sockets of their masts, They cannot spread a sail.
content_old: 21 For there the LORD in His greatness shall be for us Like a region of rivers, of broad streams, Where no floating vessels can sail And no mighty craft can travel— Their ropes are slack, They cannot steady the sockets of their masts, They cannot spread a sail.

content: 22 For the LORD shall be our ruler, The LORD shall be our prince, The LORD shall be our king: He shall deliver us.
content_old: 22 For the LORD shall be our ruler, The LORD shall be our prince, The LORD shall be our king: He shall deliver us.

content: 23 Then shall indeed much spoil be divided, Even the lame shall seize booty.
content_old: 23 Then shall indeed much spoil be divided, Even the lame shall seize booty.

content: 1 Approach, O nations, and listen, Give heed, O peoples! Let the earth and those in it hear; The world, and what it brings forth.
content_old: 1 Approach, O nations, and listen, Give heed, O peoples! Let the earth and those in it hear; The world, and what it brings forth.

content: 2 For the LORD is angry at all the nations, Furious at all their host; He has doomed them, consigned them to slaughter.
content_old: 2 For the LORD is angry at all the nations, Furious at all their host; He has doomed them, consigned them to slaughter.

content: 3 Their slain shall be left lying, And the stench of their corpses shall mount; And the hills shall be drenched with their blood,
content_old: 3 Their slain shall be left lying, And the stench of their corpses shall mount; And the hills shall be drenched with their blood,

content: 4 All the host of heaven shall molder. The heavens shall be rolled up like a scroll, And all their host shall wither Like a leaf withering on the vine, Or shriveled fruit on a fig tree.
content_old: 4 All the host of heaven shall molder. The heavens shall be rolled up like a scroll, And all their host shall wither Like a leaf withering on the vine, Or shriveled fruit on a fig tree.

content: 5 For My sword shall be drunk in the sky; Lo, it shall come down upon Edom, Upon the people I have doomed, To wreak judgment.
content_old: 5 For My sword shall be drunk in the sky; Lo, it shall come down upon Edom, Upon the people I have doomed, To wreak judgment.

content: 6 The LORD has a sword; it is sated with blood, It is gorged with fat— The blood of lambs and he-goats, The kidney fat of rams. For the LORD holds a sacrifice in Bozrah, A great slaughter in the land of Edom.
content_old: 6 The LORD has a sword; it is sated with blood, It is gorged with fat— The blood of lambs and he-goats, The kidney fat of rams. For the LORD holds a sacrifice in Bozrah, A great slaughter in the land of Edom.

content: 7 Wild oxen shall fall with them, Young bulls with mighty steers; And their land shall be drunk with blood, Their soil shall be saturated with fat.
content_old: 7 Wild oxen shall fall with them, Young bulls with mighty steers; And their land shall be drunk with blood, Their soil shall be saturated with fat.

content: 8 For it is the LORD’s day of retribution, The year of vindication for Zion’s cause.
content_old: 8 For it is the LORD’s day of retribution, The year of vindication for Zion’s cause.

content: 9 Its streams shall be turned to pitch And its soil to sulfur. Its land shall become burning pitch,
content_old: 9 Its streams shall be turned to pitch And its soil to sulfur. Its land shall become burning pitch,

content: 10 Night and day it shall never go out; Its smoke shall rise for all time. Through the ages it shall lie in ruins; Through the aeons none shall traverse it.
content_old: 10 Night and day it shall never go out; Its smoke shall rise for all time. Through the ages it shall lie in ruins; Through the aeons none shall traverse it.

content: 11 Jackdaws and owls shall possess it; Great owls and ravens shall dwell there. He shall measure it with a line of chaos And with weights of emptiness.
content_old: 11 Jackdaws and owls shall possess it; Great owls and ravens shall dwell there. He shall measure it with a line of chaos And with weights of emptiness.

content: 12 It shall be called, “No kingdom is there,” Its nobles and all its lords shall be nothing.
content_old: 12 It shall be called, “No kingdom is there,” Its nobles and all its lords shall be nothing.

content: 13 Thorns shall grow up in its palaces, Nettles and briers in its strongholds. It shall be a home of jackals, An abode of ostriches.
content_old: 13 Thorns shall grow up in its palaces, Nettles and briers in its strongholds. It shall be a home of jackals, An abode of ostriches.

content: 14 Wildcats shall meet hyenas, Goat-demons shall greet each other; There too the lilith shall repose And find herself a resting place.
content_old: 14 Wildcats shall meet hyenas, Goat-demons shall greet each other; There too the lilith shall repose And find herself a resting place.

content: 15 There the arrow-snake shall nest and lay eggs, And shall brood and hatch in its shade. There too the buzzards shall gather With one another.
content_old: 15 There the arrow-snake shall nest and lay eggs, And shall brood and hatch in its shade. There too the buzzards shall gather With one another.

content: 16 Search and read it in the scroll of the LORD: Not one of these shall be absent, Not one shall miss its fellow. For His mouth has spoken, It is His spirit that has assembled them,
content_old: 16 Search and read it in the scroll of the LORD: Not one of these shall be absent, Not one shall miss its fellow. For His mouth has spoken, It is His spirit that has assembled them,

content: 1 The arid desert shall be glad, The wilderness shall rejoice And shall blossom like a rose.
content_old: 1 The arid desert shall be glad, The wilderness shall rejoice And shall blossom like a rose.

content: 2 It shall blossom abundantly, It shall also exult and shout. It shall receive the glory of Lebanon, The splendor of Carmel and Sharon. They shall behold the glory of the LORD, The splendor of our God.
content_old: 2 It shall blossom abundantly, It shall also exult and shout. It shall receive the glory of Lebanon, The splendor of Carmel and Sharon. They shall behold the glory of the LORD, The splendor of our God.

content: 3 Strengthen the hands that are slack; Make firm the tottering knees!
content_old: 3 Strengthen the hands that are slack; Make firm the tottering knees!

content: 4 Say to the anxious of heart, “Be strong, fear not; Behold your God! Requital is coming, The recompense of God— He Himself is coming to give you triumph.”
content_old: 4 Say to the anxious of heart, “Be strong, fear not; Behold your God! Requital is coming, The recompense of God— He Himself is coming to give you triumph.”

content: 5 Then the eyes of the blind shall be opened, And the ears of the deaf shall be unstopped.
content_old: 5 Then the eyes of the blind shall be opened, And the ears of the deaf shall be unstopped.

content: 6 Then the lame shall leap like a deer, And the tongue of the dumb shall shout aloud; For waters shall burst forth in the desert, Streams in the wilderness.
content_old: 6 Then the lame shall leap like a deer, And the tongue of the dumb shall shout aloud; For waters shall burst forth in the desert, Streams in the wilderness.

content: 7 Torrid earth shall become a pool; Parched land, fountains of water; The home of jackals, a pasture; The abode , reeds and rushes.
content_old: 7 Torrid earth shall become a pool; Parched land, fountains of water; The home of jackals, a pasture; The abode , reeds and rushes.

content: 8 And a highway shall appear there, Which shall be called the Sacred Way. No one unclean shall pass along it, But it shall be for them. No traveler, not even fools, shall go astray.
content_old: 8 And a highway shall appear there, Which shall be called the Sacred Way. No one unclean shall pass along it, But it shall be for them. No traveler, not even fools, shall go astray.

content: 9 No lion shall be there, No ferocious beast shall set foot on it— These shall not be found there. But the redeemed shall walk it;
content_old: 9 No lion shall be there, No ferocious beast shall set foot on it— These shall not be found there. But the redeemed shall walk it;

content: 1 In the fourteenth year of King Hezekiah, King Sennacherib of Assyria marched against all the fortified towns of Judah and seized them.
content_old: 1 In the fourteenth year of King Hezekiah, King Sennacherib of Assyria marched against all the fortified towns of Judah and seized them.

content: 2 From Lachish, the king of Assyria sent the Rabshakeh, with a large force, to King Hezekiah in Jerusalem. The Rabshakeh took up a position near the conduit of the Upper Pool, by the road of the Fuller’s Field;
content_old: 2 From Lachish, the king of Assyria sent the Rabshakeh, with a large force, to King Hezekiah in Jerusalem. The Rabshakeh took up a position near the conduit of the Upper Pool, by the road of the Fuller’s Field;

content: 3 and Eliakim son of Hilkiah who was in charge of the palace, Shebna the scribe, and Joah son of Asaph the recorder went out to him.
content_old: 3 and Eliakim son of Hilkiah who was in charge of the palace, Shebna the scribe, and Joah son of Asaph the recorder went out to him.

content: 4 The Rabshakeh said to them, “You tell Hezekiah: Thus said the Great King, the king of Assyria: What makes you so confident?
content_old: 4 The Rabshakeh said to them, “You tell Hezekiah: Thus said the Great King, the king of Assyria: What makes you so confident?

content: 5 I suppose mere talk makes counsel and valor for war! Look, on whom are you relying, that you have rebelled against me?
content_old: 5 I suppose mere talk makes counsel and valor for war! Look, on whom are you relying, that you have rebelled against me?

content: 6 You are relying on Egypt, that splintered reed of a staff, which enters and punctures the palm of anyone who leans on it. That’s what Pharaoh king of Egypt is like to all who rely on him.
content_old: 6 You are relying on Egypt, that splintered reed of a staff, which enters and punctures the palm of anyone who leans on it. That’s what Pharaoh king of Egypt is like to all who rely on him.

content: 7 And if you tell me that you are relying on the LORD your God, He is the very one whose shrines and altars Hezekiah did away with, telling Judah and Jerusalem, ‘You must worship only at this altar!’
content_old: 7 And if you tell me that you are relying on the LORD your God, He is the very one whose shrines and altars Hezekiah did away with, telling Judah and Jerusalem, ‘You must worship only at this altar!’

content: 8 Come now, make this wager with my master, the king of Assyria: I’ll give you two thousand horses, if you can produce riders to mount them.
content_old: 8 Come now, make this wager with my master, the king of Assyria: I’ll give you two thousand horses, if you can produce riders to mount them.

content: 9 So how could you refuse anything, even to the deputy of one of my master’s lesser servants, relying on Egypt for chariots and horsemen?
content_old: 9 So how could you refuse anything, even to the deputy of one of my master’s lesser servants, relying on Egypt for chariots and horsemen?

content: 10 And do you think I have marched against this land to destroy it without the LORD? The LORD Himself told me: Go up against that land and destroy it.”
content_old: 10 And do you think I have marched against this land to destroy it without the LORD? The LORD Himself told me: Go up against that land and destroy it.”

content: 11 Eliakim, Shebna, and Joah replied to the Rabshakeh, “Please, speak to your servants in Aramaic, since we understand it; do not speak to us in Judean in the hearing of the people on the wall.”
content_old: 11 Eliakim, Shebna, and Joah replied to the Rabshakeh, “Please, speak to your servants in Aramaic, since we understand it; do not speak to us in Judean in the hearing of the people on the wall.”

content: 12 But the Rabshakeh replied, “Was it to your master and to you that my master sent me to speak those words? It was precisely to the men who are sitting on the wall���who will have to eat their dung and drink their urine with you.”
content_old: 12 But the Rabshakeh replied, “Was it to your master and to you that my master sent me to speak those words? It was precisely to the men who are sitting on the wall���who will have to eat their dung and drink their urine with you.”

content: 13 And the Rabshakeh stood and called out in a loud voice in Judean:
content_old: 13 And the Rabshakeh stood and called out in a loud voice in Judean:

content: 14 “Hear the words of the Great King, the king of Assyria! Thus said the king: Don’t let Hezekiah deceive you, for he will not be able to save you.
content_old: 14 “Hear the words of the Great King, the king of Assyria! Thus said the king: Don’t let Hezekiah deceive you, for he will not be able to save you.

content: 15 Don’t let Hezekiah make you rely on the LORD, saying, ‘The LORD will surely save us; this city will not fall into the hands of Assyria!’
content_old: 15 Don’t let Hezekiah make you rely on the LORD, saying, ‘The LORD will surely save us; this city will not fall into the hands of Assyria!’

content: 16 Don’t listen to Hezekiah. For thus said the king of Assyria: Make your peace with me and come out to me, so that you may all eat from your vines and your fig trees and drink water from your cisterns,
content_old: 16 Don’t listen to Hezekiah. For thus said the king of Assyria: Make your peace with me and come out to me, so that you may all eat from your vines and your fig trees and drink water from your cisterns,

content: 17 until I come and take you away to a land like your own, a land of bread and wine, of grain and vineyards.
content_old: 17 until I come and take you away to a land like your own, a land of bread and wine, of grain and vineyards.

content: 18 Beware of letting Hezekiah mislead you by saying, ‘The LORD will save us.’ Did any of the gods of the other nations save his land from the king of Assyria?
content_old: 18 Beware of letting Hezekiah mislead you by saying, ‘The LORD will save us.’ Did any of the gods of the other nations save his land from the king of Assyria?

content: 19 Where were the gods of Hamath and Arpad? Where were the gods of Sepharvaim? And did they save Samaria from me?
content_old: 19 Where were the gods of Hamath and Arpad? Where were the gods of Sepharvaim? And did they save Samaria from me?

content: 20 Which among all the gods of those countries saved their countries from me, that the LORD should save Jerusalem from me?”
content_old: 20 Which among all the gods of those countries saved their countries from me, that the LORD should save Jerusalem from me?”

content: 21 But they were silent and did not answer him with a single word; for the king’s order was: “Do not answer him.”
content_old: 21 But they were silent and did not answer him with a single word; for the king’s order was: “Do not answer him.”

content: 1 When King Hezekiah heard this, he rent his clothes and covered himself with sackcloth and went into the House of the LORD.
content_old: 1 When King Hezekiah heard this, he rent his clothes and covered himself with sackcloth and went into the House of the LORD.

content: 2 He also sent Eliakim, who was in charge of the palace, Shebna, the scribe, and the senior priests, covered with sackcloth, to the prophet Isaiah son of Amoz.
content_old: 2 He also sent Eliakim, who was in charge of the palace, Shebna, the scribe, and the senior priests, covered with sackcloth, to the prophet Isaiah son of Amoz.

content: 3 They said to him, “Thus said Hezekiah: This day is a day of distress, of chastisement, and of disgrace. The babes have reached the birthstool, but the strength to give birth is lacking.
content_old: 3 They said to him, “Thus said Hezekiah: This day is a day of distress, of chastisement, and of disgrace. The babes have reached the birthstool, but the strength to give birth is lacking.

content: 4 Perhaps the LORD your God will take note of the words of the Rabshakeh, whom his master the king of Assyria has sent to blaspheme the living God, and will mete out judgment for the words that the LORD your God has heard—if you will offer up prayer for the surviving remnant.”
content_old: 4 Perhaps the LORD your God will take note of the words of the Rabshakeh, whom his master the king of Assyria has sent to blaspheme the living God, and will mete out judgment for the words that the LORD your God has heard—if you will offer up prayer for the surviving remnant.”

content: 5 When King Hezekiah’s ministers came to Isaiah,
content_old: 5 When King Hezekiah’s ministers came to Isaiah,

content: 6 Isaiah said to them, “Tell your master as follows: Thus said the LORD: Do not be frightened by the words of blasphemy against Me that you have heard from the minions of the king of Assyria.
content_old: 6 Isaiah said to them, “Tell your master as follows: Thus said the LORD: Do not be frightened by the words of blasphemy against Me that you have heard from the minions of the king of Assyria.

content: 7 I will delude him: He will hear a rumor and return to his land, and I will make him fall by the sword in his land.”
content_old: 7 I will delude him: He will hear a rumor and return to his land, and I will make him fall by the sword in his land.”

content: 8 The Rabshakeh, meanwhile, heard that the King had left Lachish; he turned back and found the king of Assyria attacking Libnah.
content_old: 8 The Rabshakeh, meanwhile, heard that the King had left Lachish; he turned back and found the king of Assyria attacking Libnah.

content: 9 But learned that King Tirhakah of Nubia had come out to fight him; and when he heard it, he sent messengers to Hezekiah, saying,
content_old: 9 But learned that King Tirhakah of Nubia had come out to fight him; and when he heard it, he sent messengers to Hezekiah, saying,

content: 10 “Tell this to King Hezekiah of Judah: Do not let your God, on whom you are relying, mislead you into thinking that Jerusalem will not be delivered into the hands of the king of Assyria.
content_old: 10 “Tell this to King Hezekiah of Judah: Do not let your God, on whom you are relying, mislead you into thinking that Jerusalem will not be delivered into the hands of the king of Assyria.

content: 11 You yourself have heard what the kings of Assyria have done to all the lands, how they have annihilated them; and can you escape?
content_old: 11 You yourself have heard what the kings of Assyria have done to all the lands, how they have annihilated them; and can you escape?

content: 12 Were the nations that my predecessors destroyed—Gozan, Haran, Rezeph, and the Bethedenites in Telassar—saved by their gods?
content_old: 12 Were the nations that my predecessors destroyed—Gozan, Haran, Rezeph, and the Bethedenites in Telassar—saved by their gods?

content: 13 Where is the king of Hamath? and the king of Arpad? and the kings of Lair, Sepharvaim, Hena, and Ivvah?”
content_old: 13 Where is the king of Hamath? and the king of Arpad? and the kings of Lair, Sepharvaim, Hena, and Ivvah?”

content: 14 Hezekiah received the letter from the messengers and read it. Hezekiah then went up to the House of the LORD and spread it out before the LORD.
content_old: 14 Hezekiah received the letter from the messengers and read it. Hezekiah then went up to the House of the LORD and spread it out before the LORD.

content: 15 And Hezekiah prayed to the LORD:
content_old: 15 And Hezekiah prayed to the LORD:

content: 16 “O LORD of Hosts, enthroned on the Cherubim! You alone are God of all the kingdoms of the earth. You made the heavens and the earth.
content_old: 16 “O LORD of Hosts, enthroned on the Cherubim! You alone are God of all the kingdoms of the earth. You made the heavens and the earth.

content: 17 O LORD, incline Your ear and hear, open Your eye and see. Hear all the words that Sennacherib has sent to blaspheme the living God!
content_old: 17 O LORD, incline Your ear and hear, open Your eye and see. Hear all the words that Sennacherib has sent to blaspheme the living God!

content: 18 True, O LORD, the kings of Assyria have annihilated all the nations and their lands
content_old: 18 True, O LORD, the kings of Assyria have annihilated all the nations and their lands

content: 19 and have committed their gods to the flames and have destroyed them; for they are not gods, but man’s handwork of wood and stone.
content_old: 19 and have committed their gods to the flames and have destroyed them; for they are not gods, but man’s handwork of wood and stone.

content: 20 But now, O LORD our God, deliver us from his hands, and let all the kingdoms of the earth know that You, O LORD, alone are God.”
content_old: 20 But now, O LORD our God, deliver us from his hands, and let all the kingdoms of the earth know that You, O LORD, alone are God.”

content: 21 Then Isaiah son of Amoz sent this message to Hezekiah: “Thus said the LORD, the God of Israel, to whom you have prayed, concerning King Sennacherib of Assyria—
content_old: 21 Then Isaiah son of Amoz sent this message to Hezekiah: “Thus said the LORD, the God of Israel, to whom you have prayed, concerning King Sennacherib of Assyria—

content: 22 this is the word that the LORD has spoken concerning him: Fair Maiden Zion despises you, She mocks at you; Fair Jerusalem shakes Her head at you.
content_old: 22 this is the word that the LORD has spoken concerning him: Fair Maiden Zion despises you, She mocks at you; Fair Jerusalem shakes Her head at you.

content: 23 Whom have you blasphemed and reviled? Against whom made loud your voice And haughtily raised your eyes? Against the Holy One of Israel!
content_old: 23 Whom have you blasphemed and reviled? Against whom made loud your voice And haughtily raised your eyes? Against the Holy One of Israel!

content: 24 Through your servants you have blasphemed my Lord. Because you thought, ‘Thanks to my vast chariotry, It is I who have climbed the highest mountains, To the remotest parts of the Lebanon, And have cut down its loftiest cedars, Its choicest cypresses, And have reached its highest peak, Its densest forest.
content_old: 24 Through your servants you have blasphemed my Lord. Because you thought, ‘Thanks to my vast chariotry, It is I who have climbed the highest mountains, To the remotest parts of the Lebanon, And have cut down its loftiest cedars, Its choicest cypresses, And have reached its highest peak, Its densest forest.

content: 25 It is I who have drawn And drunk water. I have dried up with the soles of my feet All the streams of Egypt.’
content_old: 25 It is I who have drawn And drunk water. I have dried up with the soles of my feet All the streams of Egypt.’

content: 26 Have you not heard? Of old I planned that very thing, I designed it long ago, And now have fulfilled it. And it has come to pass, Laying fortified towns waste in desolate heaps.
content_old: 26 Have you not heard? Of old I planned that very thing, I designed it long ago, And now have fulfilled it. And it has come to pass, Laying fortified towns waste in desolate heaps.

content: 27 Their inhabitants are helpless, Dismayed and shamed. They were but grass of the field And green herbage, Grass of the roofs that is blasted Before the east wind.
content_old: 27 Their inhabitants are helpless, Dismayed and shamed. They were but grass of the field And green herbage, Grass of the roofs that is blasted Before the east wind.

content: 28 I know your stayings And your goings and comings, And how you have raged against Me,
content_old: 28 I know your stayings And your goings and comings, And how you have raged against Me,

content: 29 Because you have raged against Me, And your tumult has reached My ears, I will place My hook in your nose And My bit between your jaws; And I will make you go back by the road By which you came.
content_old: 29 Because you have raged against Me, And your tumult has reached My ears, I will place My hook in your nose And My bit between your jaws; And I will make you go back by the road By which you came.

content: 30 “And this is the sign for you: This year you eat what grows of itself, and the next year what springs from that, and in the third year sow and reap and plant vineyards and eat their fruit.
content_old: 30 “And this is the sign for you: This year you eat what grows of itself, and the next year what springs from that, and in the third year sow and reap and plant vineyards and eat their fruit.

content: 31 And the survivors of the House of Judah that have escaped shall renew its trunk below and produce boughs above.
content_old: 31 And the survivors of the House of Judah that have escaped shall renew its trunk below and produce boughs above.

content: 32 For a remnant shall come forth from Jerusalem, Survivors from Mount Zion. The zeal of the LORD of Hosts Shall bring this to pass.
content_old: 32 For a remnant shall come forth from Jerusalem, Survivors from Mount Zion. The zeal of the LORD of Hosts Shall bring this to pass.

content: 33 “Assuredly, thus said the LORD concerning the king of Assyria: He shall not enter this city; He shall not shoot an arrow at it, Or advance upon it with a shield, Or pile up a siegemound against it.
content_old: 33 “Assuredly, thus said the LORD concerning the king of Assyria: He shall not enter this city; He shall not shoot an arrow at it, Or advance upon it with a shield, Or pile up a siegemound against it.

content: 34 He shall go back By the way he came, He shall not enter this city —declares the LORD;
content_old: 34 He shall go back By the way he came, He shall not enter this city —declares the LORD;

content: 35 I will protect and save this city for My sake And for the sake of My servant David.”
content_old: 35 I will protect and save this city for My sake And for the sake of My servant David.”

content: 36 an angel of the LORD went out and struck down one hundred and eighty-five thousand in the Assyrian camp, and the following morning they were all dead corpses.
content_old: 36 an angel of the LORD went out and struck down one hundred and eighty-five thousand in the Assyrian camp, and the following morning they were all dead corpses.

content: 37 So King Sennacherib of Assyria broke camp and retreated, and stayed in Nineveh.
content_old: 37 So King Sennacherib of Assyria broke camp and retreated, and stayed in Nineveh.

content: 1 In those days Hezekiah fell dangerously ill. The prophet Isaiah son of Amoz came and said to him, “Thus said the LORD: Set your affairs in order, for you are going to die; you will not get well.”
content_old: 1 In those days Hezekiah fell dangerously ill. The prophet Isaiah son of Amoz came and said to him, “Thus said the LORD: Set your affairs in order, for you are going to die; you will not get well.”

content: 2 Thereupon Hezekiah turned his face to the wall and prayed to the LORD.
content_old: 2 Thereupon Hezekiah turned his face to the wall and prayed to the LORD.

content: 3 “Please, O LORD,” he said, “remember how I have walked before You sincerely and wholeheartedly, and have done what is pleasing to You.” And Hezekiah wept profusely.
content_old: 3 “Please, O LORD,” he said, “remember how I have walked before You sincerely and wholeheartedly, and have done what is pleasing to You.” And Hezekiah wept profusely.

content: 4 Then the word of the LORD came to Isaiah:
content_old: 4 Then the word of the LORD came to Isaiah:

content: 5 “Go and tell Hezekiah: Thus said the LORD, the God of your father David: I have heard your prayer, I have seen your tears. I hereby add fifteen years to your life.
content_old: 5 “Go and tell Hezekiah: Thus said the LORD, the God of your father David: I have heard your prayer, I have seen your tears. I hereby add fifteen years to your life.

content: 6 I will also rescue you and this city from the hands of the king of Assyria. I will protect this city.
content_old: 6 I will also rescue you and this city from the hands of the king of Assyria. I will protect this city.

content: 7 And this is the sign for you from the LORD that the LORD will do the thing that He has promised:
content_old: 7 And this is the sign for you from the LORD that the LORD will do the thing that He has promised:

content: 8 I am going to make the shadow on the steps, which has descended on the dial of Ahaz because of the sun, recede ten steps.” And the sun’s shadowreceded ten steps, the same steps as it had descended.
content_old: 8 I am going to make the shadow on the steps, which has descended on the dial of Ahaz because of the sun, recede ten steps.” And the sun’s shadowreceded ten steps, the same steps as it had descended.

content: 9 A poem by King Hezekiah of Judah when he recovered from the illness he had suffered:
content_old: 9 A poem by King Hezekiah of Judah when he recovered from the illness he had suffered:

content: 10 I had thought: I must depart in the middle of my days; I have been consigned to the gates of Sheol For the rest of my years.
content_old: 10 I had thought: I must depart in the middle of my days; I have been consigned to the gates of Sheol For the rest of my years.

content: 11 I thought, I shall never see Yah, Yah in the land of the living, Or ever behold men again Among those who inhabit the earth.
content_old: 11 I thought, I shall never see Yah, Yah in the land of the living, Or ever behold men again Among those who inhabit the earth.

content: 12 My dwelling is pulled up and removed from me Like a tent of shepherds; My life is rolled up like a web And cut from the thrum. Only from daybreak to nightfall Was I kept whole,
content_old: 12 My dwelling is pulled up and removed from me Like a tent of shepherds; My life is rolled up like a web And cut from the thrum. Only from daybreak to nightfall Was I kept whole,

content: 13 Then it was as though a lion Were breaking all my bones; I cried out until morning. Only from daybreak to nightfall Was I kept whole.
content_old: 13 Then it was as though a lion Were breaking all my bones; I cried out until morning. Only from daybreak to nightfall Was I kept whole.

content: 14 I piped like a swift or a swallow, I moaned like a dove, As my eyes, all worn, looked to heaven: “My Lord, I am in straits; Be my surety!”
content_old: 14 I piped like a swift or a swallow, I moaned like a dove, As my eyes, all worn, looked to heaven: “My Lord, I am in straits; Be my surety!”

content: 15 What can I say? He promised me, And He it is who has wrought it. All my sleep had fled Because of the bitterness of my soul.
content_old: 15 What can I say? He promised me, And He it is who has wrought it. All my sleep had fled Because of the bitterness of my soul.

content: 16 My Lord, for all that and despite it My life-breath is revived; You have restored me to health and revived me.
content_old: 16 My Lord, for all that and despite it My life-breath is revived; You have restored me to health and revived me.

content: 17 Truly, it was for my own good That I had such great bitterness: You saved my life From the pit of destruction, For You have cast behind Your back All my offenses.
content_old: 17 Truly, it was for my own good That I had such great bitterness: You saved my life From the pit of destruction, For You have cast behind Your back All my offenses.

content: 18 For it is not Sheol that praises You, Not Death that extols You; Nor do they who descend into the Pit Hope for Your grace.
content_old: 18 For it is not Sheol that praises You, Not Death that extols You; Nor do they who descend into the Pit Hope for Your grace.

content: 19 The living, only the living Can give thanks to You As I do this day; Fathers relate to children Your acts of grace:
content_old: 19 The living, only the living Can give thanks to You As I do this day; Fathers relate to children Your acts of grace:

content: 20 “the LORD to deliver us, That is why we offer up music All the days of our lives At the House of the LORD.”
content_old: 20 “the LORD to deliver us, That is why we offer up music All the days of our lives At the House of the LORD.”

content: 21 When Isaiah said, “Let them take a cake of figs and apply it to the rash, and he will recover,”
content_old: 21 When Isaiah said, “Let them take a cake of figs and apply it to the rash, and he will recover,”

content: 1 At that time, Merodach-baladan son of Baladan, the king of Babylon, sent envoys with a letter and a gift to Hezekiah, for he had heard about his illness and recovery.
content_old: 1 At that time, Merodach-baladan son of Baladan, the king of Babylon, sent envoys with a letter and a gift to Hezekiah, for he had heard about his illness and recovery.

content: 2 Hezekiah was pleased by their coming, and he showed them his treasure house—the silver, the gold, the spices, and the fragrant oil—and all his armory, and everything that was to be found in his storehouses. There was nothing in his palace or in all his realm that Hezekiah did not show them.
content_old: 2 Hezekiah was pleased by their coming, and he showed them his treasure house—the silver, the gold, the spices, and the fragrant oil—and all his armory, and everything that was to be found in his storehouses. There was nothing in his palace or in all his realm that Hezekiah did not show them.

content: 3 Then the prophet Isaiah came to King Hezekiah. “What,” he demanded of him, “did those men say to you? Where have they come to you from?” “They have come to me,” replied Hezekiah, “from a far country, from Babylon.”
content_old: 3 Then the prophet Isaiah came to King Hezekiah. “What,” he demanded of him, “did those men say to you? Where have they come to you from?” “They have come to me,” replied Hezekiah, “from a far country, from Babylon.”

content: 4 Next he asked, “What have they seen in your palace?” And Hezekiah replied, “They have seen everything there is in my palace. There was nothing in my storehouses that I did not show them.”
content_old: 4 Next he asked, “What have they seen in your palace?” And Hezekiah replied, “They have seen everything there is in my palace. There was nothing in my storehouses that I did not show them.”

content: 5 Then Isaiah said to Hezekiah, “Hear the word of the LORD of Hosts:
content_old: 5 Then Isaiah said to Hezekiah, “Hear the word of the LORD of Hosts:

content: 6 A time is coming when everything in your palace, which your ancestors have stored up to this day, will be carried off to Babylon; nothing will be left behind, said the LORD.
content_old: 6 A time is coming when everything in your palace, which your ancestors have stored up to this day, will be carried off to Babylon; nothing will be left behind, said the LORD.

content: 7 And some of your sons, your own issue, whom you will have fathered, will be taken to serve as eunuchs in the palace of the king of Babylon.”
content_old: 7 And some of your sons, your own issue, whom you will have fathered, will be taken to serve as eunuchs in the palace of the king of Babylon.”

content: 1 Comfort, oh comfort My people, Says your God.
content_old: 1 Comfort, oh comfort My people, Says your God.

content: 2 Speak tenderly to Jerusalem, And declare to her That her term of service is over, That her iniquity is expiated; For she has received at the hand of the LORD Double for all her sins.
content_old: 2 Speak tenderly to Jerusalem, And declare to her That her term of service is over, That her iniquity is expiated; For she has received at the hand of the LORD Double for all her sins.

content: 3 A voice rings out: “Clear in the desert A road for the LORD! Level in the wilderness A highway for our God!
content_old: 3 A voice rings out: “Clear in the desert A road for the LORD! Level in the wilderness A highway for our God!

content: 4 Let every valley be raised, Every hill and mount made low. Let the rugged ground become level And the ridges become a plain.
content_old: 4 Let every valley be raised, Every hill and mount made low. Let the rugged ground become level And the ridges become a plain.

content: 5 The Presence of the LORD shall appear, And all flesh, as one, shall behold— For the LORD Himself has spoken.”
content_old: 5 The Presence of the LORD shall appear, And all flesh, as one, shall behold— For the LORD Himself has spoken.”

content: 6 A voice rings out: “Proclaim!” Another asks, “What shall I proclaim?” “All flesh is grass, All its goodness like flowers of the field:
content_old: 6 A voice rings out: “Proclaim!” Another asks, “What shall I proclaim?” “All flesh is grass, All its goodness like flowers of the field:

content: 7 Grass withers, flowers fade When the breath of the LORD blows on them. Indeed, man is but grass:
content_old: 7 Grass withers, flowers fade When the breath of the LORD blows on them. Indeed, man is but grass:

content: 8 Grass withers, flowers fade— But the word of our God is always fulfilled!”
content_old: 8 Grass withers, flowers fade— But the word of our God is always fulfilled!”

content: 9 Ascend a lofty mountain, O herald of joy to Zion; Raise your voice with power, O herald of joy to Jerusalem— Raise it, have no fear; Announce to the cities of Judah: Behold your God!
content_old: 9 Ascend a lofty mountain, O herald of joy to Zion; Raise your voice with power, O herald of joy to Jerusalem— Raise it, have no fear; Announce to the cities of Judah: Behold your God!

content: 10 Behold, the Lord GOD comes in might, And His arm wins triumph for Him; See, His reward is with Him, His recompense before Him.
content_old: 10 Behold, the Lord GOD comes in might, And His arm wins triumph for Him; See, His reward is with Him, His recompense before Him.

content: 11 Like a shepherd He pastures His flock: He gathers the lambs in His arms And carries them in His bosom; Gently He drives the mother sheep.
content_old: 11 Like a shepherd He pastures His flock: He gathers the lambs in His arms And carries them in His bosom; Gently He drives the mother sheep.

content: 12 Who measured the waters with the hollow of His hand, And gauged the skies with a span, And meted earth’s dust with a measure, And weighed the mountains with a scale And the hills with a balance?
content_old: 12 Who measured the waters with the hollow of His hand, And gauged the skies with a span, And meted earth’s dust with a measure, And weighed the mountains with a scale And the hills with a balance?

content: 13 Who has plumbed the mind of the LORD, What man could tell Him His plan?
content_old: 13 Who has plumbed the mind of the LORD, What man could tell Him His plan?

content: 14 Whom did He consult, and who taught Him, Guided Him in the way of right? Who guided Him in knowledge And showed Him the path of wisdom?
content_old: 14 Whom did He consult, and who taught Him, Guided Him in the way of right? Who guided Him in knowledge And showed Him the path of wisdom?

content: 15 The nations are but a drop in a bucket, Reckoned as dust on a balance; The very coastlands He lifts like motes.
content_old: 15 The nations are but a drop in a bucket, Reckoned as dust on a balance; The very coastlands He lifts like motes.

content: 16 Lebanon is not fuel enough, Nor its beasts enough for sacrifice.
content_old: 16 Lebanon is not fuel enough, Nor its beasts enough for sacrifice.

content: 17 All nations are as naught in His sight; He accounts them as less than nothing.
content_old: 17 All nations are as naught in His sight; He accounts them as less than nothing.

content: 18 To whom, then, can you liken God, What form compare to Him?
content_old: 18 To whom, then, can you liken God, What form compare to Him?

content: 19 The idol? A woodworker shaped it, And a smith overlaid it with gold, Forging links of silver.
content_old: 19 The idol? A woodworker shaped it, And a smith overlaid it with gold, Forging links of silver.

content: 20 As a gift, he chooses the mulberry— A wood that does not rot— Then seeks a skillful woodworker To make a firm idol, That will not topple.
content_old: 20 As a gift, he chooses the mulberry— A wood that does not rot— Then seeks a skillful woodworker To make a firm idol, That will not topple.

content: 21 Do you not know? Have you not heard? Have you not been told From the very first? Have you not discerned How the earth was founded?
content_old: 21 Do you not know? Have you not heard? Have you not been told From the very first? Have you not discerned How the earth was founded?

content: 22 It is He who is enthroned above the vault of the earth, So that its inhabitants seem as grasshoppers; Who spread out the skies like gauze, Stretched them out like a tent to dwell in.
content_old: 22 It is He who is enthroned above the vault of the earth, So that its inhabitants seem as grasshoppers; Who spread out the skies like gauze, Stretched them out like a tent to dwell in.

content: 23 He brings potentates to naught, Makes rulers of the earth as nothing.
content_old: 23 He brings potentates to naught, Makes rulers of the earth as nothing.

content: 24 Hardly are they planted, Hardly are they sown, Hardly has their stem Taken root in earth, When He blows upon them and they dry up, And the storm bears them off like straw.
content_old: 24 Hardly are they planted, Hardly are they sown, Hardly has their stem Taken root in earth, When He blows upon them and they dry up, And the storm bears them off like straw.

content: 25 To whom, then, can you liken Me, To whom can I be compared? —says the Holy One.
content_old: 25 To whom, then, can you liken Me, To whom can I be compared? —says the Holy One.

content: 26 Lift high your eyes and see: Who created these? He who sends out their host by count, Who calls them each by name: Because of His great might and vast power, Not one fails to appear.
content_old: 26 Lift high your eyes and see: Who created these? He who sends out their host by count, Who calls them each by name: Because of His great might and vast power, Not one fails to appear.

content: 27 Why do you say, O Jacob, Why declare, O Israel, “My way is hid from the LORD, My cause is ignored by my God”?
content_old: 27 Why do you say, O Jacob, Why declare, O Israel, “My way is hid from the LORD, My cause is ignored by my God”?

content: 28 Do you not know? Have you not heard? The LORD is God from of old, Creator of the earth from end to end, He never grows faint or weary, His wisdom cannot be fathomed.
content_old: 28 Do you not know? Have you not heard? The LORD is God from of old, Creator of the earth from end to end, He never grows faint or weary, His wisdom cannot be fathomed.

content: 29 He gives strength to the weary, Fresh vigor to the spent.
content_old: 29 He gives strength to the weary, Fresh vigor to the spent.

content: 30 Youths may grow faint and weary, And young men stumble and fall;
content_old: 30 Youths may grow faint and weary, And young men stumble and fall;

content: 1 Stand silent before Me, coastlands, And let nations renew their strength. Let them approach to state their case; Let us come forward together for argument.
content_old: 1 Stand silent before Me, coastlands, And let nations renew their strength. Let them approach to state their case; Let us come forward together for argument.

content: 2 Who has roused a victor from the East, Summoned him to His service? Has delivered up nations to him, And trodden sovereigns down? Has rendered their swords like dust, Their bows like wind-blown straw?
content_old: 2 Who has roused a victor from the East, Summoned him to His service? Has delivered up nations to him, And trodden sovereigns down? Has rendered their swords like dust, Their bows like wind-blown straw?

content: 3 He pursues them, he goes on unscathed; No shackle is placed on his feet.
content_old: 3 He pursues them, he goes on unscathed; No shackle is placed on his feet.

content: 4 Who has wrought and achieved this? He who announced the generations from the start— I, the LORD, who was first And will be with the last as well.
content_old: 4 Who has wrought and achieved this? He who announced the generations from the start— I, the LORD, who was first And will be with the last as well.

content: 5 The coastlands look on in fear, The ends of earth tremble. They draw near and come;
content_old: 5 The coastlands look on in fear, The ends of earth tremble. They draw near and come;

content: 6 Each one helps the other, Saying to his fellow, “Take courage!”
content_old: 6 Each one helps the other, Saying to his fellow, “Take courage!”

content: 7 The woodworker encourages the smith; He who flattens with the hammer Encourages him who pounds the anvil. He says of the riveting, “It is good!” And he fixes it with nails, That it may not topple.
content_old: 7 The woodworker encourages the smith; He who flattens with the hammer Encourages him who pounds the anvil. He says of the riveting, “It is good!” And he fixes it with nails, That it may not topple.

content: 8 But you, Israel, My servant, Jacob, whom I have chosen, Seed of Abraham My friend—
content_old: 8 But you, Israel, My servant, Jacob, whom I have chosen, Seed of Abraham My friend—

content: 9 You whom I drew from the ends of the earth And called from its far corners, To whom I said: You are My servant; I chose you, I have not rejected you—
content_old: 9 You whom I drew from the ends of the earth And called from its far corners, To whom I said: You are My servant; I chose you, I have not rejected you—

content: 10 Fear not, for I am with you, Be not frightened, for I am your God; I strengthen you and I help you, I uphold you with My victorious right hand.
content_old: 10 Fear not, for I am with you, Be not frightened, for I am your God; I strengthen you and I help you, I uphold you with My victorious right hand.

content: 11 Shamed and chagrined shall be All who contend with you; They who strive with you Shall become as naught and shall perish.
content_old: 11 Shamed and chagrined shall be All who contend with you; They who strive with you Shall become as naught and shall perish.

content: 12 You may seek, but shall not find Those who struggle with you; Less than nothing shall be The men who battle against you.
content_old: 12 You may seek, but shall not find Those who struggle with you; Less than nothing shall be The men who battle against you.

content: 13 For I the LORD am your God, Who grasped your right hand, Who say to you: Have no fear; I will be your help.
content_old: 13 For I the LORD am your God, Who grasped your right hand, Who say to you: Have no fear; I will be your help.

content: 14 Fear not, O worm Jacob, O men of Israel: I will help you —declares the LORD— I your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel.
content_old: 14 Fear not, O worm Jacob, O men of Israel: I will help you —declares the LORD— I your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel.

content: 15 I will make of you a threshing board, A new thresher, with many spikes; You shall thresh mountains to dust, And make hills like chaff.
content_old: 15 I will make of you a threshing board, A new thresher, with many spikes; You shall thresh mountains to dust, And make hills like chaff.

content: 16 You shall winnow them And the wind shall carry them off; The whirlwind shall scatter them. But you shall rejoice in the LORD, And glory in the Holy One of Israel.
content_old: 16 You shall winnow them And the wind shall carry them off; The whirlwind shall scatter them. But you shall rejoice in the LORD, And glory in the Holy One of Israel.

content: 17 The poor and the needy Seek water, and there is none; Their tongue is parched with thirst. I the LORD will respond to them. I, the God of Israel, will not forsake them.
content_old: 17 The poor and the needy Seek water, and there is none; Their tongue is parched with thirst. I the LORD will respond to them. I, the God of Israel, will not forsake them.

content: 18 I will open up streams on the bare hills And fountains amid the valleys; I will turn the desert into ponds, The arid land into springs of water.
content_old: 18 I will open up streams on the bare hills And fountains amid the valleys; I will turn the desert into ponds, The arid land into springs of water.

content: 19 I will plant cedars in the wilderness, Acacias and myrtles and oleasters; I will set cypresses in the desert, Box trees and elms as well—
content_old: 19 I will plant cedars in the wilderness, Acacias and myrtles and oleasters; I will set cypresses in the desert, Box trees and elms as well—

content: 20 That men may see and know, Consider and comprehend That the LORD’s hand has done this, That the Holy One of Israel has wrought it.
content_old: 20 That men may see and know, Consider and comprehend That the LORD’s hand has done this, That the Holy One of Israel has wrought it.

content: 21 Submit your case, says the LORD; Offer your pleas, says the King of Jacob.
content_old: 21 Submit your case, says the LORD; Offer your pleas, says the King of Jacob.

content: 22 Let them approach and tell us what will happen. Tell us what has occurred, And we will take note of it; Or announce to us what will occur, That we may know the outcome.
content_old: 22 Let them approach and tell us what will happen. Tell us what has occurred, And we will take note of it; Or announce to us what will occur, That we may know the outcome.

content: 23 Foretell what is yet to happen, That we may know that you are gods! Do anything, good or bad, That we may be awed and see.
content_old: 23 Foretell what is yet to happen, That we may know that you are gods! Do anything, good or bad, That we may be awed and see.

content: 24 Why, you are less than nothing, Your effect is less than nullity; One who chooses you is an abomination.
content_old: 24 Why, you are less than nothing, Your effect is less than nullity; One who chooses you is an abomination.

content: 25 I have roused him from the north, and he has come, From the sunrise, one who invokes My name; And he has trampled rulers like mud, Like a potter treading clay.
content_old: 25 I have roused him from the north, and he has come, From the sunrise, one who invokes My name; And he has trampled rulers like mud, Like a potter treading clay.

content: 26 Who foretold this from the start, that we may note it; From aforetime, that we might say, “He is right”? Not one foretold, not one announced; No one has heard your utterance!
content_old: 26 Who foretold this from the start, that we may note it; From aforetime, that we might say, “He is right”? Not one foretold, not one announced; No one has heard your utterance!

content: 27 The things once predicted to Zion— Behold, here they are! And again I send a herald to Jerusalem.
content_old: 27 The things once predicted to Zion— Behold, here they are! And again I send a herald to Jerusalem.

content: 28 But I look and there is not a man; Not one of them can predict Or can respond when I question him.
content_old: 28 But I look and there is not a man; Not one of them can predict Or can respond when I question him.

content: 1 This is My servant, whom I uphold, My chosen one, in whom I delight. I have put My spirit upon him, He shall teach the true way to the nations.
content_old: 1 This is My servant, whom I uphold, My chosen one, in whom I delight. I have put My spirit upon him, He shall teach the true way to the nations.

content: 2 He shall not cry out or shout aloud, Or make his voice heard in the streets.
content_old: 2 He shall not cry out or shout aloud, Or make his voice heard in the streets.

content: 3 He shall not break even a bruised reed, Or snuff out even a dim wick. He shall bring forth the true way.
content_old: 3 He shall not break even a bruised reed, Or snuff out even a dim wick. He shall bring forth the true way.

content: 4 He shall not grow dim or be bruised Till he has established the true way on earth; And the coastlands shall await his teaching.
content_old: 4 He shall not grow dim or be bruised Till he has established the true way on earth; And the coastlands shall await his teaching.

content: 5 Thus said God the LORD, Who created the heavens and stretched them out, Who spread out the earth and what it brings forth, Who gave breath to the people upon it And life to those who walk thereon:
content_old: 5 Thus said God the LORD, Who created the heavens and stretched them out, Who spread out the earth and what it brings forth, Who gave breath to the people upon it And life to those who walk thereon:

content: 6 I the LORD, in My grace, have summoned you, And I have grasped you by the hand. I created you, and appointed you A covenant people, a light of nations—
content_old: 6 I the LORD, in My grace, have summoned you, And I have grasped you by the hand. I created you, and appointed you A covenant people, a light of nations—

content: 7 Opening eyes deprived of light, Rescuing prisoners from confinement, From the dungeon those who sit in darkness.
content_old: 7 Opening eyes deprived of light, Rescuing prisoners from confinement, From the dungeon those who sit in darkness.

content: 8 I am the LORD, that is My name; I will not yield My glory to another, Nor My renown to idols.
content_old: 8 I am the LORD, that is My name; I will not yield My glory to another, Nor My renown to idols.

content: 9 See, the things once predicted have come, And now I foretell new things, Announce to you ere they sprout up.
content_old: 9 See, the things once predicted have come, And now I foretell new things, Announce to you ere they sprout up.

content: 10 Sing to the LORD a new song, His praise from the ends of the earth— You who sail the sea and you creatures in it, You coastlands and their inhabitants!
content_old: 10 Sing to the LORD a new song, His praise from the ends of the earth— You who sail the sea and you creatures in it, You coastlands and their inhabitants!

content: 11 Let the desert and its towns cry aloud, The villages where Kedar dwells; Let Sela’s inhabitants shout, Call out from the peaks of the mountains.
content_old: 11 Let the desert and its towns cry aloud, The villages where Kedar dwells; Let Sela’s inhabitants shout, Call out from the peaks of the mountains.

content: 12 Let them do honor to the LORD, And tell His glory in the coastlands.
content_old: 12 Let them do honor to the LORD, And tell His glory in the coastlands.

content: 13 The LORD goes forth like a warrior, Like a fighter He whips up His rage. He yells, He roars aloud, He charges upon His enemies.
content_old: 13 The LORD goes forth like a warrior, Like a fighter He whips up His rage. He yells, He roars aloud, He charges upon His enemies.

content: 14 “I have kept silent far too long, Kept still and restrained Myself; Now I will scream like a woman in labor, I will pant and I will gasp.
content_old: 14 “I have kept silent far too long, Kept still and restrained Myself; Now I will scream like a woman in labor, I will pant and I will gasp.

content: 15 Hills and heights will I scorch, Cause all their green to wither; I will turn rivers into isles, And dry the marshes up.
content_old: 15 Hills and heights will I scorch, Cause all their green to wither; I will turn rivers into isles, And dry the marshes up.

content: 16 I will lead the blind By a road they did not know, And I will make them walk By paths they never knew. I will turn darkness before them to light, Rough places into level ground. These are the promises— I will keep them without fail.
content_old: 16 I will lead the blind By a road they did not know, And I will make them walk By paths they never knew. I will turn darkness before them to light, Rough places into level ground. These are the promises— I will keep them without fail.

content: 17 Driven back and utterly shamed Shall be those who trust in an image, Those who say to idols, ‘You are our gods!’ ”
content_old: 17 Driven back and utterly shamed Shall be those who trust in an image, Those who say to idols, ‘You are our gods!’ ”

content: 18 Listen, you who are deaf; You blind ones, look up and see!
content_old: 18 Listen, you who are deaf; You blind ones, look up and see!

content: 19 Who is so blind as My servant, So deaf as the messenger I send? Who is so blind as the chosen one, So blind as the servant of the LORD?
content_old: 19 Who is so blind as My servant, So deaf as the messenger I send? Who is so blind as the chosen one, So blind as the servant of the LORD?

content: 20 Seeing many things, he gives no heed; With ears open, he hears nothing.
content_old: 20 Seeing many things, he gives no heed; With ears open, he hears nothing.

content: 21 The LORD desires His vindication, That he may magnify and glorify HisTeaching.
content_old: 21 The LORD desires His vindication, That he may magnify and glorify HisTeaching.

content: 22 Yet it is a people plundered and despoiled: All of them are trapped in holes, Imprisoned in dungeons. They are given over to plunder, with none to rescue them; To despoilment, with none to say “Give back!”
content_old: 22 Yet it is a people plundered and despoiled: All of them are trapped in holes, Imprisoned in dungeons. They are given over to plunder, with none to rescue them; To despoilment, with none to say “Give back!”

content: 23 If only you would listen to this, Attend and give heed from now on!
content_old: 23 If only you would listen to this, Attend and give heed from now on!

content: 24 Who was it gave Jacob over to despoilment And Israel to plunderers? Surely, the LORD against whom they sinned In whose ways they would not walk And whose Teaching they would not obey.
content_old: 24 Who was it gave Jacob over to despoilment And Israel to plunderers? Surely, the LORD against whom they sinned In whose ways they would not walk And whose Teaching they would not obey.

content: 1 But now thus said the LORD— Who created you, O Jacob, Who formed you, O Israel: Fear not, for I will redeem you; I have singled you out by name, You are Mine.
content_old: 1 But now thus said the LORD— Who created you, O Jacob, Who formed you, O Israel: Fear not, for I will redeem you; I have singled you out by name, You are Mine.

content: 2 When you pass through water, I will be with you; Through streams, They shall not overwhelm you. When you walk through fire, You shall not be scorched; Through flame, It shall not burn you.
content_old: 2 When you pass through water, I will be with you; Through streams, They shall not overwhelm you. When you walk through fire, You shall not be scorched; Through flame, It shall not burn you.

content: 3 For I the LORD am your God, The Holy One of Israel, your Savior. I give Egypt as a ransom for you, Ethiopia and Saba in exchange for you.
content_old: 3 For I the LORD am your God, The Holy One of Israel, your Savior. I give Egypt as a ransom for you, Ethiopia and Saba in exchange for you.

content: 4 Because you are precious to Me, And honored, and I love you, I give men in exchange for you And peoples in your stead.
content_old: 4 Because you are precious to Me, And honored, and I love you, I give men in exchange for you And peoples in your stead.

content: 5 Fear not, for I am with you: I will bring your folk from the East, Will gather you out of the West;
content_old: 5 Fear not, for I am with you: I will bring your folk from the East, Will gather you out of the West;

content: 6 I will say to the North, “Give back!” And to the South, “Do not withhold! Bring My sons from afar, And My daughters from the end of the earth—
content_old: 6 I will say to the North, “Give back!” And to the South, “Do not withhold! Bring My sons from afar, And My daughters from the end of the earth—

content: 7 All who are linked to My name, Whom I have created, Formed, and made for My glory—
content_old: 7 All who are linked to My name, Whom I have created, Formed, and made for My glory—

content: 8 Setting free that people, Blind though it has eyes And deaf though it has ears.”
content_old: 8 Setting free that people, Blind though it has eyes And deaf though it has ears.”

content: 9 All the nations assemble as one, The peoples gather. Who among them declared this, Foretold to us the things that have happened? Let them produce their witnesses and be vindicated, That men, hearing them, may say, “It is true!”
content_old: 9 All the nations assemble as one, The peoples gather. Who among them declared this, Foretold to us the things that have happened? Let them produce their witnesses and be vindicated, That men, hearing them, may say, “It is true!”

content: 10 My witnesses are you —declares the LORD— My servant, whom I have chosen. To the end that you may take thought, And believe in Me, And understand that I am He: Before Me no god was formed, And after Me none shall exist—
content_old: 10 My witnesses are you —declares the LORD— My servant, whom I have chosen. To the end that you may take thought, And believe in Me, And understand that I am He: Before Me no god was formed, And after Me none shall exist—

content: 11 None but me, the LORD; Beside Me, none can grant triumph.
content_old: 11 None but me, the LORD; Beside Me, none can grant triumph.

content: 12 I alone foretold the triumph And I brought it to pass; I announced it, And no strange god was among you. So you are My witnesses —declares the LORD— And I am God.
content_old: 12 I alone foretold the triumph And I brought it to pass; I announced it, And no strange god was among you. So you are My witnesses —declares the LORD— And I am God.

content: 13 Ever since day was, I am He; None can deliver from My hand. When I act, who can reverse it?
content_old: 13 Ever since day was, I am He; None can deliver from My hand. When I act, who can reverse it?

content: 14 Thus said the LORD, Your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel: For your sake I send to Babylon; I will bring down all her bars, And the Chaldeans shall raise their voice in lamentation.
content_old: 14 Thus said the LORD, Your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel: For your sake I send to Babylon; I will bring down all her bars, And the Chaldeans shall raise their voice in lamentation.

content: 15 I am your Holy One, the LORD, Your King, the Creator of Israel.
content_old: 15 I am your Holy One, the LORD, Your King, the Creator of Israel.

content: 16 Thus said the LORD, Who made a road through the sea And a path through mighty waters,
content_old: 16 Thus said the LORD, Who made a road through the sea And a path through mighty waters,

content: 17 Who destroyed chariots and horses, And all the mighty host— They lay down to rise no more, They were extinguished, quenched like a wick:
content_old: 17 Who destroyed chariots and horses, And all the mighty host— They lay down to rise no more, They were extinguished, quenched like a wick:

content: 18 Do not recall what happened of old, Or ponder what happened of yore!
content_old: 18 Do not recall what happened of old, Or ponder what happened of yore!

content: 19 I am about to do something new; Even now it shall come to pass, Suddenly you shall perceive it: I will make a road through the wilderness And rivers in the desert.
content_old: 19 I am about to do something new; Even now it shall come to pass, Suddenly you shall perceive it: I will make a road through the wilderness And rivers in the desert.

content: 20 The wild beasts shall honor Me, Jackals and ostriches, For I provide water in the wilderness, Rivers in the desert, To give drink to My chosen people,
content_old: 20 The wild beasts shall honor Me, Jackals and ostriches, For I provide water in the wilderness, Rivers in the desert, To give drink to My chosen people,

content: 21 The people I formed for Myself That they might declare my praise.
content_old: 21 The people I formed for Myself That they might declare my praise.

content: 22 But you have not worshiped Me, O Jacob, That you should be weary of Me, O Israel.
content_old: 22 But you have not worshiped Me, O Jacob, That you should be weary of Me, O Israel.

content: 23 You have not brought Me your sheep for burnt offerings, Nor honored Me with your sacrifices. I have not burdened you with meal offerings, Nor wearied you about frankincense.
content_old: 23 You have not brought Me your sheep for burnt offerings, Nor honored Me with your sacrifices. I have not burdened you with meal offerings, Nor wearied you about frankincense.

content: 24 You have not bought Me fragrant reed with money, Nor sated Me with the fat of your sacrifices. Instead, you have burdened Me with your sins, You have wearied Me with your iniquities.
content_old: 24 You have not bought Me fragrant reed with money, Nor sated Me with the fat of your sacrifices. Instead, you have burdened Me with your sins, You have wearied Me with your iniquities.

content: 25 It is I, I who—for My own sake— Wipe your transgressions away And remember your sins no more.
content_old: 25 It is I, I who—for My own sake— Wipe your transgressions away And remember your sins no more.
