content: 26 Help me remember! Let us join in argument, Tell your version, That you may be vindicated.
content_old: 26 Help me remember! Let us join in argument, Tell your version, That you may be vindicated.

content: 27 Your earliest ancestor sinned, And your spokesmen transgressed against Me.
content_old: 27 Your earliest ancestor sinned, And your spokesmen transgressed against Me.

content: 1 But hear, now, O Jacob My servant, Israel whom I have chosen!
content_old: 1 But hear, now, O Jacob My servant, Israel whom I have chosen!

content: 2 Thus said the LORD, your Maker, Your Creator who has helped you since birth: Fear not, My servant Jacob, Jeshurun whom I have chosen,
content_old: 2 Thus said the LORD, your Maker, Your Creator who has helped you since birth: Fear not, My servant Jacob, Jeshurun whom I have chosen,

content: 3 Even as I pour water on thirsty soil, And rain upon dry ground, So will I pour My spirit on your offspring, My blessing upon your posterity.
content_old: 3 Even as I pour water on thirsty soil, And rain upon dry ground, So will I pour My spirit on your offspring, My blessing upon your posterity.

content: 4 And they shall sprout like grass, Like willows by watercourses.
content_old: 4 And they shall sprout like grass, Like willows by watercourses.

content: 5 One shall say, “I am the LORD’s,” Another shall use the name of “Jacob,” Another shall mark his arm “of the LORD” And adopt the name of “Israel.”
content_old: 5 One shall say, “I am the LORD’s,” Another shall use the name of “Jacob,” Another shall mark his arm “of the LORD” And adopt the name of “Israel.”

content: 6 Thus said the LORD, the King of Israel, Their Redeemer, the LORD of Hosts: I am the first and I am the last, And there is no god but Me.
content_old: 6 Thus said the LORD, the King of Israel, Their Redeemer, the LORD of Hosts: I am the first and I am the last, And there is no god but Me.

content: 7 Who like Me can announce, Can foretell it—and match Me thereby? Even as I told the future to an ancient people, So let him foretell coming events to them.
content_old: 7 Who like Me can announce, Can foretell it—and match Me thereby? Even as I told the future to an ancient people, So let him foretell coming events to them.

content: 8 Do not be frightened, do not be shaken! Have I not from of old predicted to you? I foretold, and you are My witnesses. Is there any god, then, but Me? “There is no other rock; I know none!”
content_old: 8 Do not be frightened, do not be shaken! Have I not from of old predicted to you? I foretold, and you are My witnesses. Is there any god, then, but Me? “There is no other rock; I know none!”

content: 9 The makers of idols All work to no purpose; And the things they treasure Can do no good, As they themselves can testify. They neither look nor think, And so they shall be shamed.
content_old: 9 The makers of idols All work to no purpose; And the things they treasure Can do no good, As they themselves can testify. They neither look nor think, And so they shall be shamed.

content: 10 Who would fashion a god Or cast a statue That can do no good?
content_old: 10 Who would fashion a god Or cast a statue That can do no good?

content: 11 Lo, all its adherents shall be shamed; They are craftsmen, are merely human. Let them all assemble and stand up! They shall be cowed, and they shall be shamed.
content_old: 11 Lo, all its adherents shall be shamed; They are craftsmen, are merely human. Let them all assemble and stand up! They shall be cowed, and they shall be shamed.

content: 12 The craftsman in iron, with his tools, Works it over charcoal And fashions it by hammering, Working with the strength of his arm. Should he go hungry, his strength would ebb; Should he drink no water, he would grow faint.
content_old: 12 The craftsman in iron, with his tools, Works it over charcoal And fashions it by hammering, Working with the strength of his arm. Should he go hungry, his strength would ebb; Should he drink no water, he would grow faint.

content: 13 The craftsman in wood measures with a line And marks out a shape with a stylus; He forms it with scraping tools, Marking it out with a compass. He gives it a human form, The beauty of a man, to dwell in a shrine.
content_old: 13 The craftsman in wood measures with a line And marks out a shape with a stylus; He forms it with scraping tools, Marking it out with a compass. He gives it a human form, The beauty of a man, to dwell in a shrine.

content: 14 For his use he cuts down cedars; He chooses plane trees and oaks. He sets aside trees of the forest; Or plants firs, and the rain makes them grow.
content_old: 14 For his use he cuts down cedars; He chooses plane trees and oaks. He sets aside trees of the forest; Or plants firs, and the rain makes them grow.

content: 15 All this serves man for fuel: He takes some to warm himself, And he builds a fire and bakes bread. He also makes a god of it and worships it, Fashions an idol and bows down to it!
content_old: 15 All this serves man for fuel: He takes some to warm himself, And he builds a fire and bakes bread. He also makes a god of it and worships it, Fashions an idol and bows down to it!

content: 16 Part of it he burns in a fire: On that part he roasts meat, He eats the roast and is sated; He also warms himself and cries, “Ah, I am warm! I can feel the heat!”
content_old: 16 Part of it he burns in a fire: On that part he roasts meat, He eats the roast and is sated; He also warms himself and cries, “Ah, I am warm! I can feel the heat!”

content: 17 Of the rest he makes a god—his own carving! He bows down to it, worships it; He prays to it and cries, “Save me, for you are my god!”
content_old: 17 Of the rest he makes a god—his own carving! He bows down to it, worships it; He prays to it and cries, “Save me, for you are my god!”

content: 18 They have no wit or judgment: Their eyes are besmeared, and they see not; Their minds, and they cannot think.
content_old: 18 They have no wit or judgment: Their eyes are besmeared, and they see not; Their minds, and they cannot think.

content: 19 They do not give thought, They lack the wit and judgment to say: “Part of it I burned in a fire; I also baked bread on the coals, I roasted meat and ate it— Should I make the rest an abhorrence? Should I bow to a block of wood?”
content_old: 19 They do not give thought, They lack the wit and judgment to say: “Part of it I burned in a fire; I also baked bread on the coals, I roasted meat and ate it— Should I make the rest an abhorrence? Should I bow to a block of wood?”

content: 20 He pursues ashes! A deluded mind has led him astray, And he cannot save himself; He never says to himself, “The thing in my hand is a fraud!”
content_old: 20 He pursues ashes! A deluded mind has led him astray, And he cannot save himself; He never says to himself, “The thing in my hand is a fraud!”

content: 21 Remember these things, O Jacob For you, O Israel, are My servant: I fashioned you, you are My servant— O Israel, never forget Me.
content_old: 21 Remember these things, O Jacob For you, O Israel, are My servant: I fashioned you, you are My servant— O Israel, never forget Me.

content: 22 I wipe away your sins like a cloud, Your transgressions like mist— Come back to Me, for I redeem you.
content_old: 22 I wipe away your sins like a cloud, Your transgressions like mist— Come back to Me, for I redeem you.

content: 23 Shout, O heavens, for the LORD has acted; Shout aloud, O depths of the earth! Shout for joy, O mountains, O forests with all your trees! For the LORD has redeemed Jacob, Has glorified Himself through Israel.
content_old: 23 Shout, O heavens, for the LORD has acted; Shout aloud, O depths of the earth! Shout for joy, O mountains, O forests with all your trees! For the LORD has redeemed Jacob, Has glorified Himself through Israel.

content: 24 Thus said the LORD, your Redeemer, Who formed you in the womb: It is I, the LORD, who made everything, Who alone stretched out the heavens And unaided spread out the earth;
content_old: 24 Thus said the LORD, your Redeemer, Who formed you in the womb: It is I, the LORD, who made everything, Who alone stretched out the heavens And unaided spread out the earth;

content: 25 Who annul the omens of diviners, And make fools of the augurs; Who turn sages back And make nonsense of their knowledge;
content_old: 25 Who annul the omens of diviners, And make fools of the augurs; Who turn sages back And make nonsense of their knowledge;

content: 26 But confirm the word of My servant And fulfill the prediction of My messengers. It is I who say of Jerusalem, “It shall be inhabited,” And of the towns of Judah, “They shall be rebuilt; And I will restore their ruined places.”
content_old: 26 But confirm the word of My servant And fulfill the prediction of My messengers. It is I who say of Jerusalem, “It shall be inhabited,” And of the towns of Judah, “They shall be rebuilt; And I will restore their ruined places.”

content: 27 who said to the deep, “Be dry; I will dry up your floods,”
content_old: 27 who said to the deep, “Be dry; I will dry up your floods,”

content: 1 Thus said the LORD to Cyrus, His anointed one— Whose right hand He has grasped, Treading down nations before him, Ungirding the loins of kings, Opening doors before him And letting no gate stay shut:
content_old: 1 Thus said the LORD to Cyrus, His anointed one— Whose right hand He has grasped, Treading down nations before him, Ungirding the loins of kings, Opening doors before him And letting no gate stay shut:

content: 2 I will march before you And level the hills that loom up; I will shatter doors of bronze And cut down iron bars.
content_old: 2 I will march before you And level the hills that loom up; I will shatter doors of bronze And cut down iron bars.

content: 3 I will give you treasures concealed in the dark And secret hoards— So that you may know that it is I the LORD, The God of Israel, who call you by name.
content_old: 3 I will give you treasures concealed in the dark And secret hoards— So that you may know that it is I the LORD, The God of Israel, who call you by name.

content: 4 For the sake of My servant Jacob, Israel My chosen one, I call you by name, I hail you by title, though you have not known Me.
content_old: 4 For the sake of My servant Jacob, Israel My chosen one, I call you by name, I hail you by title, though you have not known Me.

content: 5 I am the LORD and there is none else; Beside Me, there is no god. I engird you, though you have not known Me,
content_old: 5 I am the LORD and there is none else; Beside Me, there is no god. I engird you, though you have not known Me,

content: 6 So that they may know, from east to west, That there is none but Me. I am the LORD and there is none else,
content_old: 6 So that they may know, from east to west, That there is none but Me. I am the LORD and there is none else,

content: 7 I form light and create darkness, I make weal and create woe— I the LORD do all these things.
content_old: 7 I form light and create darkness, I make weal and create woe— I the LORD do all these things.

content: 8 Pour down, O skies, from above! Let the heavens rain down victory! Let the earth open up and triumph sprout, Yes, let vindication spring up: I the LORD have created it.
content_old: 8 Pour down, O skies, from above! Let the heavens rain down victory! Let the earth open up and triumph sprout, Yes, let vindication spring up: I the LORD have created it.

content: 9 Shame on him who argues with his Maker, Though naught but a potsherd of earth! Shall the clay say to the potter, “What are you doing? Your work has no handles”?
content_old: 9 Shame on him who argues with his Maker, Though naught but a potsherd of earth! Shall the clay say to the potter, “What are you doing? Your work has no handles”?

content: 10 Shame on him who asks his father, “What are you begetting?” Or a woman, “What are you bearing?”
content_old: 10 Shame on him who asks his father, “What are you begetting?” Or a woman, “What are you bearing?”

content: 11 Thus said the LORD, Israel’s Holy One and Maker: Will you question Me on the destiny of My children, Will you instruct Me about the work of My hands?
content_old: 11 Thus said the LORD, Israel’s Holy One and Maker: Will you question Me on the destiny of My children, Will you instruct Me about the work of My hands?

content: 12 It was I who made the earth And created man upon it; My own hands stretched out the heavens, And I marshaled all their host.
content_old: 12 It was I who made the earth And created man upon it; My own hands stretched out the heavens, And I marshaled all their host.

content: 13 It was I who roused him for victory And who level all roads for him. He shall rebuild My city And let My exiled people go Without price and without payment —said the LORD of Hosts.
content_old: 13 It was I who roused him for victory And who level all roads for him. He shall rebuild My city And let My exiled people go Without price and without payment —said the LORD of Hosts.

content: 14 Thus said the LORD: Egypt’s wealth and Nubia’s gains And Sabaites, long of limb, Shall pass over to you and be yours, Pass over and follow you in fetters, Bow low to you And reverently address you: “Only among you is God, There is no other god at all!
content_old: 14 Thus said the LORD: Egypt’s wealth and Nubia’s gains And Sabaites, long of limb, Shall pass over to you and be yours, Pass over and follow you in fetters, Bow low to you And reverently address you: “Only among you is God, There is no other god at all!

content: 15 You are indeed a God who concealed Himself, O God of Israel, who bring victory!
content_old: 15 You are indeed a God who concealed Himself, O God of Israel, who bring victory!

content: 16 Those who fabricate idols, All are shamed and disgraced; To a man, they slink away in disgrace.
content_old: 16 Those who fabricate idols, All are shamed and disgraced; To a man, they slink away in disgrace.

content: 17 But Israel has won through the LORD Triumph everlasting. You shall not be shamed or disgraced In all the ages to come!”
content_old: 17 But Israel has won through the LORD Triumph everlasting. You shall not be shamed or disgraced In all the ages to come!”

content: 18 For thus said the LORD, The Creator of heaven who alone is God, Who formed the earth and made it, Who alone established it— He did not create it a waste, But formed it for habitation: I am the LORD, and there is none else.
content_old: 18 For thus said the LORD, The Creator of heaven who alone is God, Who formed the earth and made it, Who alone established it— He did not create it a waste, But formed it for habitation: I am the LORD, and there is none else.

content: 19 I did not speak in secret, At a site in a land of darkness; I did not say to the stock of Jacob, “Seek Me out in a wasteland”— I the LORD, who foretell reliably, Who announce what is true.
content_old: 19 I did not speak in secret, At a site in a land of darkness; I did not say to the stock of Jacob, “Seek Me out in a wasteland”— I the LORD, who foretell reliably, Who announce what is true.

content: 20 Come, gather together, Draw nigh, you remnants of the nations! No foreknowledge had they who carry their wooden images And pray to a god who cannot give success.
content_old: 20 Come, gather together, Draw nigh, you remnants of the nations! No foreknowledge had they who carry their wooden images And pray to a god who cannot give success.

content: 21 Speak up, compare testimony— Let them even take counsel together! Who announced this aforetime, Foretold it of old? Was it not I the LORD? Then there is no god beside Me, No God exists beside Me Who foretells truly and grants success.
content_old: 21 Speak up, compare testimony— Let them even take counsel together! Who announced this aforetime, Foretold it of old? Was it not I the LORD? Then there is no god beside Me, No God exists beside Me Who foretells truly and grants success.

content: 22 Turn to Me and gain success, All the ends of earth! For I am God, and there is none else.
content_old: 22 Turn to Me and gain success, All the ends of earth! For I am God, and there is none else.

content: 23 By Myself have I sworn, From My mouth has issued truth, A word that shall not turn back: To Me every knee shall bend, Every tongue swear loyalty.
content_old: 23 By Myself have I sworn, From My mouth has issued truth, A word that shall not turn back: To Me every knee shall bend, Every tongue swear loyalty.

content: 24 They shall say: “Only through the LORD Can I find victory and might. When people trust in Him, All their adversaries are put to shame.
content_old: 24 They shall say: “Only through the LORD Can I find victory and might. When people trust in Him, All their adversaries are put to shame.

content: 1 Bel is bowed, Nebo is cowering, Their images are a burden for beasts and cattle; The things you would carry Are now piled as a burden On tired .
content_old: 1 Bel is bowed, Nebo is cowering, Their images are a burden for beasts and cattle; The things you would carry Are now piled as a burden On tired .

content: 2 They cowered, they bowed as well, They could not rescue the burden, And they themselves went into captivity.
content_old: 2 They cowered, they bowed as well, They could not rescue the burden, And they themselves went into captivity.

content: 3 Listen to Me, O House of Jacob, All that are left of the House of Israel, Who have been carried since birth, Supported since leaving the womb:
content_old: 3 Listen to Me, O House of Jacob, All that are left of the House of Israel, Who have been carried since birth, Supported since leaving the womb:

content: 4 Till you grow old, I will still be the same; When you turn gray, it is I who will carry; I was the Maker, and I will be the Bearer; And I will carry and rescue .
content_old: 4 Till you grow old, I will still be the same; When you turn gray, it is I who will carry; I was the Maker, and I will be the Bearer; And I will carry and rescue .

content: 5 To whom can you compare Me Or declare Me similar? To whom can you liken Me, So that we seem comparable?
content_old: 5 To whom can you compare Me Or declare Me similar? To whom can you liken Me, So that we seem comparable?

content: 6 Those who squander gold from the purse And weigh out silver on the balance, They hire a metal worker to make it into a god, To which they bow down and prostrate themselves.
content_old: 6 Those who squander gold from the purse And weigh out silver on the balance, They hire a metal worker to make it into a god, To which they bow down and prostrate themselves.

content: 7 They must carry it on their backs and transport it; When they put it down, it stands, It does not budge from its place. If they cry out to it, it does not answer; It cannot save them from their distress.
content_old: 7 They must carry it on their backs and transport it; When they put it down, it stands, It does not budge from its place. If they cry out to it, it does not answer; It cannot save them from their distress.

content: 8 Keep this in mind, and stand firm! Take this to heart, you sinners!
content_old: 8 Keep this in mind, and stand firm! Take this to heart, you sinners!

content: 9 Bear in mind what happened of old; For I am God, and there is none else, I am divine, and there is none like Me.
content_old: 9 Bear in mind what happened of old; For I am God, and there is none else, I am divine, and there is none like Me.

content: 10 I foretell the end from the beginning, And from the start, things that had not occurred. I say: My plan shall be fulfilled; I will do all I have purposed.
content_old: 10 I foretell the end from the beginning, And from the start, things that had not occurred. I say: My plan shall be fulfilled; I will do all I have purposed.

content: 11 I summoned that swooping bird from the East; From a distant land, the man for My purpose. I have spoken, so I will bring it to pass; I have designed it, so I will complete it.
content_old: 11 I summoned that swooping bird from the East; From a distant land, the man for My purpose. I have spoken, so I will bring it to pass; I have designed it, so I will complete it.

content: 12 Listen to Me, you stubborn of heart, Who are far from victory:
content_old: 12 Listen to Me, you stubborn of heart, Who are far from victory:

content: 1 Get down, sit in the dust, Fair Maiden Babylon; Sit, dethroned, on the ground, O Fair Chaldea; Nevermore shall they call you The tender and dainty one.
content_old: 1 Get down, sit in the dust, Fair Maiden Babylon; Sit, dethroned, on the ground, O Fair Chaldea; Nevermore shall they call you The tender and dainty one.

content: 2 Grasp the handmill and grind meal. Remove your veil, Strip off your train, bare your leg, Wade through the rivers.
content_old: 2 Grasp the handmill and grind meal. Remove your veil, Strip off your train, bare your leg, Wade through the rivers.

content: 3 Your nakedness shall be uncovered, And your shame shall be exposed. I will take vengeance, And let no man intercede.
content_old: 3 Your nakedness shall be uncovered, And your shame shall be exposed. I will take vengeance, And let no man intercede.

content: 4 Our Redeemer—LORD of Hosts is His name— Is the Holy One of Israel.
content_old: 4 Our Redeemer—LORD of Hosts is His name— Is the Holy One of Israel.

content: 5 Sit silent; retire into darkness, O Fair Chaldea; Nevermore shall they call you Mistress of Kingdoms.
content_old: 5 Sit silent; retire into darkness, O Fair Chaldea; Nevermore shall they call you Mistress of Kingdoms.

content: 6 I was angry at My people, I defiled My heritage; I put them into your hands, But you showed them no mercy. Even upon the aged you made Your yoke exceedingly heavy.
content_old: 6 I was angry at My people, I defiled My heritage; I put them into your hands, But you showed them no mercy. Even upon the aged you made Your yoke exceedingly heavy.

content: 7 You thought, “I shall always be The mistress still.” You did not take these things to heart, You gave no thought to the end of it.
content_old: 7 You thought, “I shall always be The mistress still.” You did not take these things to heart, You gave no thought to the end of it.

content: 8 And now hear this, O pampered one— Who dwell in security, Who think to yourself, “I am, and there is none but me; I shall not become a widow Or know loss of children”—
content_old: 8 And now hear this, O pampered one— Who dwell in security, Who think to yourself, “I am, and there is none but me; I shall not become a widow Or know loss of children”—

content: 9 These two things shall come upon you, Suddenly, in one day: Loss of children and widowhood Shall come upon you in full measure, Despite your many enchantments And all your countless spells.
content_old: 9 These two things shall come upon you, Suddenly, in one day: Loss of children and widowhood Shall come upon you in full measure, Despite your many enchantments And all your countless spells.

content: 10 You were secure in your wickedness; You thought, “No one can see me.” It was your skill and your science That led you astray. And you thought to yourself, “I am, and there is none but me.”
content_old: 10 You were secure in your wickedness; You thought, “No one can see me.” It was your skill and your science That led you astray. And you thought to yourself, “I am, and there is none but me.”

content: 11 Evil is coming upon you Which you will not know how to charm away; Disaster is falling upon you Which you will not be able to appease; Coming upon you suddenly Is ruin of which you know nothing.
content_old: 11 Evil is coming upon you Which you will not know how to charm away; Disaster is falling upon you Which you will not be able to appease; Coming upon you suddenly Is ruin of which you know nothing.

content: 12 Stand up, with your spells and your many enchantments On which you labored since youth! Perhaps you’ll be able to profit, Perhaps you will find strength.
content_old: 12 Stand up, with your spells and your many enchantments On which you labored since youth! Perhaps you’ll be able to profit, Perhaps you will find strength.

content: 13 You are helpless, despite all your art. Let them stand up and help you now, The scanners of heaven, the star-gazers, Who announce, month by month, Whatever will come upon you.
content_old: 13 You are helpless, despite all your art. Let them stand up and help you now, The scanners of heaven, the star-gazers, Who announce, month by month, Whatever will come upon you.

content: 14 See, they are become like straw, Fire consumes them; They cannot save themselves From the power of the flame; This is no coal for warming oneself, No fire to sit by!
content_old: 14 See, they are become like straw, Fire consumes them; They cannot save themselves From the power of the flame; This is no coal for warming oneself, No fire to sit by!

content: 1 Listen to this, O House of Jacob, Who bear the name Israel And have issued from the waters of Judah, Who swear by the name of the LORD And invoke the God of Israel— Though not in truth and sincerity—
content_old: 1 Listen to this, O House of Jacob, Who bear the name Israel And have issued from the waters of Judah, Who swear by the name of the LORD And invoke the God of Israel— Though not in truth and sincerity—

content: 2 For you are called after the Holy City And you do lean on the God of Israel, Whose name is LORD of Hosts:
content_old: 2 For you are called after the Holy City And you do lean on the God of Israel, Whose name is LORD of Hosts:

content: 3 Long ago, I foretold things that happened, From My mouth they issued, and I announced them; Suddenly I acted, and they came to pass.
content_old: 3 Long ago, I foretold things that happened, From My mouth they issued, and I announced them; Suddenly I acted, and they came to pass.

content: 4 Because I know how stubborn you are Your neck is like an iron sinew And your forehead bronze,
content_old: 4 Because I know how stubborn you are Your neck is like an iron sinew And your forehead bronze,

content: 5 Therefore I told you long beforehand, Announced things to you ere they happened— That you might not say, “My idol caused them, My carved and molten images ordained them.”
content_old: 5 Therefore I told you long beforehand, Announced things to you ere they happened— That you might not say, “My idol caused them, My carved and molten images ordained them.”

content: 6 You have heard all this; look, must you not acknowledge it? As of now, I announce to you new things, Well-guarded secrets you did not know.
content_old: 6 You have heard all this; look, must you not acknowledge it? As of now, I announce to you new things, Well-guarded secrets you did not know.

content: 7 Only now are they created, and not of old; Before today you had not heard them; You cannot say, “I knew them already.”
content_old: 7 Only now are they created, and not of old; Before today you had not heard them; You cannot say, “I knew them already.”

content: 8 You had never heard, you had never known, Your ears were not opened of old. Though I know that you are treacherous, That you were called a rebel from birth,
content_old: 8 You had never heard, you had never known, Your ears were not opened of old. Though I know that you are treacherous, That you were called a rebel from birth,

content: 9 For the sake of My name I control My wrath; To My own glory, I am patient with you, And I will not destroy you.
content_old: 9 For the sake of My name I control My wrath; To My own glory, I am patient with you, And I will not destroy you.

content: 10 See, I refine you, but not as silver; I test you in the furnace of affliction.
content_old: 10 See, I refine you, but not as silver; I test you in the furnace of affliction.

content: 11 For My sake, My own sake, do I act— Lest My name be dishonored! I will not give My glory to another.
content_old: 11 For My sake, My own sake, do I act— Lest My name be dishonored! I will not give My glory to another.

content: 12 Listen to Me, O Jacob, Israel, whom I have called: I am He—I am the first, And I am the last as well.
content_old: 12 Listen to Me, O Jacob, Israel, whom I have called: I am He—I am the first, And I am the last as well.

content: 13 My own hand founded the earth, My right hand spread out the skies. I call unto them, let them stand up.
content_old: 13 My own hand founded the earth, My right hand spread out the skies. I call unto them, let them stand up.

content: 14 Assemble, all of you, and listen! Who among you foretold these things: “He whom the LORD loves Shall work His will against Babylon, And, with His might, against Chaldea”?
content_old: 14 Assemble, all of you, and listen! Who among you foretold these things: “He whom the LORD loves Shall work His will against Babylon, And, with His might, against Chaldea”?

content: 15 I, I predicted, and I called him; I have brought him and he shall succeed in his mission.
content_old: 15 I, I predicted, and I called him; I have brought him and he shall succeed in his mission.

content: 16 Draw near to Me and hear this: From the beginning, I did not speak in secret; From the time anything existed, I was there. “And now the Lord God has sent me, endowed with His spirit.”
content_old: 16 Draw near to Me and hear this: From the beginning, I did not speak in secret; From the time anything existed, I was there. “And now the Lord God has sent me, endowed with His spirit.”

content: 17 Thus said the LORD your Redeemer, The Holy One of Israel: I the LORD am your God, Instructing you for your own benefit. Guiding you in the way you should go.
content_old: 17 Thus said the LORD your Redeemer, The Holy One of Israel: I the LORD am your God, Instructing you for your own benefit. Guiding you in the way you should go.

content: 18 If only you would heed My commands! Then your prosperity would be like a river, Your triumph like the waves of the sea.
content_old: 18 If only you would heed My commands! Then your prosperity would be like a river, Your triumph like the waves of the sea.

content: 19 Your offspring would be as many as the sand, Their issue as many as its grains. Their name would never be cut off Or obliterated from before Me.
content_old: 19 Your offspring would be as many as the sand, Their issue as many as its grains. Their name would never be cut off Or obliterated from before Me.

content: 20 Go forth from Babylon, Flee from Chaldea! Declare this with loud shouting, Announce this, Bring out the word to the ends of the earth!
content_old: 20 Go forth from Babylon, Flee from Chaldea! Declare this with loud shouting, Announce this, Bring out the word to the ends of the earth!

content: 21 Say: “The LORD has redeemed His servant Jacob!” They have known no thirst, Though He led them through parched places; He made water flow for them from the rock; He cleaved the rock and water gushed forth.
content_old: 21 Say: “The LORD has redeemed His servant Jacob!” They have known no thirst, Though He led them through parched places; He made water flow for them from the rock; He cleaved the rock and water gushed forth.

content: 1 Listen, O coastlands, to me, And give heed, O nations afar: The LORD appointed me before I was born, He named me while I was in my mother’s womb.
content_old: 1 Listen, O coastlands, to me, And give heed, O nations afar: The LORD appointed me before I was born, He named me while I was in my mother’s womb.

content: 2 He made my mouth like a sharpened blade, He hid me in the shadow of His hand, And He made me like a polished arrow; He concealed me in His quiver.
content_old: 2 He made my mouth like a sharpened blade, He hid me in the shadow of His hand, And He made me like a polished arrow; He concealed me in His quiver.

content: 3 And He said to me, “You are My servant, Israel in whom I glory.”
content_old: 3 And He said to me, “You are My servant, Israel in whom I glory.”

content: 4 I thought, “I have labored in vain, I have spent my strength for empty breath.” But my case rested with the LORD, My recompense was in the hands of my God.
content_old: 4 I thought, “I have labored in vain, I have spent my strength for empty breath.” But my case rested with the LORD, My recompense was in the hands of my God.

content: 5 And now the LORD has resolved— He who formed me in the womb to be His servant— To bring back Jacob to Himself, That Israel may be restored to Him. And I have been honored in the sight of the LORD, My God has been my strength.
content_old: 5 And now the LORD has resolved— He who formed me in the womb to be His servant— To bring back Jacob to Himself, That Israel may be restored to Him. And I have been honored in the sight of the LORD, My God has been my strength.

content: 6 For He has said: “It is too little that you should be My servant In that I raise up the tribes of Jacob And restore the survivors of Israel: I will also make you a light of nations, That My salvation may reach the ends of the earth.”
content_old: 6 For He has said: “It is too little that you should be My servant In that I raise up the tribes of Jacob And restore the survivors of Israel: I will also make you a light of nations, That My salvation may reach the ends of the earth.”

content: 7 Thus said the LORD, The Redeemer of Israel, his Holy One, To the despised one, To the abhorred nations, To the slave of rulers: Kings shall see and stand up; Nobles, and they shall prostrate themselves— To the honor of the LORD, who is faithful, To the Holy One of Israel who chose you.
content_old: 7 Thus said the LORD, The Redeemer of Israel, his Holy One, To the despised one, To the abhorred nations, To the slave of rulers: Kings shall see and stand up; Nobles, and they shall prostrate themselves— To the honor of the LORD, who is faithful, To the Holy One of Israel who chose you.

content: 8 Thus said the LORD: In an hour of favor I answer you, And on a day of salvation I help you— I created you and appointed you a covenant people— Restoring the land, Allotting anew the desolate holdings,
content_old: 8 Thus said the LORD: In an hour of favor I answer you, And on a day of salvation I help you— I created you and appointed you a covenant people— Restoring the land, Allotting anew the desolate holdings,

content: 9 Saying to the prisoners, “Go free,” To those who are in darkness, “Show yourselves.” They shall pasture along the roads, On every bare height shall be their pasture.
content_old: 9 Saying to the prisoners, “Go free,” To those who are in darkness, “Show yourselves.” They shall pasture along the roads, On every bare height shall be their pasture.

content: 10 They shall not hunger or thirst, Hot wind and sun shall not strike them; For He who loves them will lead them, He will guide them to springs of water.
content_old: 10 They shall not hunger or thirst, Hot wind and sun shall not strike them; For He who loves them will lead them, He will guide them to springs of water.

content: 11 I will make all My mountains a road, And My highways shall be built up.
content_old: 11 I will make all My mountains a road, And My highways shall be built up.

content: 12 Look! These are coming from afar, These from the north and the west, And these from the land of Sinim.
content_old: 12 Look! These are coming from afar, These from the north and the west, And these from the land of Sinim.

content: 13 Shout, O heavens, and rejoice, O earth! Break into shouting, O hills! For the LORD has comforted His people, And has taken back His afflicted ones in love.
content_old: 13 Shout, O heavens, and rejoice, O earth! Break into shouting, O hills! For the LORD has comforted His people, And has taken back His afflicted ones in love.

content: 14 Zion says, “The LORD has forsaken me, My Lord has forgotten me.”
content_old: 14 Zion says, “The LORD has forsaken me, My Lord has forgotten me.”

content: 15 Can a woman forget her baby, Or disown the child of her womb? Though she might forget, I never could forget you.
content_old: 15 Can a woman forget her baby, Or disown the child of her womb? Though she might forget, I never could forget you.

content: 16 See, I have engraved you On the palms of My hands, Your walls are ever before Me.
content_old: 16 See, I have engraved you On the palms of My hands, Your walls are ever before Me.

content: 17 Swiftly your children are coming; Those who ravaged and ruined you shall leave you.
content_old: 17 Swiftly your children are coming; Those who ravaged and ruined you shall leave you.

content: 18 Look up all around you and see: They are all assembled, are come to you! As I live —declares the LORD— You shall don them all like jewels, Deck yourself with them like a bride.
content_old: 18 Look up all around you and see: They are all assembled, are come to you! As I live —declares the LORD— You shall don them all like jewels, Deck yourself with them like a bride.

content: 19 As for your ruins and desolate places And your land laid waste— You shall soon be crowded with settlers, While destroyers stay far from you.
content_old: 19 As for your ruins and desolate places And your land laid waste— You shall soon be crowded with settlers, While destroyers stay far from you.

content: 20 The children you thought you had lost Shall yet say in your hearing, “The place is too crowded for me; Make room for me to settle.”
content_old: 20 The children you thought you had lost Shall yet say in your hearing, “The place is too crowded for me; Make room for me to settle.”

content: 21 And you will say to yourself, “Who bore these for me When I was bereaved and barren, Exiled and disdained— By whom, then, were these reared? I was left all alone— And where have these been?”
content_old: 21 And you will say to yourself, “Who bore these for me When I was bereaved and barren, Exiled and disdained— By whom, then, were these reared? I was left all alone— And where have these been?”

content: 22 Thus said the Lord GOD: I will raise My hand to nations And lift up My ensign to peoples; And they shall bring your sons in their bosoms, And carry your daughters on their backs.
content_old: 22 Thus said the Lord GOD: I will raise My hand to nations And lift up My ensign to peoples; And they shall bring your sons in their bosoms, And carry your daughters on their backs.

content: 23 Kings shall tend your children, Their queens shall serve you as nurses. They shall bow to you, face to the ground, And lick the dust of your feet. And you shall know that I am the LORD— Those who trust in Me shall not be shamed.
content_old: 23 Kings shall tend your children, Their queens shall serve you as nurses. They shall bow to you, face to the ground, And lick the dust of your feet. And you shall know that I am the LORD— Those who trust in Me shall not be shamed.

content: 24 Can spoil be taken from a warrior, Or captives retrieved from a victor?
content_old: 24 Can spoil be taken from a warrior, Or captives retrieved from a victor?

content: 25 Yet thus said the LORD: Captives shall be taken from a warrior And spoil shall be retrieved from a tyrant; For I will contend with your adversaries, And I will deliver your children.
content_old: 25 Yet thus said the LORD: Captives shall be taken from a warrior And spoil shall be retrieved from a tyrant; For I will contend with your adversaries, And I will deliver your children.

content: 1 Thus said the LORD: Where is the bill of divorce Of your mother whom I dismissed? And which of My creditors was it To whom I sold you off? You were only sold off for your sins, And your mother dismissed for your crimes.
content_old: 1 Thus said the LORD: Where is the bill of divorce Of your mother whom I dismissed? And which of My creditors was it To whom I sold you off? You were only sold off for your sins, And your mother dismissed for your crimes.

content: 2 Why, when I came, was no one there, Why, when I called, would none respond? Is my arm, then, too short to rescue, Have I not the power to save? With a mere rebuke I dry up the sea, And turn rivers into desert. Their fish stink from lack of water; They lie dead of thirst.
content_old: 2 Why, when I came, was no one there, Why, when I called, would none respond? Is my arm, then, too short to rescue, Have I not the power to save? With a mere rebuke I dry up the sea, And turn rivers into desert. Their fish stink from lack of water; They lie dead of thirst.

content: 3 I clothe the skies in blackness And make their raiment sackcloth.
content_old: 3 I clothe the skies in blackness And make their raiment sackcloth.

content: 4 The Lord GOD gave me a skilled tongue, To know how to speak timely words to the weary. Morning by morning, He rouses, He rouses my ear To give heed like disciples.
content_old: 4 The Lord GOD gave me a skilled tongue, To know how to speak timely words to the weary. Morning by morning, He rouses, He rouses my ear To give heed like disciples.

content: 5 The Lord GOD opened my ears, And I did not disobey, I did not run away.
content_old: 5 The Lord GOD opened my ears, And I did not disobey, I did not run away.

content: 6 I offered my back to the floggers, And my cheeks to those who tore out my hair. I did not hide my face From insult and spittle.
content_old: 6 I offered my back to the floggers, And my cheeks to those who tore out my hair. I did not hide my face From insult and spittle.

content: 7 But the Lord GOD will help me— Therefore I feel no disgrace; Therefore I have set my face like flint, And I know I shall not be shamed.
content_old: 7 But the Lord GOD will help me— Therefore I feel no disgrace; Therefore I have set my face like flint, And I know I shall not be shamed.

content: 8 My Vindicator is at hand— Who dares contend with me? Let us stand up together! Who would be my opponent? Let him approach me!
content_old: 8 My Vindicator is at hand— Who dares contend with me? Let us stand up together! Who would be my opponent? Let him approach me!

content: 9 Lo, the Lord GOD will help me— Who can get a verdict against me? They shall all wear out like a garment, The moth shall consume them.
content_old: 9 Lo, the Lord GOD will help me— Who can get a verdict against me? They shall all wear out like a garment, The moth shall consume them.

content: 10 Who among you reveres the LORD And heeds the voice of His servant?— Though he walk in darkness And have no light, Let him trust in the name of the LORD And rely upon his God.
content_old: 10 Who among you reveres the LORD And heeds the voice of His servant?— Though he walk in darkness And have no light, Let him trust in the name of the LORD And rely upon his God.

content: 1 Listen to Me, you who pursue justice, You who seek the LORD: Look to the rock you were hewn from, To the quarry you were dug from.
content_old: 1 Listen to Me, you who pursue justice, You who seek the LORD: Look to the rock you were hewn from, To the quarry you were dug from.

content: 2 Look back to Abraham your father And to Sarah who brought you forth. For he was only one when I called him, But I blessed him and made him many.
content_old: 2 Look back to Abraham your father And to Sarah who brought you forth. For he was only one when I called him, But I blessed him and made him many.

content: 3 Truly the LORD has comforted Zion, Comforted all her ruins; He has made her wilderness like Eden, Her desert like the Garden of the LORD. Gladness and joy shall abide there, Thanksgiving and the sound of music.
content_old: 3 Truly the LORD has comforted Zion, Comforted all her ruins; He has made her wilderness like Eden, Her desert like the Garden of the LORD. Gladness and joy shall abide there, Thanksgiving and the sound of music.

content: 4 Hearken to Me, My people, And give ear to Me, O My nation, For teaching shall go forth from Me, My way for the light of peoples. In a moment I will bring it:
content_old: 4 Hearken to Me, My people, And give ear to Me, O My nation, For teaching shall go forth from Me, My way for the light of peoples. In a moment I will bring it:

content: 5 The triumph I grant is near, The success I give has gone forth. My arms shall provide for the peoples; The coastlands shall trust in Me, They shall look to My arm.
content_old: 5 The triumph I grant is near, The success I give has gone forth. My arms shall provide for the peoples; The coastlands shall trust in Me, They shall look to My arm.

content: 6 Raise your eyes to the heavens, And look upon the earth beneath: Though the heavens should melt away like smoke, And the earth wear out like a garment, And its inhabitants die out as well, My victory shall stand forever, My triumph shall remain unbroken.
content_old: 6 Raise your eyes to the heavens, And look upon the earth beneath: Though the heavens should melt away like smoke, And the earth wear out like a garment, And its inhabitants die out as well, My victory shall stand forever, My triumph shall remain unbroken.

content: 7 Listen to Me, you who care for the right, O people who lay My instruction to heart! Fear not the insults of men, And be not dismayed at their jeers;
content_old: 7 Listen to Me, you who care for the right, O people who lay My instruction to heart! Fear not the insults of men, And be not dismayed at their jeers;

content: 8 For the moth shall eat them up like a garment, The worm shall eat them up like wool. But My triumph shall endure forever, My salvation through all the ages.
content_old: 8 For the moth shall eat them up like a garment, The worm shall eat them up like wool. But My triumph shall endure forever, My salvation through all the ages.

content: 9 Awake, awake, clothe yourself with splendor. O arm of the LORD! Awake as in days of old, As in former ages! It was you that hacked Rahab in pieces, That pierced the Dragon.
content_old: 9 Awake, awake, clothe yourself with splendor. O arm of the LORD! Awake as in days of old, As in former ages! It was you that hacked Rahab in pieces, That pierced the Dragon.

content: 10 It was you that dried up the Sea, The waters of the great deep; That made the abysses of the Sea A road the redeemed might walk.
content_old: 10 It was you that dried up the Sea, The waters of the great deep; That made the abysses of the Sea A road the redeemed might walk.

content: 11 So let the ransomed of the LORD return, And come with shouting to Zion, Crowned with joy everlasting. Let them attain joy and gladness, While sorrow and sighing flee.
content_old: 11 So let the ransomed of the LORD return, And come with shouting to Zion, Crowned with joy everlasting. Let them attain joy and gladness, While sorrow and sighing flee.

content: 12 I, I am He who comforts you! What ails you that you fear Man who must die, Mortals who fare like grass?
content_old: 12 I, I am He who comforts you! What ails you that you fear Man who must die, Mortals who fare like grass?

content: 13 You have forgotten the LORD your Maker, Who stretched out the skies and made firm the earth! And you live all day in constant dread Because of the rage of an oppressor Who is aiming to cut you down. Yet of what account is the rage of an oppressor?
content_old: 13 You have forgotten the LORD your Maker, Who stretched out the skies and made firm the earth! And you live all day in constant dread Because of the rage of an oppressor Who is aiming to cut you down. Yet of what account is the rage of an oppressor?

content: 14 Quickly the crouching one is freed; He is not cut down and slain, And he shall not want for food.
content_old: 14 Quickly the crouching one is freed; He is not cut down and slain, And he shall not want for food.

content: 15 For I the LORD your God— Who stir up the sea into roaring waves, Whose name is LORD of Hosts—
content_old: 15 For I the LORD your God— Who stir up the sea into roaring waves, Whose name is LORD of Hosts—

content: 16 Have put My words in your mouth And sheltered you with My hand; I, who planted the skies and made firm the earth, Have said to Zion: You are My people!
content_old: 16 Have put My words in your mouth And sheltered you with My hand; I, who planted the skies and made firm the earth, Have said to Zion: You are My people!

content: 17 Rouse, rouse yourself! Arise, O Jerusalem, You who from the LORD’s hand Have drunk the cup of His wrath, You who have drained to the dregs The bowl, the cup of reeling!
content_old: 17 Rouse, rouse yourself! Arise, O Jerusalem, You who from the LORD’s hand Have drunk the cup of His wrath, You who have drained to the dregs The bowl, the cup of reeling!

content: 18 She has none to guide her Of all the sons she bore; None takes her by the hand, Of all the sons she reared.
content_old: 18 She has none to guide her Of all the sons she bore; None takes her by the hand, Of all the sons she reared.

content: 19 These two things have befallen you: Wrack and ruin—who can console you? Famine and sword—how shall I comfort you?
content_old: 19 These two things have befallen you: Wrack and ruin—who can console you? Famine and sword—how shall I comfort you?

content: 20 Your sons lie in a swoon At the corner of every street— Like an antelope caught in a net— Drunk with the wrath of the LORD, With the rebuke of your God.
content_old: 20 Your sons lie in a swoon At the corner of every street— Like an antelope caught in a net— Drunk with the wrath of the LORD, With the rebuke of your God.

content: 21 Therefore, Listen to this, unhappy one, Who are drunk, but not with wine!
content_old: 21 Therefore, Listen to this, unhappy one, Who are drunk, but not with wine!

content: 22 Thus said the LORD, your Lord, Your God who champions His people: Herewith I take from your hand The cup of reeling, The bowl, the cup of My wrath; You shall never drink it again.
content_old: 22 Thus said the LORD, your Lord, Your God who champions His people: Herewith I take from your hand The cup of reeling, The bowl, the cup of My wrath; You shall never drink it again.

content: 1 Awake, awake, O Zion! Clothe yourself in splendor; Put on your robes of majesty, Jerusalem, holy city! For the uncircumcised and the unclean Shall never enter you again.
content_old: 1 Awake, awake, O Zion! Clothe yourself in splendor; Put on your robes of majesty, Jerusalem, holy city! For the uncircumcised and the unclean Shall never enter you again.

content: 2 Arise, shake off the dust, Sit , Jerusalem! Loose the bonds from your neck, O captive one, Fair Zion!
content_old: 2 Arise, shake off the dust, Sit , Jerusalem! Loose the bonds from your neck, O captive one, Fair Zion!

content: 3 For thus said the LORD: You were sold for no price, And shall be redeemed without money.
content_old: 3 For thus said the LORD: You were sold for no price, And shall be redeemed without money.

content: 4 For thus said the Lord GOD: Of old, My people went down To Egypt to sojourn there; But Assyria has robbed them, Giving nothing in return.
content_old: 4 For thus said the Lord GOD: Of old, My people went down To Egypt to sojourn there; But Assyria has robbed them, Giving nothing in return.

content: 5 What therefore do I gain here? —declares the LORD— For My people has been carried off for nothing, Their mockers howl —declares the LORD— And constantly, unceasingly, My name is reviled.
content_old: 5 What therefore do I gain here? —declares the LORD— For My people has been carried off for nothing, Their mockers howl —declares the LORD— And constantly, unceasingly, My name is reviled.

content: 6 Assuredly, My people shall learn My name, Assuredly on that day That I, the One who promised, Am now at hand.
content_old: 6 Assuredly, My people shall learn My name, Assuredly on that day That I, the One who promised, Am now at hand.

content: 7 How welcome on the mountain Are the footsteps of the herald Announcing happiness, Heralding good fortune, Announcing victory, Telling Zion, “Your God is King!”
content_old: 7 How welcome on the mountain Are the footsteps of the herald Announcing happiness, Heralding good fortune, Announcing victory, Telling Zion, “Your God is King!”

content: 8 Hark! Your watchmen raise their voices, As one they shout for joy; For every eye shall behold The LORD’s return to Zion.
content_old: 8 Hark! Your watchmen raise their voices, As one they shout for joy; For every eye shall behold The LORD’s return to Zion.

content: 9 Raise a shout together, O ruins of Jerusalem! For the LORD will comfort His people, Will redeem Jerusalem.
content_old: 9 Raise a shout together, O ruins of Jerusalem! For the LORD will comfort His people, Will redeem Jerusalem.

content: 10 The LORD will bare His holy arm In the sight of all the nations, And the very ends of earth shall see The victory of our God.
content_old: 10 The LORD will bare His holy arm In the sight of all the nations, And the very ends of earth shall see The victory of our God.

content: 11 Turn, turn away, touch naught unclean As you depart from there; Keep pure, as you go forth from there, You who bear the vessels of the LORD!
content_old: 11 Turn, turn away, touch naught unclean As you depart from there; Keep pure, as you go forth from there, You who bear the vessels of the LORD!

content: 12 For you will not depart in haste, Nor will you leave in flight; For the LORD is marching before you, The God of Israel is your rear guard.
content_old: 12 For you will not depart in haste, Nor will you leave in flight; For the LORD is marching before you, The God of Israel is your rear guard.

content: 13 “Indeed, My servant shall prosper, Be exalted and raised to great heights.
content_old: 13 “Indeed, My servant shall prosper, Be exalted and raised to great heights.

content: 14 Just as the many were appalled at him— So marred was his appearance, unlike that of man, His form, beyond human semblance—
content_old: 14 Just as the many were appalled at him— So marred was his appearance, unlike that of man, His form, beyond human semblance—

content: 1 “Who can believe what we have heard? Upon whom has the arm of the LORD been revealed?
content_old: 1 “Who can believe what we have heard? Upon whom has the arm of the LORD been revealed?

content: 2 For he has grown, by His favor, like a tree crown, Like a tree trunk out of arid ground. He had no form or beauty, that we should look at him: No charm, that we should find him pleasing.
content_old: 2 For he has grown, by His favor, like a tree crown, Like a tree trunk out of arid ground. He had no form or beauty, that we should look at him: No charm, that we should find him pleasing.

content: 3 He was despised, shunned by men, A man of suffering, familiar with disease. As one who hid his face from us, He was despised, we held him of no account.
content_old: 3 He was despised, shunned by men, A man of suffering, familiar with disease. As one who hid his face from us, He was despised, we held him of no account.

content: 4 Yet it was our sickness that he was bearing, Our suffering that he endured. We accounted him plagued, Smitten and afflicted by God;
content_old: 4 Yet it was our sickness that he was bearing, Our suffering that he endured. We accounted him plagued, Smitten and afflicted by God;

content: 5 But he was wounded because of our sins, Crushed because of our iniquities. He bore the chastisement that made us whole, And by his bruises we were healed.
content_old: 5 But he was wounded because of our sins, Crushed because of our iniquities. He bore the chastisement that made us whole, And by his bruises we were healed.

content: 6 We all went astray like sheep, Each going his own way; And the LORD visited upon him The guilt of all of us.”
content_old: 6 We all went astray like sheep, Each going his own way; And the LORD visited upon him The guilt of all of us.”

content: 7 He was maltreated, yet he was submissive, He did not open his mouth; Like a sheep being led to slaughter, Like a ewe, dumb before those who shear her, He did not open his mouth.
content_old: 7 He was maltreated, yet he was submissive, He did not open his mouth; Like a sheep being led to slaughter, Like a ewe, dumb before those who shear her, He did not open his mouth.

content: 8 By oppressive judgment he was taken away, Who could describe his abode? For he was cut off from the land of the living Through the sin of my people, who deserved the punishment.
content_old: 8 By oppressive judgment he was taken away, Who could describe his abode? For he was cut off from the land of the living Through the sin of my people, who deserved the punishment.

content: 9 And his grave was set among the wicked, And with the rich, in his death— Though he had done no injustice And had spoken no falsehood.
content_old: 9 And his grave was set among the wicked, And with the rich, in his death— Though he had done no injustice And had spoken no falsehood.

content: 10 But the LORD chose to crush him by disease, That, if he made himself an offering for guilt, He might see offspring and have long life, And that through him the LORD’s purpose might prosper.
content_old: 10 But the LORD chose to crush him by disease, That, if he made himself an offering for guilt, He might see offspring and have long life, And that through him the LORD’s purpose might prosper.

content: 11 Out of his anguish he shall see it; He shall enjoy it to the full through his devotion. “My righteous servant makes the many righteous, It is their punishment that he bears;
content_old: 11 Out of his anguish he shall see it; He shall enjoy it to the full through his devotion. “My righteous servant makes the many righteous, It is their punishment that he bears;

content: 1 Shout, O barren one, You who bore no child! Shout aloud for joy, You who did not travail! For the children of the wife forlorn Shall outnumber those of the espoused —said the LORD.
content_old: 1 Shout, O barren one, You who bore no child! Shout aloud for joy, You who did not travail! For the children of the wife forlorn Shall outnumber those of the espoused —said the LORD.

content: 2 Enlarge the site of your tent, Extend the size of your dwelling, Do not stint! Lengthen the ropes, and drive the pegs firm.
content_old: 2 Enlarge the site of your tent, Extend the size of your dwelling, Do not stint! Lengthen the ropes, and drive the pegs firm.

content: 3 For you shall spread out to the right and the left; Your offspring shall dispossess nations And shall people the desolate towns.
content_old: 3 For you shall spread out to the right and the left; Your offspring shall dispossess nations And shall people the desolate towns.

content: 4 Fear not, you shall not be shamed; Do not cringe, you shall not be disgraced. For you shall forget The reproach of your youth, And remember no more The shame of your widowhood.
content_old: 4 Fear not, you shall not be shamed; Do not cringe, you shall not be disgraced. For you shall forget The reproach of your youth, And remember no more The shame of your widowhood.

content: 5 For He who made you will espouse you— His name is “LORD of Hosts.” The Holy One of Israel will redeem you— He is called “God of all the Earth.”
content_old: 5 For He who made you will espouse you— His name is “LORD of Hosts.” The Holy One of Israel will redeem you— He is called “God of all the Earth.”

content: 6 The LORD has called you back As a wife forlorn and forsaken. Can one cast off the wife of his youth? —said your God.
content_old: 6 The LORD has called you back As a wife forlorn and forsaken. Can one cast off the wife of his youth? —said your God.

content: 7 For a little while I forsook you, But with vast love I will bring you back.
content_old: 7 For a little while I forsook you, But with vast love I will bring you back.

content: 8 In slight anger, for a moment, I hid My face from you; But with kindness everlasting I will take you back in love —said the LORD your Redeemer.
content_old: 8 In slight anger, for a moment, I hid My face from you; But with kindness everlasting I will take you back in love —said the LORD your Redeemer.

content: 9 For this to Me is like the waters of Noah: As I swore that the waters of Noah Nevermore would flood the earth, So I swear that I will not Be angry with you or rebuke you.
content_old: 9 For this to Me is like the waters of Noah: As I swore that the waters of Noah Nevermore would flood the earth, So I swear that I will not Be angry with you or rebuke you.

content: 10 For the mountains may move And the hills be shaken, But my loyalty shall never move from you, Nor My covenant of friendship be shaken —said the LORD, who takes you back in love.
content_old: 10 For the mountains may move And the hills be shaken, But my loyalty shall never move from you, Nor My covenant of friendship be shaken —said the LORD, who takes you back in love.

content: 11 Unhappy, storm-tossed one, uncomforted! I will lay carbuncles as your building stones And make your foundations of sapphires.
content_old: 11 Unhappy, storm-tossed one, uncomforted! I will lay carbuncles as your building stones And make your foundations of sapphires.

content: 12 I will make your battlements of rubies, Your gates of precious stones, The whole encircling wall of gems.
content_old: 12 I will make your battlements of rubies, Your gates of precious stones, The whole encircling wall of gems.

content: 13 And all your children shall be disciples of the LORD, And great shall be the happiness of your children;
content_old: 13 And all your children shall be disciples of the LORD, And great shall be the happiness of your children;

content: 14 You shall be established through righteousness. You shall be safe from oppression, And shall have no fear; From ruin, and it shall not come near you.
content_old: 14 You shall be established through righteousness. You shall be safe from oppression, And shall have no fear; From ruin, and it shall not come near you.

content: 15 Surely no harm can be done Without My consent: Whoever would harm you Shall fall because of you.
content_old: 15 Surely no harm can be done Without My consent: Whoever would harm you Shall fall because of you.

content: 16 It is I who created the smith To fan the charcoal fire And produce the tools for his work; So it is I who create The instruments of havoc.
content_old: 16 It is I who created the smith To fan the charcoal fire And produce the tools for his work; So it is I who create The instruments of havoc.

content: 1 Ho, all who are thirsty, Come for water, Even if you have no money; Come, buy food and eat: Buy food without money, Wine and milk without cost.
content_old: 1 Ho, all who are thirsty, Come for water, Even if you have no money; Come, buy food and eat: Buy food without money, Wine and milk without cost.

content: 2 Why do you spend money for what is not bread, Your earnings for what does not satisfy? Give heed to Me, And you shall eat choice food And enjoy the richest viands.
content_old: 2 Why do you spend money for what is not bread, Your earnings for what does not satisfy? Give heed to Me, And you shall eat choice food And enjoy the richest viands.

content: 3 Incline your ear and come to Me; Hearken, and you shall be revived. And I will make with you an everlasting covenant, The enduring loyalty promised to David.
content_old: 3 Incline your ear and come to Me; Hearken, and you shall be revived. And I will make with you an everlasting covenant, The enduring loyalty promised to David.

content: 4 As I made him a leader of peoples, A prince and commander of peoples,
content_old: 4 As I made him a leader of peoples, A prince and commander of peoples,

content: 5 So you shall summon a nation you did not know, And a nation that did not know you Shall come running to you— For the sake of the LORD your God, The Holy One of Israel who has glorified you.
content_old: 5 So you shall summon a nation you did not know, And a nation that did not know you Shall come running to you— For the sake of the LORD your God, The Holy One of Israel who has glorified you.

content: 6 Seek the LORD while He can be found, Call to Him while He is near.
content_old: 6 Seek the LORD while He can be found, Call to Him while He is near.

content: 7 Let the wicked give up his ways, The sinful man his plans; Let him turn back to the LORD, And He will pardon him; To our God, For he freely forgives.
content_old: 7 Let the wicked give up his ways, The sinful man his plans; Let him turn back to the LORD, And He will pardon him; To our God, For he freely forgives.

content: 8 For My plans are not your plans, Nor are My ways your ways —declares the LORD.
content_old: 8 For My plans are not your plans, Nor are My ways your ways —declares the LORD.

content: 9 But as the heavens are high above the earth, So are My ways high above your ways And My plans above your plans.
content_old: 9 But as the heavens are high above the earth, So are My ways high above your ways And My plans above your plans.

content: 10 For as the rain or snow drops from heaven And returns not there, But soaks the earth And makes it bring forth vegetation, Yielding seed for sowing and bread for eating,
content_old: 10 For as the rain or snow drops from heaven And returns not there, But soaks the earth And makes it bring forth vegetation, Yielding seed for sowing and bread for eating,

content: 11 So is the word that issues from My mouth: It does not come back to Me unfulfilled, But performs what I purpose, Achieves what I sent it to do.
content_old: 11 So is the word that issues from My mouth: It does not come back to Me unfulfilled, But performs what I purpose, Achieves what I sent it to do.

content: 12 Yea, you shall leave in joy and be led home secure. Before you, mount and hill shall shout aloud, And all the trees of the field shall clap their hands.
content_old: 12 Yea, you shall leave in joy and be led home secure. Before you, mount and hill shall shout aloud, And all the trees of the field shall clap their hands.

content: 1 Thus said the LORD: Observe what is right and do what is just; For soon My salvation shall come, And my deliverance be revealed.
content_old: 1 Thus said the LORD: Observe what is right and do what is just; For soon My salvation shall come, And my deliverance be revealed.

content: 2 Happy is the man who does this, The man who holds fast to it: Who keeps the sabbath and does not profane it, And stays his hand from doing any evil.
content_old: 2 Happy is the man who does this, The man who holds fast to it: Who keeps the sabbath and does not profane it, And stays his hand from doing any evil.

content: 3 Let not the foreigner say, Who has attached himself to the LORD, “The LORD will keep me apart from His people”; And let not the eunuch say, “I am a withered tree.”
content_old: 3 Let not the foreigner say, Who has attached himself to the LORD, “The LORD will keep me apart from His people”; And let not the eunuch say, “I am a withered tree.”

content: 4 For thus said the LORD: “As for the eunuchs who keep My sabbaths, Who have chosen what I desire And hold fast to My covenant—
content_old: 4 For thus said the LORD: “As for the eunuchs who keep My sabbaths, Who have chosen what I desire And hold fast to My covenant—

content: 5 I will give them, in My House And within My walls, A monument and a name Better than sons or daughters. I will give them an everlasting name Which shall not perish.
content_old: 5 I will give them, in My House And within My walls, A monument and a name Better than sons or daughters. I will give them an everlasting name Which shall not perish.

content: 6 As for the foreigners Who attach themselves to the LORD, To minister to Him, And to love the name of the LORD, To be His servants— All who keep the sabbath and do not profane it, And who hold fast to My covenant—
content_old: 6 As for the foreigners Who attach themselves to the LORD, To minister to Him, And to love the name of the LORD, To be His servants— All who keep the sabbath and do not profane it, And who hold fast to My covenant—

content: 7 I will bring them to My sacred mount And let them rejoice in My house of prayer. Their burnt offerings and sacrifices Shall be welcome on My altar; For My House shall be called A house of prayer for all peoples.”
content_old: 7 I will bring them to My sacred mount And let them rejoice in My house of prayer. Their burnt offerings and sacrifices Shall be welcome on My altar; For My House shall be called A house of prayer for all peoples.”

content: 8 Thus declares the Lord GOD, Who gathers the dispersed of Israel: “I will gather still more to those already gathered.”
content_old: 8 Thus declares the Lord GOD, Who gathers the dispersed of Israel: “I will gather still more to those already gathered.”

content: 9 All you wild beasts, come and devour, All you beasts of the forest!
content_old: 9 All you wild beasts, come and devour, All you beasts of the forest!

content: 10 The watchmen are blind, all of them, They perceive nothing. They are all dumb dogs That cannot bark; They lie sprawling, They love to drowse.
content_old: 10 The watchmen are blind, all of them, They perceive nothing. They are all dumb dogs That cannot bark; They lie sprawling, They love to drowse.

content: 11 Moreover, the dogs are greedy; They never know satiety. As for the shepherds, they know not What it is to give heed. Everyone has turned his own way, Every last one seeks his own advantage.
content_old: 11 Moreover, the dogs are greedy; They never know satiety. As for the shepherds, they know not What it is to give heed. Everyone has turned his own way, Every last one seeks his own advantage.

content: 1 The righteous man perishes, And no one considers; Pious men are taken away, And no one gives thought That because of evil The righteous was taken away.
content_old: 1 The righteous man perishes, And no one considers; Pious men are taken away, And no one gives thought That because of evil The righteous was taken away.

content: 2 Yet he shall come to peace, He shall have rest on his couch Who walked straightforward.
content_old: 2 Yet he shall come to peace, He shall have rest on his couch Who walked straightforward.

content: 3 But as for you, come closer, You sons of a sorceress, You offspring of an adulterer and a harlot!
content_old: 3 But as for you, come closer, You sons of a sorceress, You offspring of an adulterer and a harlot!

content: 4 With whom do you act so familiarly? At whom do you open your mouth And stick out your tongue? Why, you are children of iniquity, Offspring of treachery—
content_old: 4 With whom do you act so familiarly? At whom do you open your mouth And stick out your tongue? Why, you are children of iniquity, Offspring of treachery—

content: 5 You who inflame yourselves Among the terebinths, Under every verdant tree; Who slaughter children in the wadis, Among the clefts of the rocks.
content_old: 5 You who inflame yourselves Among the terebinths, Under every verdant tree; Who slaughter children in the wadis, Among the clefts of the rocks.

content: 6 With such are your share and portion, They, they are your allotment; To them you have poured out libations, Presented offerings. Should I relent in the face of this?
content_old: 6 With such are your share and portion, They, they are your allotment; To them you have poured out libations, Presented offerings. Should I relent in the face of this?

content: 7 On a high and lofty hill You have set your couch; There, too, you have gone up To perform sacrifices.
content_old: 7 On a high and lofty hill You have set your couch; There, too, you have gone up To perform sacrifices.

content: 8 Behind the door and doorpost You have directed your thoughts; Abandoning Me, you have gone up On the couch you made so wide. You have made a covenant with them, You have loved bedding with them; You have chosen lust.
content_old: 8 Behind the door and doorpost You have directed your thoughts; Abandoning Me, you have gone up On the couch you made so wide. You have made a covenant with them, You have loved bedding with them; You have chosen lust.

content: 9 You have approached the king with oil, You have provided many perfumes. And you have sent your envoys afar, Even down to the netherworld.
content_old: 9 You have approached the king with oil, You have provided many perfumes. And you have sent your envoys afar, Even down to the netherworld.

content: 10 Though wearied by much travel, You never said, “I give up!” You found gratification for your lust, And so you never cared.
content_old: 10 Though wearied by much travel, You never said, “I give up!” You found gratification for your lust, And so you never cared.

content: 11 Whom do you dread and fear, That you tell lies? But you gave no thought to Me, You paid no heed. It is because I have stood idly by so long That you have no fear of Me.
content_old: 11 Whom do you dread and fear, That you tell lies? But you gave no thought to Me, You paid no heed. It is because I have stood idly by so long That you have no fear of Me.

content: 12 I hereby pronounce judgment upon your deeds: Your assorted idols shall not avail you,
content_old: 12 I hereby pronounce judgment upon your deeds: Your assorted idols shall not avail you,

content: 13 Shall not save you when you cry out. They shall all be borne off by the wind, Snatched away by a breeze. But those who trust in Me shall inherit the land And possess My sacred mount.
content_old: 13 Shall not save you when you cry out. They shall all be borne off by the wind, Snatched away by a breeze. But those who trust in Me shall inherit the land And possess My sacred mount.

content: 14 The Lord says: Build up, build up a highway! Clear a road! Remove all obstacles From the road of My people!
content_old: 14 The Lord says: Build up, build up a highway! Clear a road! Remove all obstacles From the road of My people!

content: 15 For thus said He who high aloft Forever dwells, whose name is holy: I dwell on high, in holiness; Yet with the contrite and the lowly in spirit— Reviving the spirits of the lowly, Reviving the hearts of the contrite.
content_old: 15 For thus said He who high aloft Forever dwells, whose name is holy: I dwell on high, in holiness; Yet with the contrite and the lowly in spirit— Reviving the spirits of the lowly, Reviving the hearts of the contrite.

content: 16 For I will not always contend, I will not be angry forever: Nay, I who make spirits flag, Also create the breath of life.
content_old: 16 For I will not always contend, I will not be angry forever: Nay, I who make spirits flag, Also create the breath of life.

content: 17 For their sinful greed I was angry; I struck them and turned away in My wrath. Though stubborn, they follow the way of their hearts,
content_old: 17 For their sinful greed I was angry; I struck them and turned away in My wrath. Though stubborn, they follow the way of their hearts,

content: 18 I note how they fare and will heal them: I will guide them and mete out solace to them, And to the mourners among them
content_old: 18 I note how they fare and will heal them: I will guide them and mete out solace to them, And to the mourners among them

content: 19 heartening, comforting words: It shall be well, Well with the far and the near —said the LORD— And I will heal them.
content_old: 19 heartening, comforting words: It shall be well, Well with the far and the near —said the LORD— And I will heal them.

content: 20 But the wicked are like the troubled sea Which cannot rest, Whose waters toss up mire and mud.
content_old: 20 But the wicked are like the troubled sea Which cannot rest, Whose waters toss up mire and mud.

content: 1 Cry with full throat, without restraint; Raise your voice like a ram’s horn! Declare to My people their transgression, To the House of Jacob their sin.
content_old: 1 Cry with full throat, without restraint; Raise your voice like a ram’s horn! Declare to My people their transgression, To the House of Jacob their sin.

content: 2 To be sure, they seek Me daily, Eager to learn My ways. Like a nation that does what is right, That has not abandoned the laws of its God, They ask Me for the right way, They are eager for the nearness of God:
content_old: 2 To be sure, they seek Me daily, Eager to learn My ways. Like a nation that does what is right, That has not abandoned the laws of its God, They ask Me for the right way, They are eager for the nearness of God:

content: 3 “Why, when we fasted, did You not see? When we starved our bodies, did You pay no heed?” Because on your fast day You see to your business And oppress all your laborers!
content_old: 3 “Why, when we fasted, did You not see? When we starved our bodies, did You pay no heed?” Because on your fast day You see to your business And oppress all your laborers!

content: 4 Because you fast in strife and contention, And you strike with a wicked fist! Your fasting today is not such As to make your voice heard on high.
content_old: 4 Because you fast in strife and contention, And you strike with a wicked fist! Your fasting today is not such As to make your voice heard on high.

content: 5 Is such the fast I desire, A day for men to starve their bodies? Is it bowing the head like a bulrush And lying in sackcloth and ashes? Do you call that a fast, A day when the LORD is favorable?
content_old: 5 Is such the fast I desire, A day for men to starve their bodies? Is it bowing the head like a bulrush And lying in sackcloth and ashes? Do you call that a fast, A day when the LORD is favorable?

content: 6 No, this is the fast I desire: To unlock fetters of wickedness, And untie the cords of the yoke To let the oppressed go free; To break off every yoke.
content_old: 6 No, this is the fast I desire: To unlock fetters of wickedness, And untie the cords of the yoke To let the oppressed go free; To break off every yoke.

content: 7 It is to share your bread with the hungry, And to take the wretched poor into your home; When you see the naked, to clothe him, And not to ignore your own kin.
content_old: 7 It is to share your bread with the hungry, And to take the wretched poor into your home; When you see the naked, to clothe him, And not to ignore your own kin.

content: 8 Then shall your light burst through like the dawn And your healing spring up quickly; Your Vindicator shall march before you, The Presence of the LORD shall be your rear guard.
content_old: 8 Then shall your light burst through like the dawn And your healing spring up quickly; Your Vindicator shall march before you, The Presence of the LORD shall be your rear guard.

content: 9 Then, when you call, the LORD will answer; When you cry, He will say: Here I am. If you banish the yoke from your midst, The menacing hand, and evil speech,
content_old: 9 Then, when you call, the LORD will answer; When you cry, He will say: Here I am. If you banish the yoke from your midst, The menacing hand, and evil speech,

content: 10 And you offer your compassion to the hungry And satisfy the famished creature— Then shall your light shine in darkness, And your gloom shall be like noonday.
content_old: 10 And you offer your compassion to the hungry And satisfy the famished creature— Then shall your light shine in darkness, And your gloom shall be like noonday.

content: 11 The LORD will guide you always; He will slake your thirst in parched places And give strength to your bones. You shall be like a watered garden, Like a spring whose waters do not fail.
content_old: 11 The LORD will guide you always; He will slake your thirst in parched places And give strength to your bones. You shall be like a watered garden, Like a spring whose waters do not fail.

content: 12 Men from your midst shall rebuild ancient ruins, You shall restore foundations laid long ago. And you shall be called “Repairer of fallen walls, Restorer of lanes for habitation.”
content_old: 12 Men from your midst shall rebuild ancient ruins, You shall restore foundations laid long ago. And you shall be called “Repairer of fallen walls, Restorer of lanes for habitation.”
