content: 13 If you refrain from trampling the sabbath, From pursuing your affairs on My holy day; If you call the sabbath “delight,” The LORD’s holy day “honored”; And if you honor it and go not your ways Nor look to your affairs, nor strike bargains—
content_old: 13 If you refrain from trampling the sabbath, From pursuing your affairs on My holy day; If you call the sabbath “delight,” The LORD’s holy day “honored”; And if you honor it and go not your ways Nor look to your affairs, nor strike bargains—

content: 1 No, the LORD’s arm is not too short to save, Or His ear too dull to hear;
content_old: 1 No, the LORD’s arm is not too short to save, Or His ear too dull to hear;

content: 2 But your iniquities have been a barrier Between you and your God, Your sins have made Him turn His face away And refuse to hear you.
content_old: 2 But your iniquities have been a barrier Between you and your God, Your sins have made Him turn His face away And refuse to hear you.

content: 3 For your hands are defiled with crime And your fingers with iniquity. Your lips speak falsehood, Your tongue utters treachery.
content_old: 3 For your hands are defiled with crime And your fingers with iniquity. Your lips speak falsehood, Your tongue utters treachery.

content: 4 No one sues justly Or pleads honestly; They rely on emptiness and speak falsehood, Conceiving wrong and begetting evil.
content_old: 4 No one sues justly Or pleads honestly; They rely on emptiness and speak falsehood, Conceiving wrong and begetting evil.

content: 5 They hatch adder’s eggs And weave spider webs; He who eats of those eggs will die, And if one is crushed, it hatches out a viper.
content_old: 5 They hatch adder’s eggs And weave spider webs; He who eats of those eggs will die, And if one is crushed, it hatches out a viper.

content: 6 Their webs will not serve as a garment, What they make cannot serve as clothing; Their deeds are deeds of mischief, Their hands commit lawless acts,
content_old: 6 Their webs will not serve as a garment, What they make cannot serve as clothing; Their deeds are deeds of mischief, Their hands commit lawless acts,

content: 7 Their feet run after evil, They hasten to shed the blood of the innocent. Their plans are plans of mischief, Destructiveness and injury are on their roads.
content_old: 7 Their feet run after evil, They hasten to shed the blood of the innocent. Their plans are plans of mischief, Destructiveness and injury are on their roads.

content: 8 They do not care for the way of integrity, There is no justice on their paths. They make their courses crooked, No one who walks in them cares for integrity.
content_old: 8 They do not care for the way of integrity, There is no justice on their paths. They make their courses crooked, No one who walks in them cares for integrity.

content: 9 “That is why redress is far from us, And vindication does not reach us. We hope for light, and lo! there is darkness; For a gleam, and we must walk in gloom.
content_old: 9 “That is why redress is far from us, And vindication does not reach us. We hope for light, and lo! there is darkness; For a gleam, and we must walk in gloom.

content: 10 We grope, like blind men along a wall; Like those without eyes we grope. We stumble at noon, as if in darkness; Among the sturdy, we are like the dead.
content_old: 10 We grope, like blind men along a wall; Like those without eyes we grope. We stumble at noon, as if in darkness; Among the sturdy, we are like the dead.

content: 11 We all growl like bears And moan like doves. We hope for redress, and there is none; For victory, and it is far from us.
content_old: 11 We all growl like bears And moan like doves. We hope for redress, and there is none; For victory, and it is far from us.

content: 12 For our many sins are before You, Our guilt testifies against us. We are aware of our sins, And we know well our iniquities:
content_old: 12 For our many sins are before You, Our guilt testifies against us. We are aware of our sins, And we know well our iniquities:

content: 13 Rebellion, faithlessness to the LORD, And turning away from our God, Planning fraud and treachery, Conceiving lies and uttering them with the throat.
content_old: 13 Rebellion, faithlessness to the LORD, And turning away from our God, Planning fraud and treachery, Conceiving lies and uttering them with the throat.

content: 14 And so redress is turned back And vindication stays afar, Because honesty stumbles in the public square And uprightness cannot enter.
content_old: 14 And so redress is turned back And vindication stays afar, Because honesty stumbles in the public square And uprightness cannot enter.

content: 15 Honesty has been lacking, He who turns away from evil is despoiled.” The LORD saw and was displeased That there was no redress.
content_old: 15 Honesty has been lacking, He who turns away from evil is despoiled.” The LORD saw and was displeased That there was no redress.

content: 16 He saw that there was no man, He gazed long, but no one intervened. Then His own arm won Him triumph, His victorious right hand supported Him.
content_old: 16 He saw that there was no man, He gazed long, but no one intervened. Then His own arm won Him triumph, His victorious right hand supported Him.

content: 17 He donned victory like a coat of mail, With a helmet of triumph on His head; He clothed Himself with garments of retribution, Wrapped himself in zeal as in a robe.
content_old: 17 He donned victory like a coat of mail, With a helmet of triumph on His head; He clothed Himself with garments of retribution, Wrapped himself in zeal as in a robe.

content: 18 According to their deserts, So shall He repay fury to His foes; He shall make requital to His enemies, Requital to the distant lands.
content_old: 18 According to their deserts, So shall He repay fury to His foes; He shall make requital to His enemies, Requital to the distant lands.

content: 19 From the west, they shall revere the name of the LORD, And from the east, His Presence. For He shall come like a hemmed-in stream Which the wind of the LORD drives on;
content_old: 19 From the west, they shall revere the name of the LORD, And from the east, His Presence. For He shall come like a hemmed-in stream Which the wind of the LORD drives on;

content: 20 He shall come as redeemer to Zion, To those in Jacob who turn back from sin —declares the LORD.
content_old: 20 He shall come as redeemer to Zion, To those in Jacob who turn back from sin —declares the LORD.

content: 1 Arise, shine, for your light has dawned; The Presence of the LORD has shone upon you!
content_old: 1 Arise, shine, for your light has dawned; The Presence of the LORD has shone upon you!

content: 2 Behold! Darkness shall cover the earth, And thick clouds the peoples; But upon you the LORD will shine, And His Presence be seen over you.
content_old: 2 Behold! Darkness shall cover the earth, And thick clouds the peoples; But upon you the LORD will shine, And His Presence be seen over you.

content: 3 And nations shall walk by your light, Kings, by your shining radiance.
content_old: 3 And nations shall walk by your light, Kings, by your shining radiance.

content: 4 Raise your eyes and look about: They have all gathered and come to you. Your sons shall be brought from afar, Your daughters like babes on shoulders.
content_old: 4 Raise your eyes and look about: They have all gathered and come to you. Your sons shall be brought from afar, Your daughters like babes on shoulders.

content: 5 As you behold, you will glow; Your heart will throb and thrill— For the wealth of the sea shall pass on to you, The riches of nations shall flow to you.
content_old: 5 As you behold, you will glow; Your heart will throb and thrill— For the wealth of the sea shall pass on to you, The riches of nations shall flow to you.

content: 6 Dust clouds of camels shall cover you, Dromedaries of Midian and Ephah. They all shall come from Sheba; They shall bear gold and frankincense, And shall herald the glories of the LORD.
content_old: 6 Dust clouds of camels shall cover you, Dromedaries of Midian and Ephah. They all shall come from Sheba; They shall bear gold and frankincense, And shall herald the glories of the LORD.

content: 7 All the flocks of Kedar shall be assembled for you, The rams of Nebaioth shall serve your needs; They shall be welcome offerings on My altar, And I will add glory to My glorious House.
content_old: 7 All the flocks of Kedar shall be assembled for you, The rams of Nebaioth shall serve your needs; They shall be welcome offerings on My altar, And I will add glory to My glorious House.

content: 8 Who are these that float like a cloud, Like doves to their cotes?
content_old: 8 Who are these that float like a cloud, Like doves to their cotes?

content: 9 Behold, the coastlands await me, With ships of Tarshish in the lead, To bring your sons from afar, And their silver and gold as well— For the name of the LORD your God, For the Holy One of Israel, who has glorified you.
content_old: 9 Behold, the coastlands await me, With ships of Tarshish in the lead, To bring your sons from afar, And their silver and gold as well— For the name of the LORD your God, For the Holy One of Israel, who has glorified you.

content: 10 Aliens shall rebuild your walls, Their kings shall wait upon you— For in anger I struck you down, But in favor I take you back.
content_old: 10 Aliens shall rebuild your walls, Their kings shall wait upon you— For in anger I struck you down, But in favor I take you back.

content: 11 Your gates shall always stay open— Day and night they shall never be shut— To let in the wealth of the nations, With their kings in procession.
content_old: 11 Your gates shall always stay open— Day and night they shall never be shut— To let in the wealth of the nations, With their kings in procession.

content: 12 For the nation or the kingdom That does not serve you shall perish; Such nations shall be destroyed.
content_old: 12 For the nation or the kingdom That does not serve you shall perish; Such nations shall be destroyed.

content: 13 The majesty of Lebanon shall come to you— Cypress and pine and box— To adorn the site of My Sanctuary, To glorify the place where My feet rest.
content_old: 13 The majesty of Lebanon shall come to you— Cypress and pine and box— To adorn the site of My Sanctuary, To glorify the place where My feet rest.

content: 14 Bowing before you, shall come The children of those who tormented you; Prostrate at the soles of your feet Shall be all those who reviled you; And you shall be called “City of the LORD, Zion of the Holy One of Israel.”
content_old: 14 Bowing before you, shall come The children of those who tormented you; Prostrate at the soles of your feet Shall be all those who reviled you; And you shall be called “City of the LORD, Zion of the Holy One of Israel.”

content: 15 Whereas you have been forsaken, Rejected, with none passing through, I will make you a pride everlasting, A joy for age after age.
content_old: 15 Whereas you have been forsaken, Rejected, with none passing through, I will make you a pride everlasting, A joy for age after age.

content: 16 You shall suck the milk of the nations, Suckle at royal breasts. And you shall know That I the LORD am your Savior, I, The Mighty One of Jacob, am your Redeemer.
content_old: 16 You shall suck the milk of the nations, Suckle at royal breasts. And you shall know That I the LORD am your Savior, I, The Mighty One of Jacob, am your Redeemer.

content: 17 Instead of copper I will bring gold, Instead of iron I will bring silver; Instead of wood, copper; And instead of stone, iron. And I will appoint Well-being as your government, Prosperity as your officials.
content_old: 17 Instead of copper I will bring gold, Instead of iron I will bring silver; Instead of wood, copper; And instead of stone, iron. And I will appoint Well-being as your government, Prosperity as your officials.

content: 18 The cry “Violence!” Shall no more be heard in your land, Nor “Wrack and ruin!” Within your borders. And you shall name your walls “Victory” And your gates “Renown.”
content_old: 18 The cry “Violence!” Shall no more be heard in your land, Nor “Wrack and ruin!” Within your borders. And you shall name your walls “Victory” And your gates “Renown.”

content: 19 No longer shall you need the sun For light by day, Nor the shining of the moon For radiance by night; For the LORD shall be your light everlasting, Your God shall be your glory.
content_old: 19 No longer shall you need the sun For light by day, Nor the shining of the moon For radiance by night; For the LORD shall be your light everlasting, Your God shall be your glory.

content: 20 Your sun shall set no more, Your moon no more withdraw; For the LORD shall be a light to you forever, And your days of mourning shall be ended.
content_old: 20 Your sun shall set no more, Your moon no more withdraw; For the LORD shall be a light to you forever, And your days of mourning shall be ended.

content: 21 And your people, all of them righteous, Shall possess the land for all time; They are the shoot that I planted, My handiwork in which I glory.
content_old: 21 And your people, all of them righteous, Shall possess the land for all time; They are the shoot that I planted, My handiwork in which I glory.

content: 1 The spirit of the Lord GOD is upon me, Because the LORD has anointed me; He has sent me as a herald of joy to the humble, To bind up the wounded of heart, To proclaim release to the captives, Liberation to the imprisoned;
content_old: 1 The spirit of the Lord GOD is upon me, Because the LORD has anointed me; He has sent me as a herald of joy to the humble, To bind up the wounded of heart, To proclaim release to the captives, Liberation to the imprisoned;

content: 2 To proclaim a year of the LORD’s favor And a day of vindication by our God; To comfort all who mourn—
content_old: 2 To proclaim a year of the LORD’s favor And a day of vindication by our God; To comfort all who mourn—

content: 3 To provide for the mourners in Zion— To give them a turban instead of ashes, The festive ointment instead of mourning, A garment of splendor instead of a drooping spirit. They shall be called terebinths of victory, Planted by the LORD for His glory.
content_old: 3 To provide for the mourners in Zion— To give them a turban instead of ashes, The festive ointment instead of mourning, A garment of splendor instead of a drooping spirit. They shall be called terebinths of victory, Planted by the LORD for His glory.

content: 4 And they shall build the ancient ruins, Raise up the desolations of old, And renew the ruined cities, The desolations of many ages.
content_old: 4 And they shall build the ancient ruins, Raise up the desolations of old, And renew the ruined cities, The desolations of many ages.

content: 5 Strangers shall stand and pasture your flocks, Aliens shall be your plowmen and vine-trimmers;
content_old: 5 Strangers shall stand and pasture your flocks, Aliens shall be your plowmen and vine-trimmers;

content: 6 While you shall be called “Priests of the LORD,” And termed “Servants of our God.” You shall enjoy the wealth of nations And revel in their riches.
content_old: 6 While you shall be called “Priests of the LORD,” And termed “Servants of our God.” You shall enjoy the wealth of nations And revel in their riches.

content: 7 Because your shame was double— Men cried, “Disgrace is their portion”— Assuredly, They shall have a double share in their land, Joy shall be theirs for all time.
content_old: 7 Because your shame was double— Men cried, “Disgrace is their portion”— Assuredly, They shall have a double share in their land, Joy shall be theirs for all time.

content: 8 For I the LORD love justice, I hate robbery with a burnt offering. I will pay them their wages faithfully, And make a covenant with them for all time.
content_old: 8 For I the LORD love justice, I hate robbery with a burnt offering. I will pay them their wages faithfully, And make a covenant with them for all time.

content: 9 Their offspring shall be known among the nations, Their descendants in the midst of the peoples. All who see them shall recognize That they are a stock the LORD has blessed.
content_old: 9 Their offspring shall be known among the nations, Their descendants in the midst of the peoples. All who see them shall recognize That they are a stock the LORD has blessed.

content: 10 I greatly rejoice in the LORD, My whole being exults in my God. For He has clothed me with garments of triumph, Wrapped me in a robe of victory, Like a bridegroom adorned with a turban, Like a bride bedecked with her finery.
content_old: 10 I greatly rejoice in the LORD, My whole being exults in my God. For He has clothed me with garments of triumph, Wrapped me in a robe of victory, Like a bridegroom adorned with a turban, Like a bride bedecked with her finery.

content: 1 For the sake of Zion I will not be silent, For the sake of Jerusalem I will not be still, Till her victory emerge resplendent And her triumph like a flaming torch.
content_old: 1 For the sake of Zion I will not be silent, For the sake of Jerusalem I will not be still, Till her victory emerge resplendent And her triumph like a flaming torch.

content: 2 Nations shall see your victory, And every king your majesty; And you shall be called by a new name Which the LORD Himself shall bestow.
content_old: 2 Nations shall see your victory, And every king your majesty; And you shall be called by a new name Which the LORD Himself shall bestow.

content: 3 You shall be a glorious crown In the hand of the LORD, And a royal diadem In the palm of your God.
content_old: 3 You shall be a glorious crown In the hand of the LORD, And a royal diadem In the palm of your God.

content: 4 Nevermore shall you be called “Forsaken,” Nor shall your land be called “Desolate”; But you shall be called “I delight in her,” And your land “Espoused.” For the LORD takes delight in you, And your land shall be espoused.
content_old: 4 Nevermore shall you be called “Forsaken,” Nor shall your land be called “Desolate”; But you shall be called “I delight in her,” And your land “Espoused.” For the LORD takes delight in you, And your land shall be espoused.

content: 5 As a youth espouses a maiden, Your sons shall espouse you; And as a bridegroom rejoices over his bride, So will your God rejoice over you.
content_old: 5 As a youth espouses a maiden, Your sons shall espouse you; And as a bridegroom rejoices over his bride, So will your God rejoice over you.

content: 6 Upon your walls, O Jerusalem, I have set watchmen, Who shall never be silent By day or by night. O you, the LORD’s remembrancers, Take no rest
content_old: 6 Upon your walls, O Jerusalem, I have set watchmen, Who shall never be silent By day or by night. O you, the LORD’s remembrancers, Take no rest

content: 7 And give no rest to Him, Until He establish Jerusalem And make her renowned on earth.
content_old: 7 And give no rest to Him, Until He establish Jerusalem And make her renowned on earth.

content: 8 The LORD has sworn by His right hand, By His mighty arm: Nevermore will I give your new grain To your enemies for food, Nor shall foreigners drink the new wine For which you have labored.
content_old: 8 The LORD has sworn by His right hand, By His mighty arm: Nevermore will I give your new grain To your enemies for food, Nor shall foreigners drink the new wine For which you have labored.

content: 9 But those who harvest it shall eat it And give praise to the LORD; And those who gather it shall drink it In My sacred courts.
content_old: 9 But those who harvest it shall eat it And give praise to the LORD; And those who gather it shall drink it In My sacred courts.

content: 10 Pass through, pass through the gates! Clear the road for the people; Build up, build up the highway, Remove the rocks! Raise an ensign over the peoples!
content_old: 10 Pass through, pass through the gates! Clear the road for the people; Build up, build up the highway, Remove the rocks! Raise an ensign over the peoples!

content: 11 See, the LORD has proclaimed To the end of the earth: Announce to Fair Zion, Your Deliverer is coming! See, his reward is with Him, His recompense before Him.
content_old: 11 See, the LORD has proclaimed To the end of the earth: Announce to Fair Zion, Your Deliverer is coming! See, his reward is with Him, His recompense before Him.

content: 1 Who is this coming from Edom, In crimsoned garments from Bozrah— Who is this, majestic in attire, Pressing forward in His great might? “It is I, who contend victoriously, Powerful to give triumph.”
content_old: 1 Who is this coming from Edom, In crimsoned garments from Bozrah— Who is this, majestic in attire, Pressing forward in His great might? “It is I, who contend victoriously, Powerful to give triumph.”

content: 2 Why is your clothing so red, Your garments like his who treads grapes?
content_old: 2 Why is your clothing so red, Your garments like his who treads grapes?

content: 3 “I trod out a vintage alone; Of the peoples no man was with Me. I trod them down in My anger, Trampled them in My rage; Their life-blood bespattered My garments, And all My clothing was stained.
content_old: 3 “I trod out a vintage alone; Of the peoples no man was with Me. I trod them down in My anger, Trampled them in My rage; Their life-blood bespattered My garments, And all My clothing was stained.

content: 4 For I had planned a day of vengeance, And My year of redemption arrived.
content_old: 4 For I had planned a day of vengeance, And My year of redemption arrived.

content: 5 Then I looked, but there was none to help; I stared, but there was none to aid— So My own arm wrought the triumph, And My own rage was My aid.
content_old: 5 Then I looked, but there was none to help; I stared, but there was none to aid— So My own arm wrought the triumph, And My own rage was My aid.

content: 6 I trampled peoples in My anger, I made them drunk with My rage, And I hurled their glory to the ground.”
content_old: 6 I trampled peoples in My anger, I made them drunk with My rage, And I hurled their glory to the ground.”

content: 7 I will recount the kind acts of the LORD, The praises of the LORD— For all that the LORD has wrought for us, The vast bounty to the House of Israel That He bestowed upon them According to His mercy and His great kindness.
content_old: 7 I will recount the kind acts of the LORD, The praises of the LORD— For all that the LORD has wrought for us, The vast bounty to the House of Israel That He bestowed upon them According to His mercy and His great kindness.

content: 8 He thought: Surely they are My people, Children who will not play false. So He was their Deliverer.
content_old: 8 He thought: Surely they are My people, Children who will not play false. So He was their Deliverer.

content: 9 In all their troubles He was troubled, And the angel of His Presence delivered them. In His love and pity He Himself redeemed them, Raised them, and exalted them All the days of old.
content_old: 9 In all their troubles He was troubled, And the angel of His Presence delivered them. In His love and pity He Himself redeemed them, Raised them, and exalted them All the days of old.

content: 10 But they rebelled, and grieved His holy spirit; Then He became their enemy, And Himself made war against them.
content_old: 10 But they rebelled, and grieved His holy spirit; Then He became their enemy, And Himself made war against them.

content: 11 Then they remembered the ancient days, Him, who pulled His people out “Where is He who brought them up from the Sea Along with the shepherd of His flock? Where is He who put In their midst His holy spirit,
content_old: 11 Then they remembered the ancient days, Him, who pulled His people out “Where is He who brought them up from the Sea Along with the shepherd of His flock? Where is He who put In their midst His holy spirit,

content: 12 Who made His glorious arm March at the right hand of Moses, Who divided the waters before them To make Himself a name for all time,
content_old: 12 Who made His glorious arm March at the right hand of Moses, Who divided the waters before them To make Himself a name for all time,

content: 13 Who led them through the deeps So that they did not stumble— As a horse in a desert,
content_old: 13 Who led them through the deeps So that they did not stumble— As a horse in a desert,

content: 14 Like a beast descending to the plain?” ‘Twas the spirit of the LORD gave them rest; Thus did You shepherd Your people To win for Yourself a glorious name.
content_old: 14 Like a beast descending to the plain?” ‘Twas the spirit of the LORD gave them rest; Thus did You shepherd Your people To win for Yourself a glorious name.

content: 15 Look down from heaven and see, From Your holy and glorious height! Where is Your zeal, Your power? Your yearning and Your love Are being withheld from us!
content_old: 15 Look down from heaven and see, From Your holy and glorious height! Where is Your zeal, Your power? Your yearning and Your love Are being withheld from us!

content: 16 Surely You are our Father: Though Abraham regard us not, And Israel recognize us not, You, O LORD, are our Father; From of old, Your name is “Our Redeemer.”
content_old: 16 Surely You are our Father: Though Abraham regard us not, And Israel recognize us not, You, O LORD, are our Father; From of old, Your name is “Our Redeemer.”

content: 17 Why, LORD, do You make us stray from Your ways, And turn our hearts away from revering You? Relent for the sake of Your servants, The tribes that are Your very own!
content_old: 17 Why, LORD, do You make us stray from Your ways, And turn our hearts away from revering You? Relent for the sake of Your servants, The tribes that are Your very own!

content: 18 Our foes have trampled Your Sanctuary, Which Your holy people possessed but a little while.
content_old: 18 Our foes have trampled Your Sanctuary, Which Your holy people possessed but a little while.

content: 1 As when fire kindles brushwood, And fire makes water boil— To make Your name known to Your adversaries So that nations will tremble at Your Presence,
content_old: 1 As when fire kindles brushwood, And fire makes water boil— To make Your name known to Your adversaries So that nations will tremble at Your Presence,

content: 2 When You did wonders we dared not hope for, You came down And mountains quaked before You.
content_old: 2 When You did wonders we dared not hope for, You came down And mountains quaked before You.

content: 3 Such things had never been heard or noted. No eye has seen them, O God, but You, Who act for those who trust in You.
content_old: 3 Such things had never been heard or noted. No eye has seen them, O God, but You, Who act for those who trust in You.

content: 4 Yet you have struck him who would gladly do justice, And remember You in Your ways. It is because You are angry that we have sinned; We have been steeped in them from of old, And can we be saved?
content_old: 4 Yet you have struck him who would gladly do justice, And remember You in Your ways. It is because You are angry that we have sinned; We have been steeped in them from of old, And can we be saved?

content: 5 We have all become like an unclean thing, And all our virtues like a filthy rag. We are all withering like leaves, And our iniquities, like a wind, carry us off.
content_old: 5 We have all become like an unclean thing, And all our virtues like a filthy rag. We are all withering like leaves, And our iniquities, like a wind, carry us off.

content: 6 Yet no one invokes Your name, Rouses himself to cling to You. For You have hidden Your face from us, And made us melt because of our iniquities.
content_old: 6 Yet no one invokes Your name, Rouses himself to cling to You. For You have hidden Your face from us, And made us melt because of our iniquities.

content: 7 But now, O LORD, You are our Father; We are the clay, and You are the Potter, We are all the work of Your hands.
content_old: 7 But now, O LORD, You are our Father; We are the clay, and You are the Potter, We are all the work of Your hands.

content: 8 Be not implacably angry, O LORD, Do not remember iniquity forever. Oh, look down to Your people, to us all!
content_old: 8 Be not implacably angry, O LORD, Do not remember iniquity forever. Oh, look down to Your people, to us all!

content: 9 Your holy cities have become a desert: Zion has become a desert, Jerusalem a desolation.
content_old: 9 Your holy cities have become a desert: Zion has become a desert, Jerusalem a desolation.

content: 10 Our holy Temple, our pride, Where our fathers praised You, Has been consumed by fire: And all that was dear to us is ruined.
content_old: 10 Our holy Temple, our pride, Where our fathers praised You, Has been consumed by fire: And all that was dear to us is ruined.

content: 1 I responded to those who did not ask, I was at hand to those who did not seek Me; I said, “Here I am, here I am,” To a nation that did not invoke My name.
content_old: 1 I responded to those who did not ask, I was at hand to those who did not seek Me; I said, “Here I am, here I am,” To a nation that did not invoke My name.

content: 2 I constantly spread out My hands To a disloyal people, Who walk the way that is not good, Following their own designs;
content_old: 2 I constantly spread out My hands To a disloyal people, Who walk the way that is not good, Following their own designs;

content: 3 The people who provoke My anger, Who continually, to My very face, Sacrifice in gardens and burn incense on tiles;
content_old: 3 The people who provoke My anger, Who continually, to My very face, Sacrifice in gardens and burn incense on tiles;

content: 4 Who sit inside tombs And pass the night in secret places; Who eat the flesh of swine, With broth of unclean things in their bowls;
content_old: 4 Who sit inside tombs And pass the night in secret places; Who eat the flesh of swine, With broth of unclean things in their bowls;

content: 5 Who say, “Keep your distance! Don’t come closer! For I would render you consecrated.” Such things make My anger rage, Like fire blazing all day long.
content_old: 5 Who say, “Keep your distance! Don’t come closer! For I would render you consecrated.” Such things make My anger rage, Like fire blazing all day long.

content: 6 See, this is recorded before Me; I will not stand idly by, but will repay, Deliver their sins into their bosom,
content_old: 6 See, this is recorded before Me; I will not stand idly by, but will repay, Deliver their sins into their bosom,

content: 7 And the sins of their fathers as well —said the LORD— For they made offerings upon the mountains And affronted Me upon the hills. I will count out their recompense in full, Into their bosoms.
content_old: 7 And the sins of their fathers as well —said the LORD— For they made offerings upon the mountains And affronted Me upon the hills. I will count out their recompense in full, Into their bosoms.

content: 8 Thus said the LORD: As, when new wine is present in the cluster, One says, “Don’t destroy it; there’s good in it,” So will I do for the sake of My servants, And not destroy everything.
content_old: 8 Thus said the LORD: As, when new wine is present in the cluster, One says, “Don’t destroy it; there’s good in it,” So will I do for the sake of My servants, And not destroy everything.

content: 9 I will bring forth offspring from Jacob, From Judah heirs to My mountains; My chosen ones shall take possession, My servants shall dwell thereon.
content_old: 9 I will bring forth offspring from Jacob, From Judah heirs to My mountains; My chosen ones shall take possession, My servants shall dwell thereon.

content: 10 Sharon shall become a pasture for flocks, And the Valley of Achor a place for cattle to lie down, For My people who seek Me.
content_old: 10 Sharon shall become a pasture for flocks, And the Valley of Achor a place for cattle to lie down, For My people who seek Me.

content: 11 But as for you who forsake the LORD, Who ignore My holy mountain, Who set a table for Luck And fill a mixing bowl for Destiny:
content_old: 11 But as for you who forsake the LORD, Who ignore My holy mountain, Who set a table for Luck And fill a mixing bowl for Destiny:

content: 12 I will destine you for the sword, You will all kneel down, to be slaughtered— Because, when I called, you did not answer, When I spoke, you would not listen. You did what I hold evil, And chose what I do not want.
content_old: 12 I will destine you for the sword, You will all kneel down, to be slaughtered— Because, when I called, you did not answer, When I spoke, you would not listen. You did what I hold evil, And chose what I do not want.

content: 13 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: My servants shall eat, and you shall hunger; My servants shall drink, and you shall thirst; My servants shall rejoice, and you shall be shamed;
content_old: 13 Assuredly, thus said the Lord GOD: My servants shall eat, and you shall hunger; My servants shall drink, and you shall thirst; My servants shall rejoice, and you shall be shamed;

content: 14 My servants shall shout in gladness, And you shall cry out in anguish, Howling in heartbreak.
content_old: 14 My servants shall shout in gladness, And you shall cry out in anguish, Howling in heartbreak.

content: 15 You shall leave behind a name By which My chosen ones shall curse: “So may the Lord GOD slay you!” But His servants shall be given a different name.
content_old: 15 You shall leave behind a name By which My chosen ones shall curse: “So may the Lord GOD slay you!” But His servants shall be given a different name.

content: 16 For whoever blesses himself in the land Shall bless himself by the true God; And whoever swears in the land Shall swear by the true God. The former troubles shall be forgotten, Shall be hidden from My eyes.
content_old: 16 For whoever blesses himself in the land Shall bless himself by the true God; And whoever swears in the land Shall swear by the true God. The former troubles shall be forgotten, Shall be hidden from My eyes.

content: 17 For behold! I am creating A new heaven and a new earth; The former things shall not be remembered, They shall never come to mind.
content_old: 17 For behold! I am creating A new heaven and a new earth; The former things shall not be remembered, They shall never come to mind.

content: 18 Be glad, then, and rejoice forever In what I am creating. For I shall create Jerusalem as a joy, And her people as a delight;
content_old: 18 Be glad, then, and rejoice forever In what I am creating. For I shall create Jerusalem as a joy, And her people as a delight;

content: 19 And I will rejoice in Jerusalem And delight in her people. Never again shall be heard there The sounds of weeping and wailing.
content_old: 19 And I will rejoice in Jerusalem And delight in her people. Never again shall be heard there The sounds of weeping and wailing.

content: 20 No more shall there be an infant or graybeard Who does not live out his days. He who dies at a hundred years Shall be reckoned a youth, And he who fails to reach a hundred Shall be reckoned accursed.
content_old: 20 No more shall there be an infant or graybeard Who does not live out his days. He who dies at a hundred years Shall be reckoned a youth, And he who fails to reach a hundred Shall be reckoned accursed.

content: 21 They shall build houses and dwell in them, They shall plant vineyards and enjoy their fruit.
content_old: 21 They shall build houses and dwell in them, They shall plant vineyards and enjoy their fruit.

content: 22 They shall not build for others to dwell in, Or plant for others to enjoy. For the days of My people shall be As long as the days of a tree, My chosen ones shall outlive The work of their hands.
content_old: 22 They shall not build for others to dwell in, Or plant for others to enjoy. For the days of My people shall be As long as the days of a tree, My chosen ones shall outlive The work of their hands.

content: 23 They shall not toil to no purpose; They shall not bear children for terror, But they shall be a people blessed by the LORD, And their offspring shall remain with them.
content_old: 23 They shall not toil to no purpose; They shall not bear children for terror, But they shall be a people blessed by the LORD, And their offspring shall remain with them.

content: 24 Before they pray, I will answer; While they are still speaking, I will respond.
content_old: 24 Before they pray, I will answer; While they are still speaking, I will respond.

content: 1 Thus said the LORD: The heaven is My throne And the earth is My footstool: Where could you build a house for Me, What place could serve as My abode?
content_old: 1 Thus said the LORD: The heaven is My throne And the earth is My footstool: Where could you build a house for Me, What place could serve as My abode?

content: 2 All this was made by My hand, And thus it all came into being —declares the LORD. Yet to such a one I look: To the poor and brokenhearted, Who is concerned about My word.
content_old: 2 All this was made by My hand, And thus it all came into being —declares the LORD. Yet to such a one I look: To the poor and brokenhearted, Who is concerned about My word.

content: 3 As for those who slaughter oxen and slay humans, Who sacrifice sheep and immolate dogs, Who present as oblation the blood of swine, Who offer incense and worship false gods— Just as they have chosen their ways And take pleasure in their abominations,
content_old: 3 As for those who slaughter oxen and slay humans, Who sacrifice sheep and immolate dogs, Who present as oblation the blood of swine, Who offer incense and worship false gods— Just as they have chosen their ways And take pleasure in their abominations,

content: 4 So will I choose to mock them, To bring on them the very thing they dread. For I called and none responded, I spoke and none paid heed. They did what I deem evil And chose what I do not want.
content_old: 4 So will I choose to mock them, To bring on them the very thing they dread. For I called and none responded, I spoke and none paid heed. They did what I deem evil And chose what I do not want.

content: 5 Hear the word of the LORD, You who are concerned about His word! Your kinsmen who hate you, Who spurn you because of Me, are saying, “Let the LORD manifest His Presence, So that we may look upon your joy.” But theirs shall be the shame.
content_old: 5 Hear the word of the LORD, You who are concerned about His word! Your kinsmen who hate you, Who spurn you because of Me, are saying, “Let the LORD manifest His Presence, So that we may look upon your joy.” But theirs shall be the shame.

content: 6 Hark, tumult from the city, Thunder from the Temple! It is the thunder of the LORD As He deals retribution to His foes.
content_old: 6 Hark, tumult from the city, Thunder from the Temple! It is the thunder of the LORD As He deals retribution to His foes.

content: 7 Before she labored, she was delivered; Before her pangs came, she bore a son.
content_old: 7 Before she labored, she was delivered; Before her pangs came, she bore a son.

content: 8 Who ever heard the like? Who ever witnessed such events? Can a land pass through travail In a single day? Or is a nation born All at once? Yet Zion travailed And at once bore her children!
content_old: 8 Who ever heard the like? Who ever witnessed such events? Can a land pass through travail In a single day? Or is a nation born All at once? Yet Zion travailed And at once bore her children!

content: 9 Shall I who bring on labor not bring about birth? —says the LORD. Shall I who cause birth shut the womb? —said your God.
content_old: 9 Shall I who bring on labor not bring about birth? —says the LORD. Shall I who cause birth shut the womb? —said your God.

content: 10 Rejoice with Jerusalem and be glad for her, All you who love her! Join in her jubilation, All you who mourned over her—
content_old: 10 Rejoice with Jerusalem and be glad for her, All you who love her! Join in her jubilation, All you who mourned over her—

content: 11 That you may suck from her breast Consolation to the full, That you may draw from her bosom Glory to your delight.
content_old: 11 That you may suck from her breast Consolation to the full, That you may draw from her bosom Glory to your delight.

content: 12 For thus said the LORD: I will extend to her Prosperity like a stream, The wealth of nations Like a wadi in flood; And you shall drink of it. You shall be carried on shoulders And dandled upon knees.
content_old: 12 For thus said the LORD: I will extend to her Prosperity like a stream, The wealth of nations Like a wadi in flood; And you shall drink of it. You shall be carried on shoulders And dandled upon knees.

content: 13 As a mother comforts her son So I will comfort you; You shall find comfort in Jerusalem.
content_old: 13 As a mother comforts her son So I will comfort you; You shall find comfort in Jerusalem.

content: 14 You shall see and your heart shall rejoice, Your limbs shall flourish like grass. The power of the LORD shall be revealed In behalf of His servants; But He shall rage against His foes.
content_old: 14 You shall see and your heart shall rejoice, Your limbs shall flourish like grass. The power of the LORD shall be revealed In behalf of His servants; But He shall rage against His foes.

content: 15 See, the LORD is coming with fire— His chariots are like a whirlwind— To vent His anger in fury, His rebuke in flaming fire.
content_old: 15 See, the LORD is coming with fire— His chariots are like a whirlwind— To vent His anger in fury, His rebuke in flaming fire.

content: 16 For with fire will the LORD contend, With His sword, against all flesh; And many shall be the slain of the LORD.
content_old: 16 For with fire will the LORD contend, With His sword, against all flesh; And many shall be the slain of the LORD.

content: 17 Those who sanctify and purify themselves to enter the groves, imitating one in the center, eating the flesh of the swine, the reptile, and the mouse, shall one and all come to an end—declares the LORD.
content_old: 17 Those who sanctify and purify themselves to enter the groves, imitating one in the center, eating the flesh of the swine, the reptile, and the mouse, shall one and all come to an end—declares the LORD.

content: 18 For I know their deeds and purposes. has come to gather all the nations and tongues; they shall come and behold My glory.
content_old: 18 For I know their deeds and purposes. has come to gather all the nations and tongues; they shall come and behold My glory.

content: 19 I will set a sign among them, and send from them survivors to the nations: to Tarshish, Pul, and Lud—that draw the bow—to Tubal, Javan, and the distant coasts, that have never heard My fame nor beheld My glory. They shall declare My glory among these nations.
content_old: 19 I will set a sign among them, and send from them survivors to the nations: to Tarshish, Pul, and Lud—that draw the bow—to Tubal, Javan, and the distant coasts, that have never heard My fame nor beheld My glory. They shall declare My glory among these nations.

content: 20 And out of all the nations, said the LORD, they shall bring all your brothers on horses, in chariots and drays, on mules and dromedaries, to Jerusalem My holy mountain as an offering to the LORD—just as the Israelites bring an offering in a pure vessel to the House of the LORD.
content_old: 20 And out of all the nations, said the LORD, they shall bring all your brothers on horses, in chariots and drays, on mules and dromedaries, to Jerusalem My holy mountain as an offering to the LORD—just as the Israelites bring an offering in a pure vessel to the House of the LORD.

content: 21 And from them likewise I will take some to be levitical priests, said the LORD.
content_old: 21 And from them likewise I will take some to be levitical priests, said the LORD.

content: 22 For as the new heaven and the new earth Which I will make Shall endure by My will —declares the LORD— So shall your seed and your name endure.
content_old: 22 For as the new heaven and the new earth Which I will make Shall endure by My will —declares the LORD— So shall your seed and your name endure.

content: 23 And new moon after new moon, And sabbath after sabbath, All flesh shall come to worship Me —said the LORD.
content_old: 23 And new moon after new moon, And sabbath after sabbath, All flesh shall come to worship Me —said the LORD.
